loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year old Elina owns a farm and grows bananas. She has been into banana farming for five years now. Aside from that, she also engages in buying and selling bananas, especially when her yield is low. She is married and has five grown children. She hails from the town of Carcar City, Cebu.

She has not enough funds to continue both of her sources of livelihood. She would like to improve the harvest and quality of bananas as well.

Elina joined CEVI to avail the loan and wants to purchase fertilizer and purchase more stock of bananas.

With these, she will be able to augment her earnings and settle her finances.

She is hoping that she will become successful in handling her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Rhea Mae

texts.en:
As a single parent of one child, Rhea Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of coconut wine business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Rhea Mae is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Rhea Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Нурулло 49 летный дехканин района Джоми. Он имеет земельный участок, где выращивает растение. Нурулло начал работать на земле с 25 летного возраста. Он хорошо знает свою работу. Нурулло каждый сезон сажает разных овощей. В этом году он посадил кукурузу и собирается, получит качественный и богатый урожай. Для получения качественный и богатый урожай надо обработать урожай с минеральными удобрениями. И он на часть земли решил, посадит картофель. Он спрашивает кредит для купли больше количество минеральных удобрений и семян картофель. Ему в работе помогает любимая жена. У Нурулло четверых детей. Дети взрослые и самостоятельные, они находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Нурулло любить свою семью и трудится ради них. Вы можете помочь ему финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en: Nurullo is a 49 year old farmer from Jomi.  He has a plot of land on which he raises crops.  Nurullo started working the land at the age of 25, and knows his profession well.  Every season Nurullo plants different vegetables.  This year he planted corn, and plans on having a large, quality harvest.  In order to have such a harvest, he needs to fertilize his crops.  On his plot of land, he has decided to plant potatoes.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount of fertilizer and potato seeds.  His beloved wife helps him in his work.  Nurullo has four children.  His children are grown and independent, and are working abroad in Russia.  Nurullo loves his family and works hard on their behalf.  You can help him in his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 36 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Rose Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Rose Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Rose Marie has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits, candies, pancit canton and other groceries.

In the future, Rose Marie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuis, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Grupo Paculam Group

texts.es:
Catarina es madre de familia de siete hijos de los cuales tiene las edades entre 12 y 28 años de edad, ella vive junto  a su esposo en una comunidad del caserío Paculam.
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto) para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y abastecer las necesidades de su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace seis años, su negocio se ubica en el mercado regional de su comunidad. Catarina con el afán de mejorar sus servicios hacia los clientes solicita un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías como: cortes de tintes que son los que tienen mucha demanda en su mercado. Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Catarina is a mother of seven children who are between the ages of 12 and 28. She lives with her husband in a community near the small town of Paculam.

Catarina (the first person on the left side of the photo), in order to improve her living conditions and to meet the needs of her family, buys and sells clothing typical to the area. She has been in this business for six years. Her business is located in the regional market in her community. Catarina, with the goal of improving service to her customers, is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, such as colorful fabrics, which are in demand in her market. Her hope in life is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing, such as colorful fabrics.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos es un hombre casado de 39 años de edad que trabaja diariamente en su negocio de agricultura persiguiendo un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, un sueño que ha perseguido toda la vida, quiere verse con su esposa y sus dos hijos en esa vivienda y está convencido que en un futuro lo lograra.
Luis Carlos hoy se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para preparar su cultivo para terreno y algo que lo tiene muy motivado es que tiene la oportunidad de ampliarse, ya que el dinero recibido lo invertirá en la compra de semillas, abonos, riegos y  parte del capital se usara en la adecuación del terreno.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos is a 39 year old married man. He works every day in his agricultural business, pursuing his dream of buying his own house. He is still pursing this dream today. He wants to see his wife and his two children in that house and he is convinced that in the future he will achieve this.

Today, Luis Carlos is asking for financial help to prepare his cropland. Something that is really motivating him is that he has the opportunity to expand, because the money received will be to buy seeds, fertilizer and irrigation materials, and part of the capital will be used to prepare the soil.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and irrigation materials.

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Erika, una mujer responsable, comprometida 	con su trabajo y familia, madre de 3 princesas de 11, 8 y 4 años de edad, ella alterna su trabajo de venta de alimentos con su oficio de madre y ama de casa, pues los alimentos los prepara desde su hogar, optó por trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Sus ganas de trabajar se la dan sus hijas, verlas cumplir su sueño, estudiando, siendo felices es lo más complaciente para ella, esto la motiva a querer crecer y ser una mejor empresaria.
Erika quiere solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercancía para elaborar alimentos por un valor de $500.000 y $1’000.000 lo usara en la remodelación de su cocina.
texts.en:
This is Erika, who is responsible and committed to her work and her family. She is the mother of three beautiful girls who are 11, 8, and 4 years old. She alternates between her work selling food with her role as a mother and homemaker. She prepares the foods in her home. She chose to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses. 

She uses her earnings from her work for her daughters, so she can see them fulfill their dreams by studying. To see them happy is the most wonderful thing to her. This motivates her to grow and be a better businesswoman.

Erika wants to request a loan, of which she will use COP 500,000 to buy products for making food and COP 1,000,000 for remodeling her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy products for making food (COP 500,000) and to remodel her kitchen (COP 1,000,000).

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Elena, es una mujer de 35 años de edad, una madre de cabeza de familia, tiene 3 pequeños, uno de 16, otro de 13 y la menor de 8 años de edad, ella se rebusca el sustento diario para su hogar, trabajando en casas de familia y trabajos temporales.
Mantener una familia es bastante difícil, ella se encuentra buscando alternativas para generar más recursos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Por ello hoy se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para Iniciar un negocio de cría de ganado porcino; el dinero será usado en la compra de materiales de construcción de una porqueriza, cerdos y alimento de engorde.
texts.en:
This is Luz Elena. She is 35 years old and a single mother. She has 3 children, one of whom is 16, another is 13, and the youngest is 8 years old. She is seeking a way to provide for her household, working as a domestic worker and in temporary jobs.

Providing for her family is quite difficult. She is looking for alternatives for generating more income so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

This is why today she finds herself requesting a loan to start a business of raising pigs. She will use the money to buy construction materials for pig pens, pigs, and feed.

loans.use: to start a business raising pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana toils the land and does farming; she grows and sells rice. She lives in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol together with her husband and three children. She is a very industrious woman and she is willing to sacrifice for the sake of her children.

For the past 10 years, she has sold rice to the locals and town settlers in her place. However, she has major problems in handling her farm. She lacks the capital to finance her existing livelihood.  In addition, the seasonality of the yield results in a very low income. As a result, Susana decided to access loans and boost her business. She wants to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and to pay for labor and food. With these, she would be able to improve her yield and start to expand her business.
 
She is determined that she will be able to provide her children with basic necessities including quality education and a better home.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and to pay for labor and food.

loans.name: Marleni Catarina

texts.es:
Marleni, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo pudo sacar su título de bachiller secretariado, ya que tenía que trabajar durante la semana y los fines de semana estudiaba, ella está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a laborar como barrendero en la ciudad, con él tiene 2 hijos.

Marleni, a pesar de que estudió no ha podido encontrar un trabajo fijo, es por eso que decidió dedicarse a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, este negocio lo tiene junto a su esposo desde hace 6 años de tenerlo, la agricultura igual es un trabajo familiar y todos colaboran.

Marleni, necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 pollos, para incrementar su negocio y comprar el concentrado para los pollos y para comprar abono para sus cultivos de maíz y frijol.

Marleni, sueña con tener una granja más grande y con mejores condiciones para sus aves y tenerla más tecnificada para que sus ganancias mejoren.
texts.en:
Marleni is 37 years old. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person. With a lot of hard work, she was able to get her high school secretary diploma, even though she had to work during the week and study on the weekends. She has a partner and he works in labor such as street sweeping in the city. She has 2 children with him.

Marleni, despite what she studied, has not been able to find a stable job. For this reason, she decided to work in agriculture and the raise and sell chickens. She and her husband have had this business for 6 years. Agriculture is also a family job that everyone contributes to.

Marleni needs a loan to buy 100 chickens in order to grow her business, and buy feed for the chickens, and to buy fertilizer for her corn and bean crops.

Marleni dreams of having a larger farm with better conditions for her chickens. She also wants modernize it so that her earnings can improve.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens in order to grow her business, and buy feed for the chickens, and to buy fertilizer for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Jesus Andres

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando un apoyo financiero para iniciar un negocio de sala de internet, su principal ventaja es que vive cerca de una escuela secundaria lo que le permite tener mucha oportunidad, el dinero será invertido en la compra de computadores, surtido de productos de papelería, una vitrina, sillas y un estante para snack.
Junto a Jesús esta su madre, esa mujer que lo inspira a ser un gran trabajador, a perseverar y cumplir un sueño, comprar una vivienda propia y dársela a la persona que más ama, ella.
texts.en:
Jesús is single and 27 years old. He is requesting a loan in order to start an internet café business. His main advantage is that he lives near a high school, which provides him a lot of opportunity. The money will be invested in the purchase of computers, stationary products, a vitrine, chairs, and a shelf for snacks.

Along with Jesús is his mother, who inspires him to be a great worker, to persevere, to achieve his dreams, to buy his own house, and to give it to the person he loves most, her.

loans.use: to buy computers, stationary products, a vitrine, chairs, and a shelf for snacks.

loans.name: Siege De La Sagesse A Group

texts.fr: Kadjuru est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Siege de la Sagesse A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 56 ans, mère de 11 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons dans un dépôt de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 60 caisses de sucrées et de 40 caisses de la bière Primus. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kadjuru is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Siege de la Sagesse A”. She is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. A married woman, she is 56 years old and the mother of eleven children provided with schooling. Kadjuru has been selling beverages at a warehouse in town for thirty years. She is going to stock up with 60 cases of soft drinks and 40 cases of Primus beer. She began her business with funds from her husband.

Her wish is to increase her capital and provide education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 60 cases of soft drinks and 40 cases of Primus beer.

loans.name: Philadelphie Group

texts.fr: Scolastique est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Philadelphie», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés au marché du centre-ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en trois ballons de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Scolastique is a merchant and a member of the solidarity group “Philadelphie”. She is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. A married woman, she is 38 years old and the mother of seven children provided with schooling. Scolastique has been selling secondhand shoes downtown for fifteen years. She is going to stock up with three bales of shoes. She began her business with funds from her husband.

Her wish is to purchase a plot of land and provide education and food for her children. So she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with three bales of shoes

loans.name: Lilia Amparo

texts.es:
Ella es Lilia, una persona calmada, serena, alegre que goza y agradece por las cosas buenas que le pasan cada día, es una mujer que no necesita de mucho para ser feliz.
Se dedica a la confección a terceros, actividad que realiza desde su hogar, sus ingresos ayudan a complementar el dinero para el mantenimiento del hogar, el cual comparte con su marido.
Lilia tiene una buena oportunidad de negocio, para ello necesita una máquina plana, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprarla por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprarla, iniciara con una máquina de segunda, pues la necesita urgente, debido a la mejora en tiempo de confección que está le ofrece además del tipo de telas que puede confeccionar, en pocas palabras se le abrieron las puertas de contrato con empresas y quiere aprovecharlos para generar más recursos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
This is Lilia, a person who is calm, serene, and happy, who enjoys life and is grateful for the good things that happen to her every day. She is a person who doesn’t need much to be happy.

She is a clothing manufacturing subcontractor, work that she does from her home. Her income helps to complement the money needed to provide for her household, which she shares with her husband.

Lilia has a very good business opportunity, but she needs a flat-bed sewing machine. She doesn’t have sufficient capital to buy it, which is why she is requesting a loan. She will start out with a used machine because she needs it urgently, due to the improvement in sewing time that it offers her and the variety of fabrics she can sew with it. In short, doors have opened for her for contracts with some businesses and she wants to take advantage of this fact to generate more income so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine to sew clothes for her own clothing line.

loans.name: Sitsopé

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 33 ans, Sitsopé est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant cinq enfants à charge, Sitsopé est une revendeuse des objets en plastique et des ustensiles de cuisines. Sitsopé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Sitsopé sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de bassines et des assiettes en vue de bien revendre et de satisfaire parfaitement aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Sitsopé is 33 years old, married, and living in Adidogomé. Having five children to support, she is a retailer of plasticware and kitchen utensils. She gets her supplies at the market twice a month and resells them by criss-crossing nearby neighborhoods. Sitsopé is requesting this loan to order dozens of tubs and plates with the aim of doing well in her sales and satisfying fully her customers’ expectations. Her aim is also to make a good profit for covering the day-to-day expenses and needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 7 dozen tubs and 10 dozen plates

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Faiza is in her late 30s, not married and she has one child who is at school. For seven years, she has supported her family with a business selling drinks (beers, sodas, water and juices). This is her only source of income for her family. She makes every effort to make sure her business grows and raises extra income. She works from 9:00am to 11:00pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

Sarafina Group is from Tujijenge, Tanzania, and this is the eighth credit to be apportioned among the three members of the Sarafina Group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Faiza is happy for the previous loans, all of which she has paid back successfully. She used the loans to invest in her grocery store by purchasing more varieties of drinks to increase sales. She is doing great and working hard. With the income she earned, Faiza paid school fees, household expenses and started building a house for her family. Her dream is to build her own house to live in with her child.

With this new loan request, Faiza will use it to buy beers, soda, juices, and water to sell in her grocery.

loans.use: to buy beers, soda, juices, and water for her grocery.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman and she has 3 children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area of town and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of bread, flour, salt and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier of household items to other retailers within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She plans to use the anticipated profits to open another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, flour, salt and other items.

loans.name: Sunariah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sunariah. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Sunariah has been an employee for three years and her husband has been a tailor for forty years. Sunariah has asked for a loan of $550 from KPP UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home and to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her current family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sunariah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is in her early 30s, is a divorcee, and has two children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for four years now. She works from 6:00am to 7:00pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month.
This will be Catherine's 9th loam from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her food stocks i.e kilos of rice, sugar, maize, cooking oil etc. She is doing great and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to repay a loan, to renovate her house, to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store. She dreams of being a big business woman someday.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her food store.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a single man. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes, jackets, and caps. He has been involved in this business for one year.  His business is located in a good area and most of his customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the loan of 26,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of shoes and jackets. His business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and jackets.

loans.name: Oyjon

texts.ru: Ойчон 56 летняя мать троих детей. Детям 28, 26 и 19 лет. Она уроженка района Вахш. Ее муж с двумя сыновьям занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Дочка учится в университете. Сама Ойчон работает уборщицей. Ей нравится своя работа. Она любить убирать и чистоту, по этой причине Ойчон работает уборщицей, и у нее нет высшая образования.  Ойчон не смотря ни на, что трудится. Она сейчас старается оплатить на обучения дочери. Ойчон не смогла копить денег для обучения, и решила взять кредит и оплатить на обучения. Она очень нуждается на помощь. Ваша помощь поможет ей дочери продвигать учебы.
texts.en: Oyjon is a 56-year-old mother of three. Her children are ages 28, 26, and 19. She is a native of the Vakhsh region. Her husband and two sons repair houses and her daughter in is university. Oyjon is a cleaning woman and likes her work. She loves to clean, which is why she works as a cleaner, because she does not have a higher education. Oyjon works no matter what. Now she is trying to pay for her daughter's education. She was not able to save money for the tuition and decided to take out a loan. She really needs help. Your assistance will help her daughter continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's annual tuition

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали спокойный и энергичный житель района Вахш. Ему 56 лет. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Сыновьям 31, 27 и 22 года. Дочке 19 лет. Старший сын водитель грузового автомобиля, он перевозить грузов. Младший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Третий сын студент, он учится в университете.  Дочка домохозяйка, она помогает маме в работе. Жена Курбонали дома предоставляет услуги портнихи. Сам Курбонали работает директором спортивной детской школы района Вахш.  Курбонали запрашивает кредит для оплаты на обучения третьего сына. С заработной платы Курбонали не смог копить денег, еще ему надо кормить семью. По этой причине Курбонали просит кредит. Он надеется на Вас. Заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Kurbonali is a calm, energetic resident of the Vakhsh region. He is 56 years old, married, and a father of four. His sons are 31, 27, and 22, and his daughter is 19. His eldest son is a truck driver who transports cargo, his youngest son works in Russia, and his third son is a student at university. His daughter is a homemaker and helps her mother with her work. Kurbonali's wife is a seamstress, while he himself is the director of a sports school in the Vakhsh region. Kurbonali is requesting a loan to pay for his son's tuition. Kurbonali couldn't save any money from his wages because he has to feed his family, so he applied for a loan. He is relying on you and expresses his gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is 44 years old and has four children. She resides in Kapsowar, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 10 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Salina has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Salina will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family.

Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband
Salina dreams of seeing her business last in time, as well as having the opportunity of improving the conditions of her house. Help Salina to achieve all her goals; a loan will get him a lot closer.

loans.use: To pay for cereals

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris at 32 years old works as a smallholder farmer. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nyamira, in the Nyanza region of Kenya. For the past 5 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Damaris has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said.

She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Damaris is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Damaris is going to achieve her dream and goals. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Damaris will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her family of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for speedy delivery of her farm produce to market.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a wife, mother, and farmer with 10 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Siongiroi, Kenya with her seven children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Loice completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. Although this humble and ever-smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm.

She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Loice has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity.

This loan will be a turning point in Loice’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children. Her desires to move forward are admirable and what she proposes, she achieves. Loice is working with a purpose and that purpose is to improve the conditions of her home. She knows that she'll achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
For the past five years, Mercy has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been planting different varieties of crops and has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Mercy passionately loves dairy farming. She is requesting a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing the milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it is a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This milk production will immediately translate to increased profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan.

Mercy is very visionary, and she intends to start adding value to her milk business. You can be part of the story of this woman's life. Help her with a loan and watch her success.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She is a mother of two from Kapsowar, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya.
She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. Of all the activities she involves herself in, maize farming is closest to her heart.

Penina wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Penina will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors.

This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Penina is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.
Penina awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
With three children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Mercy, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in.

Mercy is seeking a loan worth 100,000 KES from the wonderful Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business and also buy a chaff cutter. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily-rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Mercy access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. Through the loan she will be able to buy a chaff cutter which is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces before being mixed with other forages so that the cow never refuses any part of the food. With your loan, Mercy’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business and also buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a hardworking, dedicated and honest 36-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family, with a husband and three children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Chuka, in the central region of Kenya. For the past five years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling.

Jackline passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy unit will assist Jackline in managing her cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions.

Before Jackline joined Juhudi Kilimo, she considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Jackline now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way to go. With the loan, Jackline will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows.

An increase in income will allow Jackline to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Beatrice, who, with her partner, has become a very good smallholder farmer. She is happily married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last 14 years and has gained so much experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 5 children, she has been selling milk, bananas and a varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Nyamira area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that what she like best is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.
As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Sindia

texts.en:
Sindia is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Sindia’s primary source of income is milk. Sindia has managed to take care of her family with her income from milk selling.

The Chuka area has conditions that favor dairy goat farming. Sindia has always wanted to take care of another dairy goat but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy goat. The dairy goat she intends to buy is not just an ordinary goat. It’s a breed that produces between 1-2 liters of milk a day. With this goat, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for goat milk in the Chuka area is high but the supply is low. Her increased income will allow Sindia to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy goats so that she can improve her living conditions. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy goat.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 43, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. , She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and crops. Margaret is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereal. Kenya's Kapsowar area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Margaret could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Margaret believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereal. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Margaret to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 38,has been practicing mixed farming for the last thirteen years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her 6 children, she has been selling eggs, tea, milk and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Nyamira area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Vamos En Victoria Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL VAMOS EN VICTORIA ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON DIES HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERCION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, LAMENTABLMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES NORMA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, JUGOS, GALLETAS, TISTE, GASEOSAS, MENEITOS ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE LOS CLIENTES Y OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL VAMOS EN VICTORIA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The "Vamos en Victoria" communal bank has eight members, all single mothers with a combined total of ten children. The members are from Sauce, in the north of the region. The women are hard-working, responsible and want to do better in life. In their spare time, they like to enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately, owing to a lack of money, the women could not study and needed to work in order to help pay household costs.

Thanks to her desire to move forward, Norma is the coordinator of the group. She earns a living running a small grocery store where she sells perishables such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, biscuits, fizzy drinks, cheese puffs and more. Norma works some 12 hours per day, selling her products to satisfy customer demand and earn an income.

The "Vamos en Victoria" communal bank is grateful for the help Kiva lenders`provide to poor countries such as Nicragagua, and to those with little money who can now find a decent job.

loans.use: to buy and sell perishables such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, biscuits, fizzy drinks, cheese puffs and more.

loans.name: G.s. Las Estrellas (Nagarote) Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. LAS ESTRELLAS DE NAGAROTE ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRES INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON SEIS HIJOS TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, TODAS TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICAS, LAS CUALES LUCHAN PARA HACER PROPERAR SUS NEGOCIOS, BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS, CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO FORMAS A SUS HIJOS EN PROFESIONALES, Y TENER UN TECHO DIGNO DONDE VIVIIR, DEDES MUY JOVENES DECIDIERON ESTUDIAR Y AYUDAR A SUS FAMILIAS CON LOS INGRESOS DEL HOGAR

GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES FATIMA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA, COMO: PANTALONES, FALDAS, VESTIDOS, CAMISETAS, SHORES, ROPA DE NIÑO, ROPA DE CAMA ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS OCHO HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU MERCADERIA PARA BRINDARLES MEJORES SERVICIOS A SUS CLIENTES Y EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. G.S. LAS ESTRELLAS AGRADECEN LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONITAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Nagarote" group has three members, all single mothers with a combined total of six children all under the age of 18 years. The members area hard-working and want to do better in life. They all have different trades and each member is working hard to make their business prosper and to give their children better opportunities. The members want to achieve their goals and dreams, such as seeing their children learn a profession, and having a decent home to live in. From a very young age, the members decided to study and help their families by providing an income.

Thanks to her desire to move forward, Fatima is the coordinator of the group. She earns a living selling new clothing, such as trousers, skirts, dresses, shirts, shorts, children's clothing, bed clothes and more. Fatima works some eight hours per day selling her products. This loan will be used to invest in working capital, to stock up on merchandise to offer her customers better service and earn a higher income.

The "Estrellas de Nagarote" communal bank is grateful for the help Kiva lenders`provide to poor countries such as Nicragagua, and to those with little money who can now find a decent job.

loans.use: to buy and sell new clothing, such as trousers, skirts, dresses, shirts, shorts, children's clothing, bed clothes and more.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer from Kathegeri, a remote village in Chuka, Kenya, who believes that agriculture is not just for the older generation. She is a loving mother who has farmed for five years. Elizabeth grows crops and raises cattle and goats. She enjoys farming. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances and fighting diseases. Elizabeth is kindly seeking a loan to buy a quality breed of dairy goat. She will sell goat milk and goat meat, which is very expensive and earns more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family.
The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the dairy goat milk business. Elizabeth wants to set up an example for her children by being the most successful dairy goat farmer in her village because she finds farming very rewarding.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has been a farmer for five years and knows what it takes to succeed. He is happily married and has been blessed with 4 children. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. Most of the small-holder farmers in his village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living by selling milk and eggs. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family.

Anthony has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. Because of increased demand, Anthony requests a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Anthony is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Anthony is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. He plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream. Anthony will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 54-year-old farmer from Litein in the Rift valley region of Kenya. He has been blessed with a lovely family and has been doing mixed-farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs. Milking to him is a hobby by itself. However, he has not been milking since his cow was pregnant. The cow delivered, but he is still sparing the milk for the calf. This whole situation has had an effect on his livelihood. His own family has not been getting much milk, and also his income has been cut.

Richard is seeking a loan to purchase a highly productive dairy cow. The cow will produce more milk than that which an average cow can produce in a day. Having an additional cow will also cushion him against losses associated with such scenarios in the future. When he was asked how his family will benefit if he was granted this loan, he said, "The loan will increase the number of my dairy animals. I will use the returns to build a dairy unit that will boost my milk production. The extra income as a result of this loan will help me take better care of my family needs."
Richard just needs a little help that he can get from you; a loan may change his life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a father of four from Litein, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He has spent the past 7 years of his life farming. He sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on his farm. Of all the activities in which he is involved, poultry farming is closest to his heart. Johana wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. He would like to expand his poultry business, but the biggest challenge he faces is lack of capital.

He is requesting a loan of KES 10,000, which he will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Johana will be able to expand the poultry section on his farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and he will also be able to save extra money. Johana is very concerned about his children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Johana dreams of a secure future for his children. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 52 years old and a hard-worker. Damaris is creative and knows how to make the most of opportunities. She lives in Motobo, a remote village in Nyamira area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with 2 children.

Damaris has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, Damaris has been selling milk and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, Damaris has been engaging in another small personal business(posho mill).

The Nyamira area is very populated so demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. Damaris stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming so she is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy poultry. Damaris feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry.

The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in a humble home in the town of Nandihills, along with her husband and their five children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity.

Lydia is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Lydia and her family.
Lenders! Support this woman who wants to offer her children an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her 5 children. She is a youthful 50-year-old go-getter. She hails from Waitaluk, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, but Sabina has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past thirty years. Her primary sources of income are her crops and animal farming. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Although she makes profits through selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also help prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. Sabina believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she will use to spend on treating her cows because she currently lacks a good dairy unit. Sabina’s greatest dream is to improve the conditions in her home and offer her children a good future.
Sabina patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a small dairy, crop and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She has a lovely family and has been doing crop farming for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her goats. She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand.

Doris is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. She will rely on other sources of income to make initial installments of the loan but in no time, the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. Her increased income will uplift the living standards of her family.
Doris is sure that with the help of Juhudi Kilimo, and the Kiva lenders, her dreams will be realized. Be inspired and loan today!

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya, has now been practicing mixed farming for the past three years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet it.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This extra production will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used to repay the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Jane is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it, and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future.
The various factors that have led to failure in previous situations have not prevented Jane from wanting to succeed and fulfill her goals. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, a 23-year-old, very hardworking, honest, and ever smiling mother of two children. She lives with her husband in the lush hills of Litein, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Sharon passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past eight years and has always managed to provide for her family. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family.

Sharon has identified a free space in her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk price in the recent past has been going up, so Sharon, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learns that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms. She underwent training and from the training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Sharon hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her two school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 51-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Nandihills area of Kenya, and is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life. Esther was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Nandihills is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Esther, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her milk-selling business. Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a wife, mother, and farmer with 10 years of experience in mixed farming. She lives in Kerugoya, Kenya with her two children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Her family is her most important thing in her life, and the main reason to wake up every morning and work really hard. Faith completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors.

Although this humble and ever-smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Faith has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein.

She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Faith’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children. With your contribution, this mother will invest in a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline who is a 31-year-old smallholder farmer from Kitale in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Caroline owns a one-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The mother of four keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has seven years of experience in farming. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya.

Through a group of 10 members called Bwake, Caroline has access to income-generating asset loans, which use the group-based savings as collateral. Horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Caroline because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry.
Her greatest wish is to pay for her children's education, as their well-being is her main concern. She knows that with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva collaborators her dreams can come true.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Diego Hernan

texts.es:
Con un firme propósito de comprar una casa propia el señor Diego inicio un negocio como independiente de cría de ganado bovino, actividad que está en sus venas, pues viene de una familia agricultora y ganadera.
Diego es padre de dos hermosas princesas de 2 y 5 años de edad, como buen padre preocupado y sobreprotector quiere lo mejor para ellas, trabaja diariamente para forjar un camino y asegurar un futuro para sus dos amores, espera que estudien y se conviertan en las primeras universitarias de la familia.
Para apoyar a su familia, seguir persiguiendo su sueño, mejorar en todos los aspecto de su trabajo, el señor Diego quiere solicitar un préstamo que usara en la compra de una vaca en periodo de gestación, vacunas y alimento.
Este préstamo le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche diaria y de alguna manera contrarrestar los efectos negativos que tiene el bajo precio de venta de leche.
texts.en:
With the strong intention of buying his own house, Sr. Diego is starting an independent business raising cattle, a job that runs in his veins as he comes from a farming and cattle-raising family. Diego has two beautiful daughters aged 2 and 5, his 'princesses'. As a good father should be, he is concerned and overprotective, and he wants to do the best for them. He works hard every day to make a route through life for them and ensure that his two beloved children have a good future. He hopes that they will study hard and become the first to attend university in his family.

To help his family, Diego wishes to pursue his dream and improve all aspects of his business. He is seeking a loan to buy a pregnant cow, vaccines, and feed. The loan will allow him to increase daily milk production and to some extent offset the negative effects of the current low price of milk.

loans.use: buy a pregnant cow, vaccines, and feed

loans.name: Kwamboka

texts.en:
Kwamboka 55, is a mother of six lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Kwamboka never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Kwamboka started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Kwamboka practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

She is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Kwamboka wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Kwamboka hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Kwamboka's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. She will employ people to work for him on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Walter Oswaldo

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 37 años de edad, residente del municipio de RIonegro, una persona muy organiza y centrada en sus objetivos. Inicio en el año 2011 un sueño como independiente, monto un puesto de venta de alimentos y conforme pasaba el tiempo y obtenía buenos resultados inyectaba capital a su negocio, compro mesas de billar, amplió el negocio, compro televisor para disfrutar eventos deportivos.
A parte de ser un tendero, es padre de familia, tiene tres varones de 4, 7 y 13 años de edad, siendo su principal objetivo crecer y mejorar sus ingresos para pagar una buena educación para ellos, también busca mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda pero por ahora está muy enfocado en hacer crecer y posicionar su tienda.
Walter quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido principalmente cervezas y licores.
texts.en:
Walter is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of Rionegro. He is very organised and focused on his goals.

In 2011, Walter started to live out his dream of being an independent trader. He opened a small stall selling food and, as time passed on, he had good results and injected more capital into his business. He therefore expanded the business, bought billiards tables, and bought a television to show sporting events.

Aside from tending the shop, Walter is a father to three boys, ages thirteen, seven and four years old. Wlater's main objective is to expand his business and increase his income in order to give his children a good education. He is also looking to improve his living conditions but, for the moment, he is focusing on expanding his business and establishing it on the market.

Walter is applying for a loan in order to stock up mainly with beers and liquors.

loans.use: to stock up mainly with beers and liquors.

loans.name: Maria Anatolia

texts.es:
María, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, es madre de 3 hijas, una de 15 años de edad que vive lejos de casa, otra de 12 años de edad que está estudiando quinto grado y la última de 6 años de edad que estudia parvularía.

María, trabaja en una finca y se dedica a abonar el cultivo de café y en época de cortar también desempeña este trabajo; la finca está un poco lejos de su casa pero les brindan transporte, su esposo también aporta al hogar, porque tiene un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas, el cual le genera ingresos para su familia.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para estructuras metálicas para el taller de su esposo.

El sueño de María, es continuar con el negocio y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para toda su familia; además desea que sus hijas sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She is marred. She has three children: one is 15 years old and lives away from home; the second is 12 years old and is in fifth grade; the youngest is six years old and at nursery school.

María works on a farm where she fertilises coffee crops. She also helps with the cutting at certain times. The farm is a little far from María's house but her employer provides transportation. María's husband also brings home an income: he has a workshop where he builds metal structures. This business provides an income for the family.

María needs this loan in order to buy material for building metal structures for her husband's workshop.

María's dream is to continue with her business and thus have her family enjoy a higher quality of life. María also wants her children to continue in education and to learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy material for building metal structures for her husband's workshop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married mother of six children. She keeps cattle and poultry for milk, eggs, and meat respectively. On her five-acre piece of land, you will also find a granary, cereals, and over 50 trees.

To make better income, Irene engages in cereal brokering, which involves arranging the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the ten years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because in this business, success depends on reputation.

Since she can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, Irene prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to build her inventory by aggregating more produce from local farmers at competitive prices. She will use her understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell later at a profit.

Your loan will help local farmers selling to Irene to focus on production, rather than sales. Irene’s family also stands to benefit greatly from the improved income and elevated livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a brilliant 39 year old farmer from Nandihills, Kenya, with a fierce entrepreneurial spirit. She practises diversified farming. Her main source of income is milk,crop farming and a side business(shop). Besides being a wife and a mother, she is also a long-time loyal client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization dedicated to elevating the quality of life for rural smallholder farmers. Julia has a a great credit history with the company.

Julia is seeking a KES 20,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders into her business. With your money, Julia will buy a grain milling machine and set up shop where locals of Kabiwer village, where she lives, can have their cereal produce processed into flour. Flour is a key ingredient to most staple foods in Kenya such as Ugali and Chapati.

Your investment will not only have a big financial and social impact on Julia's family, but it will also make grain milling easier and more convenient than ever for occupants of Kabiwer village.

loans.use: to buy a grain mill

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a mother of one from Nandihills, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past 7 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart.

Nancy wants to diversify and start a cereal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals for resale. The Nandihills area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Nancy will be able to sell cereals to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Nancy is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from cereal selling will go to pay their school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her children.

Nancy awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Bridgid

texts.en:
Bridgid has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Kwanza in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Bridgid is happily married and the proud mother of seven children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available.


Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Bridgid to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Elima

texts.en:
Elima is the proud mother of one lovely child whom she loves, adores, and protects. Elima’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming eight years ago. Through farming and a small side business (shop) she has been able to earn a decent income. Elima is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her child will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Elima is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming. Through the income from horticulture farming, Elima will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Sandra Liliana

texts.es:
Sandra es una madre cabeza de familia, una mujer guerrera y luchadora que ha sabido sacar a delante a su familia y en especial a su hija de 11 años de edad, una mujer que hoy pide tu apoyo, tu ayuda para hacer de su negocio de papelería, venta de productos como peluches, vitrales, artículos románticos en general, ella quiere tener el almacén más completo y con surtido variado de la zona, quiere que su negocio sea reconocido y muy frecuentado, pero para ello necesita capital, por ello quiere acudir a un apoyo financiero para poner en marcha su plan.
El dinero será destinado en la compra de surtido en general, estanterías, vitrinas y una reforma visual a su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is the head of her household. She is a hardworking woman who struggles every day to help her family get ahead, in particular her 11-year old daughter.

Today Sandra is asking for your help with her stationery business where she also sells such items as stuffed toys, stained glass items, and other sentimental articles. She wishes to increase stock especially with local items so that her store becomes more well-known and visited. For this she needs capital so is seeking financial assistance to put her plan into action. The money will be used to buy stock in general, shelving, display cabinets, and give a new look to her business.

loans.use: buy stock in general, shelving, display cabinets, and give a new look to her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from Kibagenge village who is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming. Her work brings home an important source of income. She gets help with the work from her family members.

Eunice is seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. Through your loan investment in her business, Eunice will use the money to buy important supplies such as herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve the harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters.

Eunice is optimistic that this year's harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and make a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Speaking with the ever-smilling Milka, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their seven angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

Milka has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity.

Milka is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm.

Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Milka and her family.

Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the area of Nyamira. She was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Because of how much she likes farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family.

Norah also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Norah is very visionary and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Norah believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Norah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Dior's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de six femmes a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Dior est la responsable elle est mariée et âgée de 70 ans et mère de quinze enfants tous majeures. Elle s'active depuis bientôt 30 ans dans la transformation de poissons frais et leur commercialisation.
Avec son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille francs cfa elle se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va transformer en poissons fumés ou séchés puis les revendre au détails au niveau du marché de pèche de sa localité.
Les bénéfices réalisés  par son activité lui permettent de prendre en  charge les besoins alimentaires de ses enfants et de renforcer son capital économique.
texts.en: This group made up of six women was created from the first round of banc villageois and is united by good social and professional relationships.
