Madame Dior is the head, she is married, 70 years-old and mother of fifteen children, all of whom are adults. She has been involved in the processing and sales of fresh fish for almost 30 years. With her new loan of five hundred thousand francs she [will] buy herself baskets of fresh fish that she will make into smoked or dried fish then re-sell them in retail sales at the level of her village's fish market. The profits made by her business allow her to take care of her children's nutritional needs and to increase her economic capital.

loans.use: to buy baskets of fresh fish intended for processing and sales.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Esther, who is a tenacious, determined, and very resourceful woman who hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is a proud mother and has been doing mixed farming for the past four years. Her primary sources of income are milk vending, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet.

Esther loves farming. She really takes good care of her dairy cows. She wakes up every morning to milk her cows, and she has even nicknamed them. While this humble mom has been making a profit by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand for her products. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk.

Esther is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce 10 to 20 liters of nutritious milk each day and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions. You can help Esther to accomplish all of her dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow to increase her milk vending business.

loans.name: Jose Niguer

texts.es:
José Niguer con 20 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijo, en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. José Niguer cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

José Niguer se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea, variedad Catimor; plantación tiene 4 años de edad, está en primer y segundo año de producción. José Niguer cuenta con una amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que anteriormente sus padres cultivaban café variedad nacional siendo de este su principal sustento de ingreso con los que han sido criados;ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad Catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). Siendo estos para su consumo. El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando campaña agrícola 2016 con una mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José Niguer es socio recurrente en nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con aval.
texts.en:
José Niguer is 20 years old and in a civil partnership. He lives with his partner and son in his own home made from rustic materials in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Perú. José Niguer has very good references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The residents of this town mostly work in agriculture, trade and cattle farming.
José Niguer grows the Catimor variety of coffee and has 1 hectare so far. His plantation is 4 years old, and is in its first and second year of production. José Niguer has ample experience in the trade as previously his parents grew coffee (national variety) and it was their main source of income. Now due to disease and plague the plantation has been renewed with the Catimor variety which is much more resistant to disease.
He also breeds small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, etc.) and grows cereal products (agave, banana, taro, etc.) for his own consumption.
The loan would be for the maintenance of his 1 hectare of coffee production, assuring that the 2016 farming season gives a better yield. This would be reflected in a larger number of sales and therefore higher income to be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.
José Niguer is a recurring member of our financial insitution - Edpyme Alternativa. Invest with confidence.

loans.use: with the maintenance of his 1 hectare of coffee production, assuring that the 2016 farming season gives a better yield.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Maurine, a 24-year-old farmer from the remote village of Kaplong, situated in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is no clean water nor electrical connections. Maurine lives with her lovely family on a small piece of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops.

For 7 years, Maurine's primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and produce. Her biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Maurine made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Maurine recently applied for a loan for expanding her farm in order to expand her operations and increase her overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to Maurine's siblings' education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Esther’s siblings will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her farm.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Tecla resides in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, which is a remote region with harsh living conditions because of its bad terrain. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family.

Tecla’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Tecla has managed to take care of her family with her income from selling milk. The Nandi Hills area has conditions that favor dairy farming.

Tecla has always wanted to take care of another dairy cow, but a lack of capital has prevented her from doing so. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow she intends to buy is not just an ordinary cow. It’s a breed that produces between 10-15 liters of milk a day. With this cow, she will produce more milk, which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Nandi Hills area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Tecla is going to have more milk and could comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Tecla to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy cows so that she will be able to build a biogas digester, which would help her to save more energy. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and increase her milk vending business

loans.name: Assa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de six femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économique.Il a été  crée depuis le 01/12/2008. Madame Ndèye Sokhna est la responsable elle est mariée et mère deux filles toutes majeures.
Elle s'active dans le commerce  de produits alimentaire tels que l'huile de palme et la patte d’arachide.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 300 000 francs CFA elle se payer des bidons d'huile et des seaux de patte d'arachide qu'elle va revendre au détails  au niveau des différents marchés de la ville. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six women who come from the same area and are united through good social and business ties. The group was established 1 December 2008.

Ndèye Sokhna is the leader [of this group]. She is married and the mother of two daughters, who are both adults now. She works selling food products, especially palm oil and groundnut paste.

With this new loan of 300,000 francs CFA Ndèye Sokhna will buy drums of oil and buckets of groundnut paste, which she will resell at retail at different city markets.

She does well with this work, because she has been doing it for a long time.

Earnings will allow her to take care of her family's food needs and to increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy drums of palm oil and groundnut paste.

loans.name: Angilibina

texts.en:
Angilibina, 56 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Muembeni, a remote village in Chuka. She is happily married and is blessed with four children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Chuka area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Angilibina feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas desde hace varios años, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, la clienta esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas materiales como: telas, hilos, agujas, entre otras cosas ya que le va muy bien en su trabajo y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
42 year old Maribel lives in her own home with her husband and son. She owns a sewing workshop at her home where she has made different types of garment for several years. Her work is what has enabled her to get ahead.
She is asking for a loan again to buy more materials such as cloth, threads, needles, etc., as she is getting on very well with her work and will be able to achieve better financial revenue.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as cloth, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Susan resides in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is a remote region with harsh living conditions because of its bad terrain. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family.

Susan’s primary sources of income are milk, wool, mutton, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. She has managed to take care of her family with her income from mutton and wool selling. The region has conditions that favor sheep farming. Susan has always wanted to take care of another sheep, but the lack of capital has prevented her from doing so. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional sheep. The sheep she intends to buy is not just an ordinary sheep. It’s a breed that produces more wool. With this sheep, she will produce more wool, which will translate to more income. Demand for wool and mutton in the Kapsowar area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Susan is going to have more wool and could comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Susan to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more sheep. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Berlys Lucia

texts.es:
Berlys es una mujer grandiosa, responsable, activa, emprendedora y amorosa, a sus 45 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos y actualmente separada de su pareja, lo que la convierte en cabeza de familia, tiene 3 hijas de 17, 14 y 15 años de edad y el menor de 8 años.
Trabaja como independiente, realizando alimentos que ella misma sale a vender en una carreta, es realmente admirable el empeño y ganas que pone por salir adelante y salir sin pena diariamente gritando por las calles para vender sus comidas.
El principal objetivo de esta mujer es pagar la educación de sus hijas, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de nuevas ollas, insumos principalmente leña y maíz y restaurar la carretilla donde transporta los alimentos que está en muy malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Berly is an impressive, responsible, active, enterprising and loving woman, who at 45 years old is mother to 4 children and is now separated from her partner meaning she has become the head of the family. She has 3 daughters aged 17, 14 and 15 and an 8 year old son.
She works on her own, making food which she takes out to sell in a cart. Her determination and enthusiasm to get ahead are really admirable and she goes out every day without complaint to shout in the streets and sell her food.
This woman's main aim is to pay for the education of her daughters, so she is asking for a loan to buy new pans and supplies (mainly firewood and corn) and repair the wheelbarrow which she uses to transport her food, which is in very bad condition.

loans.use: to buy new pans and supplies (mainly firewood and corn) and repair the wheelbarrow which she uses to transport her food.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis décembre 2010 est composé de trois femmes issues du même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame  Oumy est la responsable elle est âgée de 45 ans mariée et mère de dix enfants  dont 2 filles et huit garçons tous scolarisés.
Elle debout à gauche de la photo , elle s'active dans la commercialisation de friperie. 
Avec son nouveau crédit de deux cent cinquante elle va se payer des balles de friperie qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du marché central de la ville.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre les besoins alimentaires de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau de son compte de banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was established in December 2010 and is composed of three women who come from the same area. They share good social and professional ties.

Oumy is the leader [of the group]. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children, of whom two are girls and eight are boys. All of the children are in school.

Oumy, who is standing on the left in the photo, works selling used clothing. With this new loan of 250 [thousand francs CFA], she is going to buy bales of used clothing, which she will resell at retail in the central town market.

Earnings will allow her to take care of her family's food needs and to increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es:
Mario se siente feliz y agradecido por el crecimiento que ha tenido  su negocio, el aumento en ventas, aumento de clientes, los buenos comentarios, la mejora de calidad de vida,  pero a la vez se siente preocupado porque no tiene suficiente abasto para los clientes que tiene actualmente.
Por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de licores, mesas y sillas, este préstamo apoyara el crecimiento que  ha tenido, mejorando sus ventas para alcanzar su meta de para la educación de sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Mario is very happy and grateful about how much his business has grown. Sales have increased; clients have increased; the positive comments have increased; his quality of life has increased. However, he is also worried because he doesn't have enough supplies for the clientele he currently has.

Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy liquor, tables and chairs to support the growth his business has had up till now, increase sales and achieve his goal of providing an education to his three children.

loans.use: buy liquor, tables and chairs to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 41-year-old farmer from a remote village in Kiangondu in the Chuka area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 5 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Dorcas passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Dorcas is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Dorcas will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Dorcas will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Ascar

texts.en:
Ascar is a married mother of two lovely children. To help her husband provide for the family, Ascar ventured into farming 15 years ago. Currently, she keeps cows and poultry on her farm for milk, meat, and eggs. She also makes extra money arranging the logistics of getting cereal produce from local farmers to their buyers. She understands that for this business to be successful, she needs to rely on two things: relationships and capital. She has been able to build strong relationships in the 15 years she has been farming, but what she seems to be lacking is capital to secure cereal inventory.

Ascar is seeking a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cereals. She plans to use the money to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. The impact of your loan will be twofold: smallholder farmers selling to Ascar will be relieved the burden of selling, which will help them to focus more on production, while Ascar’s family stands to benefit greatly from the improved income, which will go a long way toward elevating their livelihood and improving their living conditions.

Ascar dreams of having a successful and recognized business with a lot of customers that will allow her to give to her family the best quality of life possible. You can be part of Ascar’s story by making a loan and getting her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Mauricio Rafael

texts.es:
Mauricio es una personal luchadora, trabajadora, el cual vive en el municipio de Sincelejo, una zona muy afectada por la pobreza, donde las oportunidades de empleo escasean, por tal motivo, optó por montar un negocio de cría de animales, principalmente cerdos y aves, dado que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia conformada por sus 2 hijas.
A pesar de las dificultades económicas que ha tenido, ha llevado el alimento diario para sus amadas hijas, y seguirá haciéndolo porque es un padre responsable que tiene la ilusión de salir de la pobreza.
Mauricio quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y aves y materiales para reparar una porqueriza.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a tenacious, hard-working individual who lives in the town of Sincelejo, an area which is very affected by poverty and where job opportunities are scarce. For that reason, he opted to put together an animal breeding business (mainly pigs and birds), as he has the responsibility of looking after his family, consisting of two daughters.
In spite of the financial difficulties he has had, he has brought home food every day for his beloved daughters, and will continue to do so because he is a responsible father who is hopeful of rising out of poverty.
Mauricio wants to ask for a loan to buy pigs and birds, and materials to repair his pigpen.

loans.use: to buy pigs and birds, and materials to repair his pigpen.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Rose, a 36-year-old youthful, very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kihuha, in the Ndaragwa region of Kenya.

Rose passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past five years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her large family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her large family.

Rose enjoys the returns she gets from farming but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. Rose has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and the price of milk has been going up recently, so Rose, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she learned that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure to boost the fertility of her farm. Selling the milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also sell to big dairy processing firms.

Rose said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agriculture-based loans and their interest rate is low and offered on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and, from the training, she learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro-finance institutions. Rose hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to add value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Eusilah

texts.en:
Meet Eusilah, a very industrious, honest, and hardworking woman from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift Valley escarpment.

Eusilah, 29, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, she has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Eusilah is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereal.

Kenya's Nandi Hills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Eusilah could increase her profits by satisfying the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Eusilah, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring female farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Eusilah believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereal. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Eusilah to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises es un emprendedor de 27 años de edad que en compañía de su cónyuge, inició su microempresa de pasabocas congelados en el año 2014 en la ciudad de Cartagena, ellos consideraron que sería una alternativa de ingresos para el beneficio de su familia e iniciaron la actividad con recursos propios. Los pasabocas son elaborados a base de harina de trigo y los rellenan con queso y carnes aderezadas, ellos producen deditos, empanaditas y quibbes que son embalados en bandejitas forradas con film plástico para su conservación en el congelador. Todos los días inician su producción a las 7 a.m. y finalizan a las 11 a.m., posteriormente ofrecen sus productos a sus vecinos con pagos de contado o a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirán en la compra de materias primas y un congelador de mayor capacidad para conservar estos alimentos. Su meta a futuro es distribuir a almacenes de cadena y educar a sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Moises is a 27-year-old entrepreneur. In 2014, he and his wife started their own microenterprise selling "pasabocas" (tasty snacks) in the city of Cartagena. They thought that it would be a good alternative source of income to benefit their family and started the business with their own funds.

The "pasabocas" are prepared with a wheat-flour pastry and then filled with cheese and seasoned meats. They produce "deditos," "empanaditas," and "quibbes" that are stored in the freezer in plastic-wrapped trays to preserve them. They start production every day at 7 a.m. and finish at 11 a.m., and then they offer their products to their neighbors, who pay them with cash or on credit.

Moises is currently applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in the purchase of ingredients and a larger freezer to preserve his products. His goal for the future is to distribute to grocery store chains, and to pay for the education of his two children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and a larger freezer to preserve his products.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es: Mónica es una microempresaria residente en Puerto Colombia un municipio del Atlántico con cercanía al mar y en esta localidad funciona su almacén misceláneo que aperturó en el año 2012, motivada por su madre quien se ha dedicado toda su vida al comercio, le sugirió tener un punto de venta de artículos y productos misceláneos.  Hoy en día esta actividad le permite a Mónica estar más tiempo con sus hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad y cumplir con sus labores en el hogar, garantizando un ingreso seguro que le permite aportar a los gastos del hogar. Todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. esta dispuesta a recibir a sus clientes quienes realizan compras de detalles para toda ocasión como perfumes, colonias, splash, cosméticos entre otra variedad de productos de uso personal. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para surtir con nuevas líneas de productos cosméticos y perfumería, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y tener muy buenas utilidades.  Su meta es incrementar sus ventas y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mónica is a small business owner from Puerto Colombia, a municipality on the Atlantic, very close to the sea. She opened her store in 2012 encouraged by her mother, who has worked in sales all her life and suggested she opened a point of sales of miscellaneous items and products.

Today, her business allows Mónica to spend more time with her sons, who are 7 and 5 years old, and to do her daily domestic chores, while guaranteeing a steady income to contribute to the household expenses. Every day from 8 a.m. she is ready to welcome her clients who buy items for any occasion, such as perfume, cologne, splash, cosmetics, among a variety of products for personal use.

She is currently requesting her first credikiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to stock her business with new lines of cosmetic products and perfumes. This investment will allow her to increase sales with very good profit. Her goal is to increase sales and remodel her house.

loans.use: stock her business with new lines of cosmetic products an perfumes.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a creative and hard-working young woman who is dedicated to her family. Anyone watching her at work will admire her for the determination and dedication that she puts into each one of her tasks. Ndaragwa is a rain-fed area popularly known for maize and dairy farming. With the help of her beloved husband, Purity runs a successful rural enterprise, capitalizing on her small piece of land. The farm consists of her home, a cow, poultry, and trees.

Purity is planning to grow her milk business, but the only way she can do this without having to purchase more land is by focusing on dairy goat farming. Dairy goat farming is a very lucrative venture that does not require very much land. Purity is kindly seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase quality breeds of dairy goats in a bid to boost milk production and ultimately increase her income. Her family will use the milk produced to fill their domestic needs and to meet commercial ends. Money generated from the sales will be used to settle the loan debt and pay part of their children's educational expenses. Purity's vision is to provide for her family and to meet their needs as best as she can.

Be part of Purity’s dream by making a loan today!

loans.use: To purchase a quality breed of goat

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is a smallholder farmer who is 36 years of age. She is a fighter of a woman, enterprising and honest. She resides with her husband with whom she has been blessed with four lovely children. She wants to fight to make sure her children and grandchildren to come lack nothing.

Eveline has been actively involved in farming for the last 10 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells dairy cow and goat milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves goat farming, but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of goats that are resistant to diseases and produce more milk.

Eveline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase an additional goat. She will use her excess grass to feed the goat. Through better feeding, the goat will produce quality milk, which will translate to more income. She is going to benefit from goat manure, which is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save money that would have been spent buying fertilizer.

Through increased profits, Eveline hopes to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Your loan will bring joy to this family because she will be able to support them and improve their living conditions. Support this great, grand mum who is not deterred by difficulty so that she can achieve a good future for her children.

loans.use: To buy good quality breeds of goats

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Alice has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the scarce time she has, she sells crops from her small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry.

Alice is seeking a Kiva loan of 50,000 KES to buy seed and grow her agriculture business. Produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, as evidenced by the steadily rising exports. Experience shows that farming offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income. The government, however, fails to ensure that small and poor farmers are afforded opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Alice access to a loan that will support her in making her farm a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and increase commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Alice’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

Alice expects that her farming business will last a long time and provide for her family, giving them a good quality of life. You can be part of this mother’s story by helping make her farming business successful and her family happy. A loan will allow her to accomplish big things.

loans.use: To buy seed and grow her farm.

loans.name: Victor Jose

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad que trabaja por un noble principio, quiere que su madre deje de trabajar y descanse en su casa, por ello trabaja de 10 a 12 horas diarias.
Víctor tiene un humilde negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, también realiza está profesión porque se está pagando sus estudios superiores, quiere ser universitario y ser exitoso en la vida, por ello te invita a que lo apoyes en un préstamo para la compra de 2 televisores, 2 play station 2 y una mesa.
texts.en:
Victor is a young entrepreneur aged 22 years old who works for a noble cause: he wants his mother to give up work and relax at home. For that reason he works 10 to 12 hours per day.
Victor has a humble business renting video games. He also works at this profession because he is paying for his higher education as he wants to be an undergraduate and be successful in life.
He therefore invites you to support him with a loan to buy 2 televisions, 2 PlayStation 2s and a table.

loans.use: to buy 2 televisions, 2 PlayStation 2s and a table.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a hardworking, honest, and warm-hearted farmer from the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns for farming.

Monica is the proud mother of three lovely children whom she loves, adores, and protects. Monica’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming eight years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Monica is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her three children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Monica is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her farm. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Monica is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from farming, Monica will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start farming.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 60 años de edad una persona muy enérgica que labora para mantener su hogar, pagar sus deudas, comprar los medicamentos y alimentos de ella y su esposo.
Su trabajo es bastante difícil, vende frutas y verduras, empujando un carreta por las calles, pero el esfuerzo vale la pena, pues goza de una excelente calidad de vida.
Blanca muy acomedidamente quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de frutas y verduras, también parte del dinero lo destinara en la compra de e materiales y repuesto para su carreta.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 60-year-old woman, a very energetic person who works to maintain her household, pay off her debts, and to purchase medicines and food for herself and her husband.

Her work is rather difficult. She sells fruits and vegetables, pushing her cart through the streets, but the effort is worth it because she enjoys an excellent quality of life.

Blanca very courteously would like to ask for a loan to purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables, and also a part of the money will be used to purchase materials and parts for her cart.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables, and also a part of the money will be used to purchase materials and parts for her cart.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer de 53 años de edad, actualmente separa de su esposo y madre de dos hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar como independiente la confección, actividad que emplea hace varios años, pero con la separación de su esposo ha tenido que emplearse tiempo completo en la actividad para generar los recursos suficientes para mantener su hogar.
Mercedes necesita generar más dinero, el precio de los alimentos, el arrendamiento, está muy alto y sus ingresos actuales no están alcanzando por ello quiere iniciar con su línea propia de confección por lo que necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de una máquina fileteadora e hilos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 53-year-old woman, currently separated from her husband, and the mother of two children. She works independently making clothing, work that she has done for some years, but with the separation from her husband, she has had to work full time at the job to generate enough resources to maintain her household.

Mercedes needs to generate more money, the price of food and the rent are very high and her current income are not enough, so she wants to begin her own line of sewing, and for this she needs economic support to purchase a serger and thread.

loans.use: to purchase a serger and thread.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.es:
Marlyn es una hermosa Joven de 18 años de edad que vive en unión libre con su pareja, ella quiere progresar y vivir cómodamente con su amor, por ello inicio hace poco con un negocio de venta de mercancía y no solo eso, quiere estudiar, progresar y ser independiente económicamente.
Su sueño a futuro es comprar una vivienda propia.
Con mucha ilusión y ansiedad Marlyn quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos de uso doméstico, aseo personal y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Marlyn is a lovely young woman, 18 years old, who lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. She wants to progress and live comfortably with her love, so a little while ago she began a business selling merchandise and not only this, she wants to go to school, progress and be economically independent.

Her dream for the future is to purchase her own house.

With a lot of eagerness and anxiety, Marlyn wants to ask for a loan to purchase household items, personal care products and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase household items, personal care products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Georgina from Ndaragwa, Kenya. Although her community is not known for farming, she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and together with her husband is blessed with five lovely children.

For the past five years, Georgina has been practicing mixed farming, and, because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from milk, eggs, and crop selling has allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra coin, Georgina engages in small personal business.

Georgina passionately loves dairy farming and the animals on her farm have been given names. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Demand has been overwhelming, so she is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Georgina does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow; she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich, creamy milk. The dairy cow will produce between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income so Georgina will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Eriberto Jose

texts.es:
Eriberto es un joven de 24 años de edad que con su negocio de cría de aves está sacando a su familia adelante y tiene oportunidades de estudiar para cambiar su realidad, pues vive en una zona muy afectada por la pobreza y lo que quiere es progresar y ser una persona exitosa.
Eriberto quiere solicitar tu apoyo para crecer como empresario, un pequeño capital que usara en la construcción de un segundo galpón, aves y alimento, esto le permitirá expandirse y poder buscar contratos con empresas que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Eriberto is a young man, 24 years old, who with his business raising poultry is getting his family ahead and he has the opportunity to go to school to change his reality, since he lives in an area affected a lot by poverty and what he wants is to progress and be a successful person.

Eriberto wants to ask for your support to grow as a businessman, a little capital that he will use to build a second enclosure, and purchase poultry and feed. This will allow him to expand and be able to seek contracts with businesses, which is his great dream.

loans.use: to build a second enclosure, and purchase poultry and feed.

loans.name: Karimi

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Karimi, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 44-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family- which includes her husband and three children- she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu in the central region of Kenya. For the past five years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been from selling milk, eggs and crops. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming.

Karimi passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and expand her farming. The dairy unit will assist Karimi in managing her cows well and will also protect them from the harsh weather conditions.

Before Karimi joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, she considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have a future promise for income generation. After training, Karimi now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want a rather less rough way into the “millionaires club”. With the loan, Karimi will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Karimi will achieve this. Through this loan she will also expand her farming and produce more.

An increase in income will allow Karimi to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Karimi fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide the reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

You can help Karimi to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that. Lend to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit and expand her farming.

loans.name: Carmelo Jose

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad, una persona amorosa, cariñosa y servicial, tiene dos pequeños, el mayor de 10 años de edad y la princesa de tan solo 8 años de edad, su sueño es verlos crecer en un excelente ambiente familiar, poder ofrecerles una buena educación y jamás dejar que lleguen a pasar necesidades.
José se dedica a fabricar artesanías, las cuales fabrica principalmente con objetos marinos, su carisma y su sonrisa le ayudan a venderlos con mayor facilidad.
Se encuentra solicitando un impulso monetario que usara en la compra de objetos marinos en grandes cantidades para la fabricación de sus collares, aretes y manillas.
texts.en:
José is a father, 38 years old, a loving, caring and helpful person. He has two little ones, the older one is 10 and the princess is only 8 years old. His dream is to see them grow in an excellent family environment, to be able to offer them a good education and never let them have a time of need.

José works making crafts, which he makes primarily with marine objects. His charisma and his smile help him to sell them more easily.

He is asking for a monetary boost which he will use to purchase marine objects in large quantities to make his necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of marine objects to make crafts.

loans.name: Liliana Milena

texts.es:
Ella es Liliana simplemente una mujer excepcional, vive en el municipio de sucre, es madre cabeza de familia, nació bajo el seno de una familia humilde pero su mentalidad ganadora y sus ganas de crecer y ser exitosa la llevaron a buscar la forma de cumplir sus sueños, hoy en día está mujer cuenta con un salón de belleza muy lindo, es frecuentado y gracias a este puede sustentar los gastos familiares.
Liliana tiene dos metas trazadas, las cuales osn comprar una vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos, trabaja largas jornadas laborales y no se detendrá hasta alcanzar su sueño.
Liliana se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que usara en la compra de muebles para la peluquería (silla, sofá, espejos, lava-cabezas) y  productos de belleza
texts.en:
This is Liliana, simply an exceptional woman. She lives in the municipality of Sucre and is a female head of household. She was born into the bosom of a humble family but her winning mentality and her desire to grow and be successful have brought her to seek the way to achieve her dreams. These days, this woman has a very nice beauty salon, it is frequented and, thanks to this, she can cover the family expenses.

Liliana has set two goals, which are to purchase a house and pay for her children's education, she works long days and won't stop until she achieves her dreams.

Liliana is asking for a loan which she will use to purchase furniture for hairdressing (chair, sofa, mirrors, shampoo station) and beauty products.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing furniture (chair, sofa, mirrors, shampoo station) and beauty products.

loans.name: Rhidah

texts.en:
This is Rhidah, a 53-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale. It is a thriving area full of people like Rhidah who, with hard and honest work, make this a very productive town.

Rhidah is eager to get ahead. She is married and lives with her family. She is blessed with four children who motivate her to persevere because she wants to provide them with a better future.

Dairy, poultry, a side hustle business and crop-farming all produce food and provide Rhidah with a basis for income generation and employment.

However, the full potential of agriculture for food and income generation is not realized because Rhidah still uses traditional tools for crop production which results in low productivity of land and labor. Low agricultural productivity also contributes to poor health and poverty.

Rhidah is seeking a loan to buy low-cost, manually operated farm implements that are modified to fit local needs. Your loan will help supply Rhidah with the appropriate tools required to improve agricultural productivity and profitability.

She knows that, with the help of the Kiva lenders, she will achieve her goals. Be inspired and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy low-cost, manually-operated farm tools.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Caroline, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment. Caroline, age 21, has been farming for the past three years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Caroline is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why she wakes up very early every day to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Caroline could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Caroline, but she now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Caroline believes that this loan will be of much help and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Caroline to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.
Be inspired make a loan!

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, 38 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kaboi, a remote village in Nandihills. She is happily married and is blessed with two children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Sally intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will earn will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and in securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Kerugoya area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 80,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.
Veronica knows that, with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and those at Kiva, her dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen, a youthful farmer from Nyabite, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her family as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Nyamira area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Hellen has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Hellen started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 10 years. Hellen's sources of income are a small side hustle business,vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. The Nyamira area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Hellen is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Hellen is very determined to succeed and because she is very disciplined with finances, she plans that through accumulated profits she will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for her family. Hellen's dream is to provide a secure future for her children through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan you will help him realize her dream. You can be part of Hellen’s dream -- make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so as to deliver her produce speedily to market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Hello lenders, the above picture presents Mary, 51 years of age, a hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer. She is based in Kerugoya. It is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has four lovely children. Her primary sources of income are cow and goat milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Mary is a tough woman with tough skin and she has managed to take care of her family with her income from goat milk selling. The Kerugoya area has conditions that favor dairy goat farming and Mary has always wanted to take care of another dairy goat but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy an additional dairy goat. The dairy goat she intends to buy is not just an ordinary goat. It’s a breed that produces between 1-3 liters of milk a day. With this goat, she will produce more milk which will translate to more income. Demand for milk in the Kerugoya area is high but the supply is low. So, through this loan, Mary is going to reap more and comfortably meet the demand. Her increased income will allow Mary to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to keep even more dairy goats. Be inspired and loan to her today!

loans.use: to buy a quality exotic breed of dairy goat.

loans.name: Kadiatou Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 femmes qui forment ce groupe sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou Adama (debout derrière et à droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus teintés  et d’autres tissus qu’elle achète à Dakar pour le revendre détail.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus teintés d’un montant de 300 000f et d’autres à 150000 paie un transport de 45000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et prendre soins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The five women who make up this group are very united and, by working together, have built up a solidarity and group spirit which is hailed by persons of note in the village. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Kadiatou Adama (who is standing at the back on the right) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has one child. She sells tinted fabrics as well as other types of fabric, which she buys in Dakar to resell on a retail basis. With this new loan, she is planning to buy tinted fabrics to a value of 300,000 francs and others amounting to 150,000 francs, as well as paying 45,000 francs for transport; she will resell the fabrics on a retail basis in her neighborhood.

With her profits she is planning to help out her husband with the daily outgoings and take care of her child.

loans.use: to buy tinted fabrics to a value of 300,000 francs and others for 150,000 francs, to be retailed in her neighborhood, as well as to pay 45,000 francs for transport.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, a 38-year-old mother of two lovely children that she really adores and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Salome hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Salome started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Salome practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the “key to success”.

She is seeking a loan of KES 45,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Salome wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits. Salome hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Salome's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. She will employ people to work for him on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society. Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 42-year-old farmer from the remote village of Kathieri, situated in the central province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is no clean water nor electrical connections.

For 10 years, her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Catherine's biggest challenges are disease and a shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs such as chemicals to prevent these diseases. Catherine made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help her improve her farming activities.

Sometime this month, she applied for a loan for expanding her horticulture farm. This will enable her to expand her operations and increase her overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to Catherine’s children education. The cost of education in Kenya is becoming prohibitive for low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Catherine’s children will acquire a quality education that will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.
Catherine’s dream is to build a modern house and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Esther. Esther is a 49-year-old smallholder farmer from Ndaragwa in the central region of Kenya. She owns a two and a half-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The mother of seven keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. Esther is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output.

Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Esther. Through a group of 10 members called Joy center self-help group, Esther has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi which use the group-based savings as collateral. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Esther because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry and should be supported.

loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 46 years of age, with 5 children, a very hardworking woman. She hails from Kiminini, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Alice is contented with the farming way of life. She is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal.

The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Alice feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Alice is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children who are in college and primary school. Please help Alice so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her 5 children.

loans.name: Codou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de six femmes a été crée depuis bientôt six ans. Ses membres sont issues du même quartiers et unies par de bonnes relations sociales professionnelles. Madame Codou est une femme mariée âgée de 47 ans et mère de deux filles et quatre garçons tous scolarisé.
Elle s'active dans la commercialisation des brebis après engraissage. Madame Codou est debout a gauche de la photo la main levée. Avec son nouveau crédit de  cinq cent mille francs CFA elle va acheter des moutons qu'elle va engraisser puis les revendre au niveau des marchés et amis de sa localité.
elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis bientôt cinq ans .
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, which is made up of six women, was set up almost six years ago. Its members all come from the same neighborhood and have a good social and professional relationship with one another.

Codou is a married woman who is 47 years old and mother to two girls and four boys, all of whom are at school. She has an activity fattening up sheep and then selling them. She is standing on the left of the photo with her hand raised.

With her new loan of 500,000 FCFA she is going to buy sheep which she will fatten up and then resell in markets and to friends in her town. She has good experience in this field, having carried out this activity for almost five years now.

The profits she makes will enable her to provide for food and build up her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Membre depuis le 29 Janvier 1998,  cette brave femme a une expérience en matière de crédit. Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la restauration et la vente de jus et d’eau fraiche.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 08sac de riz à 13000f le sac, 06 bouteilles de 20 litre d’huile raffiné à 20000f la bouteille de l’huile de palme à 35000f  du charbon d’un montant de 30000f des légumes et d’autres condiment pour le restaurant à 98000f de l’oseille d’un montant de 88000f du pain de singe à 35000f et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de jus 15000 payer ses femmes de ménage à 55000f payer l’eau et l’électricité à 120000f

 Les bénéfices lui serviront  d’acheter un terrain aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This courageous woman, who has been a member since 29th January 1998, has a long experience of borrowing. Aminata, who has a small trading business, is married and mother to four children. She has a restauration activity and also sells juice and fresh water.

With this loan, she is planning to buy eight sacks of rice at 13,000 francs each, six 20-liter bottles of refined oil at 20,000 francs the bottle, palm oil for 35,000 francs, charcoal for 30,000 francs, vegetables and other condiments for the restaurant to a value of 98,000 francs, sorrel for 88,000 francs, monkey bread for 35,000 francs and other condiments for making juice for 15,000 francs; she will also use 55,000 francs to pay her cleaning ladies and 120,000 francs to pay for water and electricity.

The profits she makes will be used to buy a plot of land and help her husband with the daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of rice at 1,300 francs each and six 20-liter bottles of refined oil at 20,000 francs a bottle.

loans.name: Mairy Ruth

texts.es: Mairy es una microempresaria de 35 años residenciada en un barrio de Barranquilla con cercanía al mar, donde el desayuno de muchos de sus vecinos depende de los deliciosos bollos que elabora y que consisten en un envuelto de masa de maíz en hojas de mazorca, que se cocina y quedan listos para su consumo.  Esta actividad la aprendió de su cuñado quien lleva realizando este producto alimenticio veinte años con excelentes resultados. Ella realiza sus bollos de lunes a sábado e inicia su producción a las 5 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m., y como su meta es duplicar sus ventas está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual comprará maíz al por mayor y dos ollas de aluminio grandes, esto le permitirá realizar una producción más variada y voluminosa. Ella es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y vive en compañía de su cónyuge. Gracias a su labor ha ofrecido al bienestar de su familia y lo mejor de su trabajo es que puede compartir con ellos todo el tiempo.
texts.en: Mairy is a micro-entrepreneur, 35 years old, who lives in a neighborhood of Barranquilla near the sea where many of her neighbors' breakfasts depend on the delicious rolls she makes and that consist of wrapping a corn dough in corn leaves which she cooks and they are ready to eat. She learned this work from her brother-in-law who has made this food product for twenty years with excellent results. She makes her rolls from Monday to Saturday and begins her production at 5 am until 7 pm and, as her goal is to double her sales, she is applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she will purchase corn in bulk and two large aluminum pots. This will allow her to make a more varied and larger production. She is the mother of two children who are minors and lives with her spouse. Thanks to her work, she has offered her family well-being and the best of her work is that she can share with them all the time.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and two large aluminum pots.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 39-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Kitale area of Kenya, and is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Florence was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Kitale is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for milk. Florence, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mum is 41 years of age. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of four lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Joyce’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming.

She faces financial challenges, and because the Nyamira area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Joyce’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Joyce is quite visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.
You can help this devoted mother to accomplish her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Siliviah

texts.en:
Siliviah lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with her husband and their two children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. Siliviah works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. Siliviah has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize.

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Siliviah said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Siliviah is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Siliviah is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

Siliviah dreams of a good life and being able to offer a good education for her children, because she wants to see them become professionals and successful people. You can help Siliviah with a loan, support her and watch her do great things.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill, with three children. has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Her primary sources of income are milk and eggs

Norah is seeking a loan worth 65,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily-rising exports. Experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Norah access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Norah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.
Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Norah!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Grupo Chiguaxte Group

texts.es:
Sabina es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 18 y 23 años, todos ellos ya trabajan, esta familia vive en una comunidad del cantón chiguaxte.
Sabina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)  es ama de casa y para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 6 años. Sabina con el afán de obtener unos cerdos grandes y muy bien alimentados ha considerado necesario solicitar un préstamo para la compra de concentrados para sus cerdos. Este préstamo la ayudara a que sus cerdos tengan una buena alimentación para que engorden luego.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 41-year-old woman, single, with a lovely family of three children between the ages of 18 and 23, they all work. This family lives in a community in the canton of Chiguaxte.

Sabina (the first on the left in the photo) is a homemaker and, to get income, she works raising pigs. She has done this work for 6 years. Sabina, with the desire to get some large and very well-fed pigs considers it necessary to ask for a loan to purchase concentrated pig feed. This loan will help her pigs have good feed so that they then get fat.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline, 34, with four children,spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, in her mixed farm, tirelessly working. She is based in Miruka, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is happily married to Douglas, who adds additional income to support their family. For the past 10 years she has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although Hyline makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption.

Hyline comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this it. Hyline faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health. Hyline is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Hyline wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming.

Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan, Hyline will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Hyline is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Hyline’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Kagere in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with three children. For the last ten years, Ann has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet.

Ann finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs.
