She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels.

Ann is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and increase her farming business

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago con 39 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Santiago cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santiago se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1.5 hectáreas de variedad Catimor; plantación tiene 3-4 años de edad, esta en primer y segundo año de producción. Santiago cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que anteriormente a cultivada café tradicional variedad nacional; ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad Catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). Siendo estos para su consumo.El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1.5 hectáreas de café en producción, asegurando campaña agrícola 2016 con una mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Santiago es socio recurrente en nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa.Firma con aval.
texts.en:
Santiago, 39 years old, lives with his spouse and four children in their own house, made of rustic materials, in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. Santiago has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the zone. The people in this area work primarily in agriculture, trade and raising animals.

Santiago works growing coffee, having to date 1.5 hectares of Catimor variety; the plantation is 3-4 years old, it is in its first and second year of production. Santiago has wide experience in the field since he previously grew traditional coffee of the national variety. Now, due to disease and pests, he has replanted with Catimor variety, which is much more resistant to disease. In addition, he works raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and more) and growing food products (yucca, plantains, and vituca), which are for his own consumption. The loan will be destined to maintain the 1.5 hectares of coffee in production, assuring a 2016 agricultural season with more production reflected in a larger volume of sales, and in the end getting more income so as to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Santiago is a return borrower in our financial institution Edpyme Alternativa. He signs with a guarantee.

loans.use: to maintain 1.5 hectares of coffee in production, assuring a 2016 farming season with more production.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a youthful 45-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Chuka, which is in the central region of Kenya. Christine is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them with a better future.

Christine has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to use for dairy cow and goat farming. She has requested a loan to buy a dairy goat. Chuka is an area that has a high population and there is a high demand for goat milk. Christine, being an enterprising person, wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and expand her goat milk-selling business.

Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large goat milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered and knows that accessing funds is challenging, but she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved and she will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, age 51, is hopeful and happy at the idea that she can change her future and that of her family. She resides in Nkubu, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 20 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Lilian enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Lilian has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Lilian will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family. Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her 3 children and husband.
You can help this strong willed woman to do great things in her farming business and her life. A loan can do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 53-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nkubu, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Mount Kenya. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely husband, and they have been blessed with lovely, angelic children. On the land, they have kept cows and grown vegetables for three years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. She recently ventured into a “side hustle” business.

From Kiva lenders, Agnes is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, made evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to provide Agnes with access to a loan that will help her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business and that will also increase employment opportunities and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Agnes' family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income but it will also reduce their income vulnerability.
Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: L’Union A Group

texts.fr: Chibichabene est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «L’union A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 29 ans, mariée, mère de cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est propriétaire d’un dépôt de braises dans le centre commercial depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 100 sacs de braises. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son ami. Elle compte accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Chibichabene is a trader and member of the "L'Union A" group. She is a customer of IMF Hekima and is 29 years old, married and mother to five children, four of whom are at school while the fifth is still a very young child. She has owned an ember store in the shopping center for the past five years and is going to buy 100 sacks of embers. She began her business with capital given to her by her friend. She is planning to expand her business and educate and feed her children. Finally she is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to get 100 sacks of embers.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
Claudia es una hermosa joven de 20 años de edad que desde el año 2012 se dedica a vender productos de aseo persona, aseo doméstico y productos de belleza, Inicio su trabajo por gusto y vocación, le gusta ser independiente y generar sus propios ingresos para costear su universidad y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares.
Claudia quiere solicitar un aliento económico que usara en la compra de productos de uso persona, aseo doméstico y cosméticos, su sueño a futuro es comprar una vivienda propia, conseguir por sus propios medios activos para independizarse totalmente.
texts.en:
Claudia is an lovely 20 year old young woman who has made a living by selling toiletries, household cleaning products, make up and cosmetics since 2012.
She started her business as a vocation and for her own enjoyment. She likes to be independent and earn her own income to pay for university and her help parents with family expenses.

Claudia is asking for a loan which she will use to buy toiletries, household cleaning products and cosmetics. She dreams that in future she'll buy her own home and become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, household cleaning products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Narmin

texts.en:
Narmin is 24 years old single farmer who lives in the Fuzuli region. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Narmin has been in the poultry business for two years. She earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular customers and neighbors and has applied to Komak company for a loan.

Today she needs her first loan in the amount of 2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She wants to buy ducks and chickens. Once Narmin increases her business she will have more clients and a better monthly income. She is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy ducks and chickens

loans.name: Myrlinda

texts.en: Myrlinda is 38 years old and is a hardworking farmer who primarily grows vegetables that supplies their local market. She's doing well on her chosen business activity that she wants to renovate their house. She presents her house renovations proposal to Paglaum MPC and avails a loan to buy wood, plywood, nails, galvanized iron sheets for house repair.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, nails, galvanized iron sheets for house repair

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a tricycle passenger in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Rowena dreams that one day, She will be able to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Scolastic

texts.en:
Scolastic has a lovely family that she really adores very much. She will always do anything good so that her children never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Scolastic hails from the Kitale area of Kenya.

She started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. She practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”.

Scolastic is a mother who is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, she wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Scolastic hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Scolastic’s dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. She will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen is 27 years old and he lives in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Vigen has very nice and young wife of 25 years old who is a student. They have a small daughter. Vigen is a farmer and through his farming he provides his family living. He has cows and heifers in his farm he sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheeses, curd and meat from his farm to his already regular customers. Vigen also cultivates potato on his plot of land which he takes and sells at the city’s wholesale market mainly to re-sellers.

This young family greatly wants to develop their farming and making it richer and richer. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Vigen now asks as his cattle need fodder and he is going to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to pay for cattle fodder

loans.name: Petroline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Petroline, a young farmer from the Nandihills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking that most Kenyans hold about agriculture. Petroline is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and the variety of crops she plants. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet. Petroline passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to find a solution for food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nandihills and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all of this success to hard work and determination.

Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to add to her farming so she started a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is a lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals to be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. With your loan, Petroline will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Petroline has been practicing agriculture by employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo. She believes that her cereal-selling business will increase in leaps and bounds.
There is no doubt that through your loan, Petroline's life is permanently going to change and she will assure that her school-going children have a secure future. Her future dreams are to construct a modern house for her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de ollas, comales de barros y productos de granos basicos desde hace 4 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes,el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose, age 35, lives in his own house with his wife. He has been selling pots, clay griddles, and basic gains products for four years. His business is located at the municipal market in a heavily traveled area. Therefore, he has a lot of customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale. This way he wil be able to continue with his sales in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy pots, clay griddles, and basic grains products.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Un impulso económico es lo que necesita la señora Liliana para salir de un bache que ha generado el bajo precio de venta de leche, algo que afecto mucho su economía, pero está tratando de remediar.
El dinero será usado en la compra de una vaca para regular la producción y abonos para el pasto.
Liliana es madre de una pequeña, su sueño es generar los ingresos suficientes para vivir cómodamente y poder pagar la educación de su amada hija.
texts.en:
A financial boost is what Liliana needs in order to get out of a hole that the low price of milk has caused. This is something that has greatly affected her finances, but she is trying to correct that.

The money will be used to buy a cow to regulate production and fertilizers for the pasture.

Lilian is the mother of a little one. Her dream is to generate enough earnings to live comfortably and to be able to pay for her beloved daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to regulate the production and fertilizers for the pasture.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es una joven de 20 años de edad que con su negocio de venta de mercancía busca costearse sus estudios universitarios, por ello solicita un aliento económico para dinamizar y aumentar sus venta, ella proviene de una familia con ingresos modestos, su principal objetivo es sacarlos adelante, ser exitosa y enorgullecer a sus padres.
El apoyo económico será usado en la compra de productos de línea nutricional, de belleza, aseo persona y de aseo doméstico.
Un apoyo económico puede cambiar el negocio de esta joven que utiliza todos los recursos que tiene a su disposición para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sara, 20, seeks to finance her college studies through her business of merchandise sales, and she is asking for encouragement in the form of a loan to stimulate and increases her sales. She comes from a family of modest financial means. Her main goal is to get them ahead, to be successful and make her parents proud.

Sara will use this loan to buy nutritional products, beauty products, personal care products and household cleaning products. Financial assistance at this time can change the business of this young woman who is tapping all available reources to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy nutritional supplements, beauty products, personal care products, and household cleaning products.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad el señor Hernán sigue persiguiendo su sueño de tener una vivienda propia y  tener sus propios terrenos. Él es un hombre soltero, que se entrega en cuerpo y alma a su trabajo, sabe que su labor lo llevara a cumplir sus sueños, por ello tiene paciencia pero también está laborando con mayor intensidad, siendo la principal razón su edad.
Hernán quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de café y plátano.
texts.en:
At his 51 years of age Hernán continues pursuing his dream of having his own house and his own land. He is single, and he gives his body and soul to his work. He knows that his work will lead him to the fulfillment of his dreams. He has patience for this, but he is also working more intensely, primarily because of his age.

Hernán want to request a loan to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee and banana crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his coffee and banana crops.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme au foyer âgée de 56 ans qui vit à Adidogomè. Mère d’un enfant, Adjo prépare du fromage de soja à domicile et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de soja, le bidon d’huile, le sac de soude et du parfum. Grâce l’épargne qui  résultera suite à une bonne vente, Adjo va pouvoir aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès ce début de la rentrée scolaire et prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a 56 year old housewife who lives in Adidogome. Adjo has one child and she prepares soy cheese at home and sells it as an itinerant saleswoman in the neighbouring districts. Adjo buys her supplies once a month at the market and requests this loan to order bowls of soy, a can of oil, a sack of soda, and some flavouring. Good sales will enable her to make savings that she will use to help her husband to pay for their child's school fees for the beginning of this school term, and to provide for certain family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 24 bowls of soy, 01 can of oil, 01 sack of soda and 01 unit of flavouring.

loans.name: Fatou       G's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé cinq femmes a été crée depuis le 28 12 /2010. Elles sont issues du même quartier  et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Mademoiselle Fatou est la responsable elle est célibataire sans  enfant. Elle s'active dans la commercialisation de savons en liquide et poudre.Elle debout à droite de la photo et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis bientôt cinq ans.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500 000 francs CFA elle va se payer des sacs de savons en poudre et des cartons de savon en liquide qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau des marchés de sa localité. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de renforcer son compte bancaire au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five women and was created on the 28th of December 2010. The women all come from the same neighbourhood and share between them good social and professional relationships. Miss Fatou is the leader, she is single and does not have any children. She works in the sale of liquid and powdered soap. She is standing on the right in the photo and has a solid experience in this field as she has been working in it for five years.
With her new loan of  500 000 francs CFA, she plans to buy sacks of powdered soap and cartons of liquid soap that she will resell retail at the markets in her district. The profits will enable her to solidify her bank account with the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy liquid and powdered soap.

loans.name: Gentrix

texts.en:
Speaking with Gentrix, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being.

She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their seven angelic-looking children. She has always striven to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been doing agriculture for 10 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her, and also poor productivity.

Gentrix is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standard. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Gentrix and her family.

Like Gentrix, thousands of entrepreneurs are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as fertilizers and good quality seeds

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
With four children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Stella, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, this is considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and some personal business that she engages in.

Stella is seeking a loan worth 60,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident in steadily-rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Stella access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Stella’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Stella!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en:
Janifer is a very hardworking, energetic, young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past 10 years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. She is based in Kianyaga, a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area with fertile soil famous for dairy farming.

Janifer has been selling eggs and milk and this has earned her a decent income. Janifer passionately loves dairy farming and taking care of her cows and goats gives her great joy. She wakes up every morning to milk her dairy goats, but she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality goat milk.

Janifer is seeking a loan to buy a quality breed of dairy goat that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With this loan, she will buy a dairy goat that will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. Through Kiva Field Partner Juhudi Kilimo, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills. This will help her save more money, repay the loan fully, and improve her living conditions. You can help Janifer to accomplish all these dreams with a loan, so do it now and get her closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy goat.

loans.name: Jannepher

texts.en:
Jannepher, 36 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Ekerenyo, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and is blessed with four children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Nyamira area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline, 23 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kebirigo, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and is blessed with three children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.
Roseline has had a big dream for many years and that is to live with her family comfortably and safely and have a good quality life. You can be part of this story, and a loan will help her a lot

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca resides in Simbi, a remote village in the lush hills of Nandihills, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 11 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that.

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. She plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Prisca’s life will take another turn, and she will be able to secure the future of her family. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Jairo es una persona, humilde, honesta, trabajador independiente de 32 años de edad, se dedica a prestar servicios de podado de terrenos, actividad que realiza para poder alcanzar sus sueños que son, pagar la educación de sus hijos y comprar una vivienda propia.
Los tiempos cambian y para sobresalir ante la competencia hay que ser más práctico y ágil.
Por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta para agilizar su desplazamiento y adquirir una máquina podadora más potente (ver foto).
texts.en:
Jairo is a humble, honest, hard-working, and independent 32 year old man. He provides trimming services. He does this in order to be able to reach his dreams, which are to pay for his children's education and to buy his own house.

The times change, and in order to survive the competition you need to be more useful and quicker. Therefore, he wants to request a loan to buy a motorcycle to expidite his transportation and a stronger trimming machine (see photo).

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to expidite his transportation and to get a stronger trimmer (see photo).

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, is a 41-year-old farmer who has two children and lives in the village of Mukuyuni in the Kitale area of Kenya. Kitale is one of the places that has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming, that is good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Eunice has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground. She is requesting a loan to start horticulture farming. Through Makunga unity self-help group is a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her transport the produce faster to an international market hence making more money. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 50, who is based in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. This area is the major maize and banana growing region of the country, but it is increasingly emerging as an important dairy farming zone for East Africa. Lucy has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years, and her primary source of income has been milk and eggs. She passionately loves dairy farming. She enjoys feeding her cows, and milking her cow is her hobby.

The biggest challenge she faces is the lack of a proper dairy unit where her cows can feed and rest. Because of this, she has suffered losses through diseases that attack her cows due to the harsh weather conditions. If you are to reap more from cows, you must feed them properly to get high quality milk. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to build a modern dairy unit.

With the loan, she will be able to increase her milk production, improve her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children. She will be able to build this business and become independent.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a smallholder farmer based in Kesogon village in Nandihills Kenya. She owns an eight acre piece of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide him with capital for her business, but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have one children with a husband to whom she has stayed married for more than fifteen years.

Salome is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for her food and her business. The demand for cereals in the market, only a few kilometers from Salome's home, is increasing. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing himself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests.

She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Salome’s livelihood. She strives to give her child a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in.
Her greatest dream is to grow her business and be able to pay for her child studies. She knows that with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva lenders, she will be able to make her hopes come into reality.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty who at the age of 39 has a small parcel of land. Betty is a very hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Nandihills area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth for farming.

She is the proud mother of a lovely family whom she adores and always protects. Betty's upbringing was very challenging, and because of this she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Betty is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Betty is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but Betty is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming Betty will assure her children a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

For Betty, nothing is impossible. She wants to continue working to fulfill her dream of becoming the largest horticulture farmer so that she can enjoy a good quality life.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is an amazing woman who is a smallholder farmer based in Kesegon village in the Nandi Hills, Kenya Rose is seeking a loan to stock her cereals business. She plans to use the money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cater for all the expenses incurred plus profit. She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard-working and financially disciplined.

Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education.
Her positive attitude and her hopes of getting ahead show that Rose has an immense desire to better herself and of course, a desire to receive a favorable response to her loan request.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Kellah

texts.en:
Kellah is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some varieties of crops she plants.

Kellah passionately loves farming and she says that she got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Nkubu area and Africa as a whole. From farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds.

She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nkubu and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local markets.

With your loan, Kellah will improve her living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals. Kellah has been practicing agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge and she believes that her cereal-selling business will increase by leaps and bounds.

There is no doubt that through your loan, Kellah’s life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Gladis Emilse

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer de 36 años de edad, una persona sencilla, respetuosa y muy alegre, vive en unión libre con su pareja tiene dos hijas de 17 y 16 años de edad, se desempeña como independiente elaborando alimentos, dicha actividad la inició buscando ser autosuficiente económicamente.
Gladis quiere solicitar un apoyo financiero, ya que desea comprar un carro de comidas rápidas, utensilios e insumos para trabajar los fines de semana y mejorar sus recursos.
El principal motivo del préstamo es que junto con su pareja se trazó la meta de comprar una vivienda y pagar la educación de sus dos hijas.
texts.en:
Gladis, age 36, is a simple person. She is respectful and very happy. She lives in a common-law marriage with her life partner, and she has two daughters, ages 17 and 16. She works independently making food. She started this business activity looking to be financially self-sufficient.

Gladis wants to request financial support because she wishes to buy a fast food card, utensils, and supplies to work on the week-ends and to improve her resources. The main reason for the loan is that she and her life partner have together set the goal of buying a house and paying for their two daughters' education.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart, utensils, and supplies in order to work on the week-ends.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 55 years old and a proud mother. Roseline is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Roseline practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her cows.

Although Roseline has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mother. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Roseline will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through this loan, Roseline will be able to expand her horticulture business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. With your loan, Roseline will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses. She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand his horticulture business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a youthful 32-year-old farmer from Kapsaos, a remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges, and because of his passion to support his children as a primary caregiver.

Living conditions in the Kericho area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Francis has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Francis started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. His sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market.

The Kericho area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of produce to the market; that is why Francis is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, he will deliver produce to the market on time and reap more profits because the produce is still fresh.

Francis is determined to succeed. Because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and for his children through accumulated profits. Francis's dream is to provide a secure future for his children by paying tuition fees for them. You will help him realize his dream through your loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver his produce to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Ma. Lorelie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to resell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like frozen food retail business.

Ma. Lorelie dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to resell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Farming is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the great effort that one must put forth in order to progress.

Hello, Kiva lenders! The above picture presents Virginia, a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Kwanza in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with five lovely angelic-looking children. For the last ten years, Virginia has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back; she really likes what she does. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet.

Virginia finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs. She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels.

Virginia is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change. She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and expand her farming business.

Be inspired and support a Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds.

loans.name: Elianora

texts.en:
Elianora is 53 years old married woman. She lives with her pensioner husband in Senaki district. Elianora is involved in agricultural business. In particular, she owns a cow, hens and a plot of agricultural land to grow fruits and vegetables there. 
Elianora is very motivated to start trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of cloothes and will resell at higher price. 
This will give her a chance to generate stable income and cover everyday living costs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade clothes in order to have a stable income .

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, aged 28, is hopeful and happy at the idea that she can change her future and that of her family. She resides in Nandihills, Kenya.

Caroline has been practicing farming for ten years on her small plot where she does dairy and crop farming. Caroline enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

Caroline has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Caroline will be able to improve her income level and take care of her family. Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her siblings and her aging parents.

You can help this strong-willed woman to do great things in her farming business and her life. A loan can do a lot for Caroline.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
For some people, hitting the 40-year mark means a life of reliance on their children or immediate family members for their livelihood. However, for Rebecca, life begins at 40.

This mother of six has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years on her small parcel of land in the Nyamira area of Kenya and has been earning a decent income. She also does some personal business to supplement her income.

Of all the activities she is involved in, Rebecca enjoys poultry keeping the most. To her, poultry keeping went from being a way of life on an African homestead to being a hobby, to being a business.

Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. With this loan, she seeks to grow her business. However, it has been a rough ride for her to find a financier who would front money to a mere smallholder farmer without substantial security or a bank statement showing a regular source of income.

Today, Rebecca is a member of Bigogo Self-Help Group. Through the group, she can access loans from Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that was started to take care of smallholder's financial needs. Since joining, the group has been trained to embrace saving money and group management to ensure cohesion and development.

Your loan will help Rebecca to earn more income that will enable her to pay for her children's education for a brighter future. The money will also enable her to take care of the basic needs of her family.

When asked how she envisions life after successfully repaying the loan, Rebecca replied that her family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée qui vit avec quatre enfants à charge. Résidant à Baguida, Akou est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Akou sollicite ce crédit pour commander des balles de drap, des unités d’habits pour enfants et des soutien-gorge en vue de bien revendre puis gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Akou is a married woman who lives with four dependent children. Residing in Baguida, Akou resells used clothing and stocks up once a month at the market. She sells her wares on the side of the road.

In order to have a big inventory and maximize her profit so as to respond to the numerous needs of her clients, Akou is requesting this loan to order bales of sheets, garments for children, and bras. She wants to have a high turnover and earn profit to help her husband with the many varied expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy two bales of sheets, 80 garments for children, and 17 bras.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina es una madre joven cabeza de familia, una persona imponente con gran carácter, la cual no le quedó grande desempeñar el papel de padre y madre, ella a pesar de vivir en una zona de postconflicto, monto un negocio de cibercafé y ahora se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para comprar un nuevo computador de mesa, busca ampliar su cobertura y generar mejores ingresos para pagar la educación de sus dos hijas.
texts.en: Karina is a young mother who is the head of the household. She is an extraordinary person of great character. She was easily able to play the role of father and mother. Although she lives in a post-conflict zone, she started an internet cafe business and is now requesting financial support to buy a new desktop computer. She is looking to expand her service and generate greater income to pay for the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy a new desktop computer. She is looking to expand her service.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomè avec cinq enfants à charge. Afi est âgée de 40 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Afi est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Afi demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et de bien vendre puis avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman with five dependent children, who lives in Adidogome. Afi is 40 and works hard to have a good financial situation. Afi sells pagne fabric. She stocks up five times each month at the market and makes her sales from home and as an itinerant saleswoman in her district.  To achieve her objectives, Afi requests this loan to order pagnes to satisfy her customers' demand, and to make good sales to enable her to maintain a remarkable financial autonomy to help her children in their schooling.

loans.use: to buy 06 pagnes.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Always in life there is a reason to smile, but today Evaline has a big reason, and it is that she is only one step away from being able to start her own cereal selling business, thanks to Juhudi Kilimo and the wonderful Kiva lenders.

Evaline is an amazing woman who is a smallholder farmer based in Lessos village in the Nandi Hills, Kenya. She is married to her handsome husband, Noah, with whom she has been together for almost a decade. She has one child who commutes to school from home every school day.

Evaline has been practicing livestock farming for ten years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise cows and poultry on the farm.

Evaline is seeking a loan to stock her cereals business. She plans to use the money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred plus profit. Evaline is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hardworking and financially disciplined.

Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her three children. She is 55 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Ikonge, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Jerusha has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 41 years.

Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Jerusha is contented with the farming way of life.

Jerusha is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family a decent meal. The Nyamira area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Being an elderly woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Jerusha feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Jerusha is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children, who are in primary school and high school. Please help Jerusha so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better income for her three children.

loans.name: Wadid Manuel

texts.es:
Wadid es un hombre humilde, sencillo y enfocado en su meta de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su vivienda, vive en una zona de postconflicto, las oportunidades de empleo son bajas, por ello decidió iniciar un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar en el año 2010 y desde entonces ha podido mantenerse en el tiempo y pagar sus cuentas básicas.
Wadid siempre ha querido crecer, aumentar su mercancía, peor la falta de capital ha sido su principal impedimento, pero todo esto cambiara, tiene la esperanza de obtener un apoyo monetario que usara para aumentar su cantidad de inventario, invertir en estanterías, busca atraer un mayor número de clientes y tener disponibilidad y variedad de surtido.
texts.en:
Wadid is a man who is humble, modest, and focused on his goal of improving the living conditions of his home. He lives in a post-conflict zone, where there are not many employment opportunities. For this reason, in 2010 he decided to start a business, which is a store selling basic daily consumption products. Since then, he has been able to take care of himself over time and pay his basic bills.

Wadid has always wanted to grow and to expand his merchandise, but he does not have capital. This has been his primary obstacle, but all this will change. He has the hope of obtaining monetary support that he will use to increase the quantity of his inventory and to invest in shelves. He is looking to attract a greater number of customers and to have variety and availability of stock.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of basic daily consumption goods.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Doña Alba de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella es muy trabajadora siempre a buscado la manera de poder salir adelante, desde hace mas de 30 años se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de de tortillas negocio que tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas que realiza diario logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Alba is 61 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She is very hardworking. She has always looked for ways to get ahead. For more than 30 years, she has made a living by making and selling tortillas, a business that she conducts from her residence. With the earnings that she obtains from her daily sales, she is able to take care of the expenses that come up in her home. She is requesting a loan to buy corn on wholesale so that she can continue her sales and have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn on wholesale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Nearly all the people in the Litein area are farmers and Betty is one of them. Betty is a mixed farmer based in Kapkatet, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of four lovely, school-going children, whom she truly loves and greatly adores. Betty describes her upbringing as challenging, so she is doing everything in her power to provide a good foundation for her children and to help secure their future.

Betty is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. With the KES 20,000 (Kenya shillings) loan, she is going to pay for a truckload of manure and also pay for seedlings.

Betty has been farming for nearly one decade. She is going to use your loan investment and the years of experience she has gathered to make this expansion a success. Money gathered from this investment will enable Betty to contribute to her family's general expenses, her children's education, and medical needs.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Five years ago, Josephine started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud.

Although Josephine makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. Through the loan, she will have a comfortable time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Josephine believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Josephine waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Hello, Lenders, meet Sofia. This lovely lady is from Nyamira, Nyanza region of Kenya. One thing you will notice when visiting Nyamira is that the place is all green! Expansive tea and banana plantations stretch 360 degrees to the horizon. Tea, banana and dairy farming are the most dominant in the area.

For five years, Sofia has been banking on dairy farming to provide for her five children. Her primary income source is milk. Sofia is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo because the microfinance institution has an exclusive focus on farmers. With the money, she will diversify into poultry farming. She will introduce eggs and meat into her product portfolio. This move not only increases her income but also helps her to manage various risks that may befall dairy farming in future.

Sofia is the type of mother who places more premiums on education than an average parent. She believes that if she does her part and lays a proper foundation for her children through education, she has afforded them a shot to being anything they want to be in future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a responsible, respectable, hardworking, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. It is thanks to her children that she has a smile every day when she wakes up to go to her farm.

Betty is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Betty offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business.

Being a caring and loving mum, Betty has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. She also has a side hustle business to supplement the income she earns through farming.

Although Betty reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that is dragging her down and preventing her from reaching the top of the skies is lack of enough land to farm. For this reason, Betty is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities.

Having so much experience in farming, Betty is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions. Betty is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. Betty has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan.

Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman! She aspires to have a very productive fourth quarter for the year.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 50 años de edad el cual busca un aliento monetario para iniciar un negocio de venta de arepas, pues actualmente se encuentra desempleado y necesita encontrar una manera de generar ingresos para mantener a su familia y en especial a su hija de 15 años de edad.
Rafael siempre se caracterizó por trabajar duro y ganarse su propio sustento, por ello busca adoptar una medida rápida y evitar que su familia pase necesidad alguna.
El dinero será destinado en la compra de un horno de carbón, carbón y maíz para elaborar las arepas.
texts.en:
Rafael is 50 years old. He is applying for a loan to start a business selling arepa pancakes. At the moment he is unemployed and needs to find a means to earn an income to support his family, particularly his 15 year old daughter.

Rafael has always been known for hard work and earning a living. He is looking for a quick means to do this and avoid his family lacking for anything. The money is to be used to buy a coal oven, coal and maize to produce arepa pancakes.

loans.use: to buy a coal oven, coal and maize to make arepa pancakes.

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
Carmen simplemente es una mujer sorprende, una mujer de 60 años de edad que vive en el sector rural de Chigorodó, a sus 60 años de edad tiene el orgullo de decir que dio vida, mantuvo, alimento, crío a un total de 9 hijos ella sola, con su negocio de cría de animales, como ven en la foto su hogar es muy humilde, pero ella ama su tierrita, aquí ha vivido todas sus experiencias y continúa trabajando para no pasar necesidades.
Carmen quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos, compra de cerdos, alimento y vitaminas y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.
texts.en:
Carmen is a simply astonishing woman. She is 60 years old and lives in the rural area of Chigorodó. At 60 years of age, she is proud to say that she gave life, upbringing, food, and care to a total of 9 children, all by herself and with financing from her business raising animals. As you can see in the photo, her home is very humble. But, she loves her little piece of land. All of her experiences have been here and she continues to work so that she has what she needs.
Carmen wants to request a loan to buy chickens, pigs, feed, and vitamins, and materials to build a barn.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, feed, vitamins, and materials to build a barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bananas and pigs to increase the products of his business and his earnings.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and has two children. She is a smallholder farmer practicing dairy, poultry, horticulture and tree farming to provide for her family. She enjoys what she does, and it is her means of securing the basic necessities of life.

In the Nandihills area of Kenya where she comes from, most people depend on agriculture for a living. The people there live and work on small farms. Their biggest challenge is the huge lack of access to agricultural inputs, meaning that farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya so that farmers in Nandihills can now buy vital inputs for use on their farms.

Gladys is seeking a 20,000 KES loan to buy quality seed, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm’s productivity. This will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, give her income to repay her loan and elevate her family’s quality of life.

Her positive attitude and the desire to get ahead demonstrate in this individual a great willingness to improve herself, and she hopes for a favorable response to her request. Be inspired and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to improve her farm's productivity.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a mother of four from Nyamira, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, tea and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Penina is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals.

Penina wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Penina will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save any extra money.

Penina is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Penina’s dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Con la ilusión, la alegría y la esperanza de iniciar su vida como independiente la señora Gloria quiere solicitar un préstamo para montar un negocio de cría de aves, la principal razón es que necesita con urgencia recursos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, ella es madre de 3 hijos, dos varones de 2 y 4 años de edad y la mujer que también tiene 4 años de edad.
Gloria se sueña con tener una casa propia, decorarla y adornarla con todo lo que a ella le parece lindo, tener la seguridad de estar en un terreno propio y poder dejarles una herencia a sus hijos.
Anímate a participar en este préstamo, tu ayuda significara una oportunidad de progresos para una familia colombiana.
texts.en:
With eagerness, happiness, and hope to start her life as an independent person, Gloria wants to request a loan to establish a poultry-raising business. The primary reason is that she urgently needs resources to cover the needs of her home. She is the mother of 3 children: two males aged 2 and 4, and a female who is also 4.

Gloria dreams of having her own house, decorating it and adorning it with everything that she finds pretty, having the security of being on her own land, and to be able to give an inheritance to her children. Go for it and participate in this loan. Your help will mean the opportunity for progress for a Colombian family.

loans.use: to start a poultry-raising business.

loans.name: Luz Nedy

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Nelly una mujer práctica, trabajadora, una ama de casa protectora y amorosa que en sus tiempos libres se dedica a elaborar alimentos todo lo hace por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por crear ilusión de progreso, por darle la oportunidad a sus 4 hijos de estudiar y formarse de buena manera para la vida.
Luz Nelly quiere dar un gran paso en su negocio y dedicarse de lleno a la venta de alimentos, por ello se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para la compra de un enfriador, utensilios de cocina y surtido, puesto que con los ingresos que tiene actualmente no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos que tiene y necesita generar mayores ingresos para apoyar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz Nelly is a practical and hardworking woman. She is a housewife who is loving and protects her family. In her free time she works making food - she does everything to improve her family's living conditions, to show progress, and to give her 4 children the opportunity to study and prepare themselves for life in a good way.
Luz Nelly wants to take a big step with her business and devote herself to selling food. For this reason, she is requesting economic support to buy a frier and kitchen utensils. Her current income is not enough to cover these expenses and she needs to generate greater profits to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a frier and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, shrits, skirts, pants, and beauty products to increase her stock and her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in jocotes, okras and other fruits to increase her sales, and thus increase her income.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Judy, a mother of eight from Kamobo, a rural village in the Nandihills area of Kenya.

Judy has been involved in farming for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and other personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable but also enjoyable: all the animals on her farm are referred to by names.

The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital. Judy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry is a big business if made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point.

Invest in Judy's future. The income she will generate from her poultry farm alone is enough to facilitate timely loan repayments and savings. The loan will help Judy’s family improve their quality of life.

Judy has many dreams but almost all of them are for the wellbeing of her eight children. Support Judy so she can achieve all her goals and can give her family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 37-year-old farmer from a remote village in Nyaramba in the Nyamira area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last 5 years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry, sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Grace will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Esther, an ever-smiling young farmer from Nandihills County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years.

Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business in order to make ends meet. Esther passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cow gives her great joy.

She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk.

Esther is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and learned the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Judith. She lives in the Chuka area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in tea plantations.

Judith is a mother of three and she has been in the agriculture business for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. Judith has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as for fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices, are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Judith remains positive and passionate about her economic activity.

Judith is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of her business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high.

With this loan, Judith will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will cultivate better quality produce and increase her yields.

This loan will support Judith’s economic activity and will change her family’s living standards indirectly. Her greatest dream is to grow her business and be able to pay for her children's studies. She knows that with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva lenders, she will be able to make her hopes into reality.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. She has been taking care of her poultry for ten years. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Nyamira area. Annah has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high.

She has always wanted to increase her poultry, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Annah can achieve their dreams and goals. Annah believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is happily married and blessed with four children. For the past 10 years she has been engaging in mixed farming and through selling milk and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Esther makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Esther comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity”.

Being 52 years of age, she faces challenges carrying water on her back. Esther is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes.
