Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain fed agriculture but Esther wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water which always goes to waste and store it in the tanks. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan Esther will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption.

Esther is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Esther’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to store rain water and water pipes and pump

loans.name: Melvi Alberto

texts.es:
Melvi es un hombre de 36 años de edad, es casado con una hermosa familia de tres hijas  de las edades entre 1 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea chocola.
Melvi para mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura cultivando café, esta actividad lo realiza el desde hace 20 años. Melvi con el afán de obtener este año una buena cosecha de café, está solicitando un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.  Su esperanza de vida, es tener su propia casa, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y fortalecer mejor su cultivo.
texts.en:
Melvi is a 36-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with three daughters between the ages of 1 and 12. This humble family lives in a community in the village of Chocolá. To improve his income and help his family get ahead, Melvi makes a living in agriculture by growing coffee. He has been in this line of work for 20 years.

Melvi, with the desire to have a good coffee harvest this year, is requesting a loan to cover the cost of buying fertilizers and to pay labor. His life dream is to have his own house, to improve his family's quality of life, and to better strengthen his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, which is known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming.

Doreen has so much experience in pig farming, having done it for the past 10 years, that she is considered one of the best farmers in her village. Her primary source of income is selling pig meat, milk, eggs and crops. Doreen has space on her farm that is unused, and she wants to use it to keep pigs. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy pigs.

The loan will help Doreen to improve her living conditions, and the conditions of her four children by providing them with a solid education. She believes education is the “key to success”.

The Chuka area has a large population and a ready market for pork. Hence, Doreen will not have a problem selling the pork and increasing her income level. She is very disciplined with finances and she is sure that, through accumulated profits, she will open a large, pork-selling butchery and will be able to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Ruzihol

texts.ru: Рузихол родилась и выросла в семье дехкана. Ее родители и родственники занимались и занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Многие жители района Шахритус занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности, они выращивает скота и работает на земле. Работать на земле не легкий труд. Дехкани сильные, активные и трудолюбивые люди. Рузихол тоже из района Шахритус. Ей 40 лет. Она выращивает растение у себя на земле. Рузихол 5 лет назад начала продвигать  деятельность мужа. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Ей в работе помогает ее дети. У нее имеет двоих детей. Рузихол посадила пшеницу, и скоро сбор урожай. Готовится к сбору урожай, она хочет получить качественный и  здоровый урожай. Рузихолу нужна минеральные удобрение для отработки урожай. Для купли минеральных удобрений требуется большая сумма денег, но у Рузихол их нет. По этой причине Она просит Вас дать ей необходимую сумму. Рузихол верит в Вас и на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ruzihol was born and raised in a family of farmers. Her family and parents worked and currently work in agriculture, like many residents of the Shahrituz region, who raise livestock and work the land. Working the land is not an easy task. Farmers are strong, active and hardworking people. Ruzihol is also from the Shahrituz region. She is 40 and grows crops on her own land. She started taking over her husband's business five years ago, as he is working in Russia. Her two children help her with the work. 

Ruzihol has planted wheat and it will soon be time to harvest it. She is preparing for the harvest and wants to receive a high-quality and healthy harvest. She needs mineral fertilizers to do so but they are very expensive and she doesn't have enough money. She is asking you to lend her the required amount. She believes in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es: Don Jose de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el es un hombre muy trabajador quien se dedica desde hace 20 años a la administracion de su tienda y un molino de nixtamal el cual los inicio con capital propio y es asi como ha podido salir adelante con sus gastos, Don Jose esta solicitando un credito a INTEGRAL para poder surtir su tienda con mas productos como: sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. todo por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos economicos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Jose is 65 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife. He is a very hardworking man who has been running his store and corn mill for 20 years. He started his business with his own capital and this is how he has been able to cover his expenses. Don Jose is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to be able to supply his store with more products such as: soup, eggs, staple grains, sodas, candy, cakes, etc, all wholesale. This will give him better income and a better quality of life for him and his wife.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, staple grains, sodas, candy, cake, etc, all wholesale.

loans.name: Marie Conney

texts.en:
Marie Conney is a single woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marie Conney is 26 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marie Conney has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Marie Conney requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marie Conney has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Marie Conney would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Rogelia has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Rogelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a youthful, 41-year-old farmer from Chebiemit, a remote village in Kapsowar area of Kenya where people live in mud and shanties houses made from whatever materials they can find, usually sheets of corrugated tin. Within the remote village of Chebiemit Esther is working hard to pull herself out of the dismal conditions. Most small-holder farmers view Esther as a role model and a mentor because of the resilience that she has despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her five children as a primary caregiver. Esther started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her husband, who dedicated his 2 acres, she has grown the business dramatically.

She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines. She keeps dairy cattle and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as maize. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Esther is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Esther will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her six children who are in public schools. Esther can buy more land and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to buy more land and expand her farming.

loans.name: Fidenis

texts.en:
Fidenis is from Nandihills, Kenya, with a fierce entrepreneurial spirit. She lives in a humble home along with her husband and their four children. Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Fidenis enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past five years. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of dairy farming, Fidenis offers extension services to other farmers who are new to the business. Being a caring and loving mother, Fidenis has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming.

Fidenis is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. Having so much experience in farming, Fidenis is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profit levels. Through the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions. Fidenis is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Mamdouh

texts.en: Mamdouh is 40, married and, has one son and one daughter. He has a small poultry (chickens and ducks) sales and a meat grinder project. He is requesting 10,000 EGP loan to buy chickens and ducks and a deep freezer to sell frozen meat, fish and chicken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks and a deep freezer to sell frozen meat.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 47 years old is very clear about what she wants in life and determined to get ahead and have a good life. She is a smallholder farmer from Nkubu in the Central region of Kenya. Mary owns a half-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The mother of two keeps dairy animals and grows maize and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. Mary is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. Loans for smallholder farmers with little irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Mary. According to Juhudi Kilimo, horticulture represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled.

Mary is kindly seeking for a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of the favorable weather and road conditions she will have an easy time transporting her horticulture products to the market. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Mary because the institution believes that women too are actively involved in various segments of the horticultural industry. Her main dream is to buy a house and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mother's Union Group

texts.en:
Scolastica is a woman aged forty-three, a divorcee with two children, who also takes care of her mother and brother whom she stays with at their family house. She is member of Mothers Union group that has four other members and she is the Chairperson. Scolastica started her cross border career in 2008, the era of economic crisis in Zimbabwe. When she started this job she operated from a flea market in Warren Park, a high-density area in Harare capital, she was mainly selling baby wear from South Africa and Botswana.

Around 2012 the baby wear market was flooded due to increased competition as many people also ventured into the same trade, so she had to begin selling adult clothes and footwear, and she procured these from Dubai. When she started selling clothes her sales levels improved and so did her standards of living. She managed to buy a residential stand.

Currently, the challenge she faces is the high cost of running this business in terms of transportation and rentals at her market table. She cannot move from that location as it is strategically positioned. She needs an injection of working capital so that she procures the clothes and shoes in bulk from Dubai so that she does not make several trips and reduce the cost of transport. The group wants to borrow $1650 and Scholastica’s portion is $400 to be used in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in bulk from Dubai so that she does not have to make so many trips.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Meet Caroline, an ever-smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 25 years of age. She hails from the Litein area of Kenya, which is home to some of the best athletes in the world. She is the proud mother of one lovely school-going child that she values and treasures, and will go an extra mile to make sure that she is comfortable.

Caroline’s primary source of income has been milk selling, crop farming and poultry farming; through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been practicing farming for five years. Throughout those years, she has never regretted venturing into farming.

Caroline sells her vegetables, eggs, and milk to the nearby market. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very thankful that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family. She has always yearned to have more dairy cows.

Caroline is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow, and has already identified the type that she will buy. The cow will produce between 15-20 liters of milk per day. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as “the ideal drinking milk” because it will not lack an adequate amount of fat and will possess desirable quantities of protein.

This cow will certainly boost milk production in her farm, which will translate to more sales and better income for her and her family. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

You can be part of this beautiful story of Caroline that is about to begin. A loan will help her a lot.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: bananas and papayas to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 55 years old, is independent and runs her own mixed farming business. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hard working than others. Ester owns a 0.7 acre piece of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. The land provides her with not only capital for her business but also a home for her family. She is blessed to have five children and a husband.

Ester is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for her food and her business. The demand for cereals in the market, only a few kilometers from Ester's home, is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests.

Your loan will directly elevate Ester’s livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in. The work that Ester does to survive deserves an applause and it is a good idea to help her with the support she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Josphine started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells dairy goat and cow milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Josphine believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Josphine only purpose is to get ahead, not to depend on anyone and support her family unconditionally and for them not to suffer hardships and to progress each day.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, from the Eldoret area of Kenya, left her peanut paying job to become a smallholder farmer. She decided to be independent and contribute to her community by practicing mixed farming. For Caroline, deciding to practice poultry farming was not difficult.

Caroline is married and blessed with four lovely children who she refers to as “my heart beat”. Her primary sources of income come from selling milk, farming poultry, and a personal business that supplements her meager income.

For the past five years, Caroline has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and she wants to increase her poultry, but the biggest challenge is a lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry.

Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is profitable and less strenuous than other activities. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high.

With your loan, Caroline is going to earn more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Caroline is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met. You could be part of this dream, come on, and make a loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Sasinta

texts.en:
The picture above presents Sasinta, a woman in her late thirties from the Chuka area of Kenya. She is a young farmer practicing mixed farming. Her community is not known for farming, but she has been earning so much through agriculture.

For the past 10 years, her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and a variety of crops she plants. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit.

Through the loan she will have an easier time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a proper place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Sasinta believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Sasinta waits for your kindness. She loves her children and is committed in giving them a good quality life. She hopes that one day she can buy a house where they both can live safely. You can be part of this story by loaning and supporting Sasinta, a little trust in her will help her a lot.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Five years ago Grace started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Miruka, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Today, this mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Nyamira area. Grace has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Grace can achieve their dreams and goals. Grace believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Born in 1991, Gladys has grown into a strong and independent woman. She has been able to hold her family of two children together and provide for them. She is a mixed farmer, who grows maize and vegetables for both consumption and sale. She also keeps dairy cows and runs a small business.

Gladys is seeking a loan, with which she intends to purchase a high-quality dairy cow. The dairy business is very profitable in this area. Most families rely on milk to feed their children and prepare their meals. Ugali is the staple food of people from the Siongiroi area of Kenya, where Kamagiboi village lies. Milk is also an ingredient in the preparation of vegetables. The heavy reliance on milk allows dairy farmers to do well in this region. Milk prices are always high because of the high demand. Little product marketing is required here, because milk is milk.

With your loan, Gladys will not only reduce the amount of money she must spend on milk for the family, but also she will increase her income from the sale of milk. She will use the profits to grow the business and to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a high-quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
With seven good-looking children to take care of, water to fetch, and food to cook, Alice has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities to her family are important, it’s a job that is normally not given enough attention and gets little appreciation. With the little time Alice has, she sells vegetables from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry.

With support from Kiva lenders, Alice is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, since it increases employment and generates income, the government of Kenya takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Alice access to a loan that will aid the growth of her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about commercialization of the rural sector.

Through this loan, Alice will be able to sell more vegetables to both the local market and the neighboring market. Her family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Kindly help out this enterprising woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Deysi Margarita

texts.es: Deysi de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños desde hace 2 años y es gracias a su trabajo y ayuda del esposo como han podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas variedad de ropa por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Deysi is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has been working selling clothing for women, men and children for two years. Thanks to this work and the help of her husband they have been able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of clothing wholesale so she can continue with her work and be able to obtain greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 41-year-old married woman with a family. They all live in a town called Kerugoya. Kerugoya doesn’t offer the best opportunities, but she has learned to deal with that. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize-growing regions, lending it the nickname “maize region of Kenya.”

For the past 10 years, Leah has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. The biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said.

Leah is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money.

Through this loan, Leah will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business. Help Leah make her dreams come true; this loan can change her life. Lend to her to keep her big smile!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Flor De Guadalupe

texts.es: Flor de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres y su hermana. Flor en busca de aportar a la economía del hogar y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero. Este negocio lo administra desde hace 4 años aproximadamente en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, también confecciona vestidos para todo tipo de ocasión. Flor desea mejorar su condición de vida para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el suelo de su vivienda colocando ladrillo de piso y así mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 21 years old and lives together with her parents and her sister. Flor, looking to contribute to the household economy and satisfy the basic needs of her family, works selling clothing for women and men. She has run this business for about four years in the market located close to her community. She also sews clothing for all types of occasions.

Flor wants to improve her living conditions so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in cement, sand, floor tiles and pay for labor to improve the floor of her house installing floor tiles, improving her style of living.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, floor tiles and pay for labor to improve the floor of her house.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Pauline, a 32-year-old mrembo (beautiful woman) who is humble, honest and a very hardworking mum on this planet Earth. Pauline adores her lovely family very much. She will always do anything good to keep them from going to bed with hungry stomachs.

Pauline hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya. She has never had the opportunity to advance her education and get a whitecollar job, but this has not killed her dream of wanting to succeed in life. She has been farming for the past six years. Throughout these years, she has gathered much experience and has all the farming techniques at her fingertips.

Pauline practises mixed farming on her farm. With her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key" to success.

Pauline is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seeds and begin horticulture farming on her farm. Pauline wants to take advantage of, and reap more profits from, favorable weather patterns, her village's good road network, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Pauline turn their farming dreams into realities through training and loan financing. Pauline hopes that she will improve her living conditions through this loan. Her dreams and projections are, by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but also in international markets through fruit and vegetable exports. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time.

Pauline is an unselfish mum and also wants to have a positive impact on society. She will do so by employing people to work on her horticulture farm.

Contribute to this mum’s life. Grant her a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to pull through, overcoming different obstacles that have arisen in her life. She is a mother of one, and from Nandi Hills, a remote town in the Rift valley province of Kenya.

Joan has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Joan is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart.

Joan wants to diversify and start a business selling cereals. She is requesting a loan to buy cereals to sell. The Nandi Hills area has a ready market for cereals, but the problem is that there are no cereal suppliers. With your loan, Joan will be able to sell cereal to the local market and to her neighbors. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Joan is very concerned about her child’s education, so profits from selling cereal will go to pay her school fees. She dreams of a secure future for her child. Joan awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, 46, is an entrepreneur who builds dreams and hopes. She is a smallholder farmer who works 12 hours a day at her farm in order to support her family and give them opportunities.
Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

Sabina is an ambitious woman who always seeks her horizon. Since she was little, she showed a strong passion for independent work, but when she became pregnant, she left behind many of her dreams to focus completely on taking care of her little ones.

Since her children are at a good age, she wants to take up her dreams again and create work to maintain herself, since she doesn't know when her husband might be lacking or when they would go through a very complicated situation. Her primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for ten years, and throughout she has never regretted going into farming.

She faces financial challenges, and because the Nkubu area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

This ever-smiling mother has been making great improvements and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life.

She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Sabina is quite a visionary and, with her accumulated profits, she hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a wife, mother, and farmer with 12 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Nyamira, Kenya with her two children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”.

Although this humble and ever smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Priscah has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This loan will be a turning point in Priscah’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Twenty-five years ago, Margaret started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of 10 children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She also does some side hustle business. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltered place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain and sun.

Margaret believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

Margaret waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in windows, a fuse box, and electrical cables to install her own electrical energy and also to change the window in her home.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is ambitious, admirable, and a hard worker who wants to triumph. At 36 years old, she is independent and runs her own mixed farming business. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. Peres owns a small parcel of land that she uses to grow maize and keep dairy animals. She has also planted trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. She is blessed with a lovely family!

Peres is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish stock for her food and her business. The demand for cereals in the market, only a few kilometers from Peres's home, is up. By placing herself in a position to supply cereal seeds and still be a cereal farmer, she gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. Your loan will directly elevate Peres’s livelihood. She strives to give her family a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in. Kindly loan to her!

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Mathilda Palpitar And Group

texts.en:
Mathilda is 44 year old widowed lady who lives with her teenaged child in the Jhabua district of Madhya Pradesh. She is the sole earner in the family, therefore she works diligently to earn for her family. She runs a sewing business. Currently she earns Rs. 2000 every month. She is worried that her current rate of earning would not help her sustain her family in the long run. She thus wants to expand her business and increase her monthly earning. She will use the loan amount to purchase materials to sew clothing, bed sheets, cushion covers, etc.

Mathilda leads a group of 5 women – Mathilda, Ranjita, Reshma, Sadhna and Basanti. Together they need a group loan of Rs. 75000 to expand their respective businesses. They are grateful to their lenders for the financial support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase materials to sew clothing, bed sheets, etc and expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Sohrat

texts.en: Sohrat is 38 years old and married. Sohrat's family consists of 2 children and his wife. He is IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives with family in Bilesuvar refugee settlement. He is a farmer and Sohrat has started his work about 12 years ago. He has gained a lot of experience at work, but currently he is not happy about the situation of his farm. Due to small size of the business he cannot earn good income. He requires funds to expand and improve business. He loves his family and knows that with grown and expanded business he can also improve his family conditions. Therefore he applied for a 1200AZN loan. He will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tool

loans.name: Emilliah

texts.en:
With 4 children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Emilliah, who is an ever-smiling woman of character and goodwill, has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are critical to her family’s well-being, they are considered a mere duty in Kenya, a job with little appreciation. Her primary sources of income are dairy farming, eggs and some personal business that she engages in.

Emilliah is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva lenders to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily-rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Emilliah access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector.

With your loan, Emilliah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Lenders, if there is someone you should consider lending to, then that person is Emilliah!
With your support she will be able to make her dreams a reality, go ahead and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Aida works very hard to provide for them.

Aida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, drinks, spices, noodles and other products.

Aida has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, drinks, spices, noodles and other products.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
The lack of capital has been a great worry in the life of Annah, a woman who is dedicated in body and soul to agriculture. For the past ten years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Annah says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” She likes farming so much that she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cows, she is able to get between 10-15 liters of milk a day, and this helps her support her family.

Annah also practices crop farming. She has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through this loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production.

Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

Annah believes that through this loan, she will be able to turn around her family's life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Annah’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements such as high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Manuela Gregoria

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer indiscutiblemente trabajadora, dedicada a su familia con 24 años de edad, con dos hijos de las edades entre 3 y 5 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad del caserío pochol.
Manuela para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo realiza ella desde hace 6 años. Manuela con el afán de mejorar su cultivo a decidió solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 3 cuerdas de terreno que lo utilizara para cultivo de tomate y frijol. Este préstamo contribuirá para que su cultivo incremente. Su esperanza de vida es comprar más terrenos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuela is unquestionably a hard-working woman, dedicated to her family. She is 24 years old and has two children between the ages of 3 and 5 years old. This beautiful family lives in the community of Pochol.

In order to obtain her income and support her family Manuela works buying and selling traditional clothing. She has done this business for 6 years. Manuela with the desire to improve her farming has decided to request a loan to buy three cuerdas (a local land measurement) of land to grow tomatoes and beans. This loan will contribute to increasing her crops. Her wish in life is to buy more land and improve her economic income.

loans.use: to buy three cuerdas (local land measurement) of land to grow tomatoes and beans.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret aged 39, is a very hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming.

Margaret practices mixed farming. She grows maize and keeps dairy cows, and through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. Although Margaret has been making profits through farming, her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases.

That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and buy seeds so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change.
You can help this hard worker mother to accomplish all her dreams, a loan will get her a lot closer to that.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and expand her horticulture business.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Jemima, one of the most hardworking women on planet Earth. Jemima, 53, has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. She has always had the strength to overcome it, however, and move forward with her six children. She is very hardworking and a go-getter.

Jemima hails from Rianyaundi, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions. To survive, you must have tough skin, but Jemima has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 41 years.

Jemima's primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also earns income through personal business. Jemima is contented with the farming way of life. Although she has never had a formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and assured her children and family a decent meal.

The Nyamira area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, which is why she is seeking a loan for this purpose. Because of good roads, a good climate and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a mature woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Jemima is relieved that institutions such as Kiva help enterprising women like herself.

Jemima is well-disciplined with finances. With her accumulated profits, she plans to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children, who are in college. Please help Jemima so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and earn a better income for her six children.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Lydia, a youthful 31-year-old Mrembo (beautiful woman), a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Nandihills, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Lydia's farming experience dates back to 2010.

Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which she has been planting for as long as she can remember. She also does dairy farming. With time, the fertility of her land has started to dwindle and whenever she plants maize the yields go down with each cropping season. Lydia has also been affected with weeds. At some point she could not be assured of harvesting anything at all.

Today, Lydia is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds. Through this loan Lydia is going to increase her crop production and this will translate to an improved income level. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Lydia; there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in farming.

Change the life of this farmer, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña maria de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 7 años, su esposo trabaja como agricola y entre los dos ha sacado adelante su hogar, hoy ella quiere comparar mas materia prima para seguir con su trabajo como: chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes ya que le va bien en su negocio y asi podra tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband and daughter. She has worked selling pupusas [filled tortillas] for 7 years. Her husband works as a farmer, and between the two of them, they have successfully supported their household. Now she would like to buy more raw materials in order to continue with her work, such as pork, cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients, since her business is going well for her, and in this way she can have better earnings for an improved quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 53 year old Lebanese widow mother of three children. In 1997, she started her own business, by opening in her house a small room for vending lingerie with her special selling methods and by giving a high quality of products.. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise with a special new clothing collections, to meet the needs of her clients, in order to increase her income. Marie is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special new clothing collections.

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
Jingle is 31 years old and married with two children.

Jingle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Jingle has not borrowed or repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jingle aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lanie is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending such as sugar, salt, rice, fish, etc.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending such as sugar, salt, rice, fish, etc.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelia is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelia has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipments needed like spare parts, etc..

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipments needed like spare parts, etc.

loans.name: Borik

texts.en:
Borik is greatly thankful for his already two partnerships with Kiva and he will be happier if he manages also his third deal with Kiva lenders. Borik with his wife lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Their children are married and they live with their families. Borik used to have his businesses of small food market also production of soft drinks, but he gave up all of it but never his farming that he runs in a nearby village Chapni.

Beekeeping is the main occupation that Borik is engaged in. He also has large plot of land on which he cultivates beans, potato, greens and also fruits such as apple, pear, peach and grapes. All his farm goods Borik sells to his regular customers who already many years used to buy his farm products. Especially his farm’s honey is of high quality and it is very tasty. Now this loan of 350.000 Armenian drams Borik asks he wants to buy beehives and also seedlings of potato and beans.

loans.use: to buy beehives and also seedlings of potato and beans

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en: Bernadetha has been involving in business activities for a few years.  She started with her own working capital. She has a kiosk in her house and she is taking the loan of $1500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, she will use to buy additional supplies with the loan including candies, biscuits, shampoo, aqua, noodles, cooking oils, nuts, coffee, sugar, including soft drinks and other things to sell. She is very happy when the Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, because she can use this loan to improving her business, because she has plan to open a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, shampoo, aqua, noodles, cooking oils, nuts, coffee, sugar, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, a 56-year-old farmer from Kagere, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her five children as a primary caregiver. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been crop farming and also keeping dairy cows.

Jenifer is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the dairy unit she will have a humble time milking her cow and her cow will not be affected with the harsh weather conditions such as rain and heat from the sun. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Jenifer believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of people who are living below the poverty line could be reduced by half.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Pooja Vijaya And Group

texts.en:
Pooja is a widow at the young age of 23 years. She lives in Madhya Pradesh with her teenaged child. She single-handedly manages her household. She is finding it very hard to make ends meet with the limited household income. She has thus decided to start a sewing business to add a source of income. But she does not have the funds to start her business.

Pooja leads a group of five women who, just like her, need a loan to start their businesses to support their families financially. She has therefore applied for a group loan. She will use the loan amount to purchase materials to sew clothes. The loan will allow this group of women to start their respective businesses. They thank their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to start her sewing business

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 36-year-old married mother of four children. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Ibtissam hopes to continue supporting her children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sergio Bladimir

texts.es: Sergio de 24 años de edad, habita en casa propia al lado de su madre y su hermana de 15 años de edad. Él en busca de mantener la economía del hogar y velar porque no le falte nada a su familia, presta sus servicios en una empresa de salud pública. Gracias a su humilde empleo logra solventar sus necesidades. La casa en la que habita es humilde y ha sido construida con adobes tal y como se puede observar en la foto, Sergio con el afán de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para encementar las paredes de su vivienda. De esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio is 24 years old. He lives in his own home beside his mother and his 15-year-old sister. In search of maintaining the economy of his home and to look after his family so they don't need for anything, he works for a public health company. Thanks to his humble employment, he can pay for the necessities.

The house he lives in is modest and has been built with adobe, as can be observed in the photo. Sergio, with the desire to improve the quality of his life, is asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in sand, cement and to pay the labor to cement over the walls of his home. This would improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement and to pay the labor to cement over the walls of his home

loans.name: Karina Del Carmen

texts.es: Karina de 20 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 8 meses de edad y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Karina en busca de satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero. Este negocio lo administra desde hace varios años, labor que realiza en las cercanías a su comunidad. Ella desea mejorar su condición de vida para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: duralita y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que debido al paso del tiempo se ha ido deteriorado y ella desea ofrecerle un hogar seguro a su hijo.
texts.en: Karina is 20 years old and lives with her 8-year-old son and her life partner, who helps her support the household. In search of a way to fulfill her family's basic needs, she started selling clothing for men and women. She has operated this business for several years, and she works in the areas around her community. She would like to improve her living conditions, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in Duralita roofing sheets and to pay for labor to improve the roof of her home, since over the course of time it has deteriorated, and she wants to offer her child a safe home.

loans.use: to invest in Duralita roofing sheets and to pay for labor to improve the roof of her home.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy’s business involvement is on direct selling and variety store. She named her business as MKZ KELZ Enterprises. She offers tupperware, Natasha, cosmetic products, MSE and herbal supplements. She has been in this kind of business for three years.

Daisy is 31 years old and living with her live-in partner and two children.She aims for continuous smooth flow of her business and increase the income she generate but her capital is not sufficient. She is seeking for financial assistance in the amount of requested for a loan of PHP50,000. She will use this loan amount in buying more stocks of tupperware,cosmetic products, shoes, sandals and blouses to sell. She knows that she could further improve her living condition and educate her children someday.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tupperware, cosmetic products, shoes, sandals and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fely is 57 years old now.

Fely has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spices, fish, meat, etc..

Fely has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Fely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spices, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en: Lucinda is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of second hand clothes. And she is taking loan because she wants use to buy more like men's trousers, men's shorts, long pants girl, shorts, girl.  She is selling second hand clothes but she selling only pants and shorts for men and women. She started to do this business a few years ago, with her own working capital. Lucinda is earning a good income from selling her second hand clothes because many people like to buy it, it is cheap and unique. If compare to new clothes.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers, men's shorts, long pants girl, shorts, girl.

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter, a 35-year-old ever smiling woman has been actively involved in farming for the last two years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Wilter is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be used in feeding the poultry; sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy, and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg output, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins.

Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that could have been spent in buying fertilizer. Wilter’s goal is to save more money so that she can go back to school and through your loan she will realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Joean

texts.en:
Joean is 32 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Joean is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Joean has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Meet Jackline, 28, an ever-smiling, hardworking, honest mother. She is proud of her lovely five-year-old. She loves and treasures her child and will go the extra mile to make sure that she is comfortable.

Jackline hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for five years. Throughout this time, she has never regretted going into farming. Her primary sources of income have come from selling milk, crop farming and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income.

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges. Because the Nkubu area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is seeking a loan to buy cereals for resale and thus improve her income.

Jackline’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements. She is quite a visionary. Through your loan, she believes that she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. With her accumulated profits, she hopes to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, microfinance institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Jackline has received training and has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ciani

texts.en:
Ciani, who is a 48-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. Ciani has a small shop and her husband is an employee for two years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Ciani will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo is the careful mother of 3 childrenbecause her husband is a migrant in Russia. Muhayo has been busy with sewing business more than 2 years. She services her clients in her house where she has a workshop. Muhayo sews variety of national Tajik dresses. She also makes embroidery.

Muhayo is going to buy new sewing machine and in this way to improve business. She is asking for a loan of 2400 Somoni to buy sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 36 years old and married. He has four children. He lives in Sangay Daku, Ozamiz city, Misamis Occidental.

Benjie owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2014 and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair his motorcycle and purchase spare parts.

His dream is to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

location.town: sangay daku, ozamiz city, Mis. Occ

loans.name: Cora

texts.en: Cora is a 38-year-old woman from Albuera, Leyte. She is married and has five children; ages 19, 18, 16, 6 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver while Cora operates various businesses such as running a sari-sari store (general store), raising pigs and is also engaged in selling food (barbecue) business. Cora describes her biggest business challenge is to have insufficient capital. This is the reason why she is asking for a bigger amount of loans. She will buy grocery items such as drinks, sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies. She will also buy piglets and feed as well. Aside from this, she needs to buy dressed chicken for her barbecue business. Cora’s main goal in life is to augment their livelihood for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits and candies; piglets and feed; dressed chicken

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Belly

texts.en:
Belly is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a tricycle passenger in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy wheel and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like welding shop business.

Belly dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheel and spare parts for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and married with six children.  With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, snack food and personal care products. 

In the future Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Phares

texts.en:
Phares is a smallholder farmer in the central province area of Kenya, where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. His main source of income is milk. Phares aspires to growing his business, making a better income and taking good care of his wife and four children.

One way that Phares can improve his business is by ensuring that his cows are more productive. He used his previous loan to buy poultry. Today, he is seeking a loan to help him introduce zero-grazing to his farm. The loan will be used to buy tools and materials for constructing a cow shed that contains a confined feeding area for the stock.

After implementing the zero-grazing technique, Phares expects to cut costs and increase his income by using the grazing land to grow fodder and vegetables. As well, since the cows will not have to constantly move around for pasture, their energy will be concentrated on producing milk.

Your loan investment will change Phares's business and improve his family's livelihood. Be inspired and make a loan to this hardworking Kenyan farmer!

loans.use: to introduce zero-grazing to his farm.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 61 years old, married with eight children.  

Sergia is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Sergia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sergia has been farming sugarcane for eleven years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sergia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jamsunah

texts.en:
Jamsunah is a 49-year-old widow widow with one son and one daughter. Jamsunah is a merchant. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Jamsunah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
The humid and rocky Kapoloseroi area, within Siongiroi, can be considered a hardship area. Despite this hardship, you find Emmy a hardworking farmer. She is a loving mum and has been farming for the past 10 years. Emmy passionately loves dairy farming. This can be attested to by the fact that she knows her cows, each individually, because she works with them twice a day, 365 days a year. She has even named one of them. Because she loves the cows, she makes sure she feeds them well and breeds them well too.

Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and some personal business that she engages in to make ends meet. The income she makes from selling milk, eggs, and crops is insufficient to meet her family's expenses, but she has still kept hope alive that she will improve.

She is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Juhudi Kilimo serves poor, smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, motorbikes, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses. Emmy's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and eggs; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market. One problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. The Siongiroi area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Emmy is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Using the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time, and she will reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Emmy is very determined to succeed, and because she is much disciplined with her finances, she plans that through accumulated profits she will be able to provide a secure future for herself, and for her parents also. All that Emmy waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver products, such as milk and vegetables, to the market when they are freshest.

loans.name: Sanju's Group

texts.en:
Sanju is a 30-year-old, sensible, charismatic, and hard-working lady standing to the left-hand side in the photograph. She hails from Narsinghpur, Odisha, India.

Sanju is a divorcee, but this factor has never broken her down nor has it come in her way in order to achieve her dreams and fulfil her ambitions. She lives with her mother, brother and her niece. Her strong willpower, determination and her patience and perseverance made her overcome all the hurdles in her life.

She is engaged in making colorful cushions for sofas, embroided bedsheets, vanity bags and cotton and baby kits. She sells her craft items in her home, and the big orders are sent by mode of public transport to the required customers, as going to the market and selling her products over there is not possible on her part due to her health issues.

Her brother helps in purchasing the raw materials from the markets in order to complete the orders on time. On average, she earns 4,000 INR every month, and during wedding seasons and other festivities, she gets a higher cashflow.

She, along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a good quality of cotton, which is quite expensive and of superior quality, colorful satin cloth and other materials like zips for making vanity bags, threads, colorful cotton cloth for baby kits and all other requirements for her business.

The loan amount will be fully invested in her running the business in order to get all the prerequisites.

loans.use: to purchase the requirements for her crafts business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 59, has been practicing mixed farming for the past twenty years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk, vegetables and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Esther has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for only the younger generation and not for the older generation like him. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. Although this humble farmer has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. Esther believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Patria from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental is happy to sew school and office uniforms, blouses, skirts, curtains, bed sheets and pillow cases depending on the need of her clients. She is nearing retirement age but she continues to do this job that she loves so much. This enterprise has been very beneficial in maintaining her household; and with this, she can extend financial help to her grandchildren.

Patria would like to avail of a loan worth PHP 9,000 that she will use in buying additional supplies of raw materials like fabrics, threads, and sewing accessories. From these, she can create more products that will bring more profit and savings for her. She is supported by her partner, Quirino, who also works as machine operator.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional raw materials like fabrics, threads, and sewing accessories

loans.name: Ana Mauricia

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de sus hijos de 12  y 13 años, su hija de 14 años de edad y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Ella vive en una humilde vivienda que está construida con láminas las cuales no están en muy buenas condiciones, y para solventar este problema decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos y pago de mano de obra para reparar su vivienda y colocar material nuevo y de mejor calidad. De esta manera poder brindarles seguridad y un hogar más digno a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She lives in her own home with her sons who are 12 and 13 years old, her daughter who is 14 years old, and her life partner who helps with the expenses of the home. Ana is a very hard-working person who works selling fruit and vegetables in the market that is near her community.

She lives in a humble home that is constructed with sheet metal that is not in very good condition. In order to resolve this problem she has decided to request a FUSAI loan to invest in sheet metal, nails, and to pay the labor to repair her home and to put on new material that is of better quality.
