In this way, she will be able to provide security and a more decent home for her children.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, nails and to pay the labor to repair her home and to put on new material of better quality.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients such as; sugar, wheat, butter, cooking oil etc

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Many people in Kenya are poor, and most of them find an opportunity in mixed farming to make a living and progress. Such is the case with Franklin, 39, who has gone through many adversities but has always put on a brave face.

Franklin resides in a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. He is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village. That is because of his resilience, in spite of personal challenges, and his passion to support his two children as a primary caregiver.

The living conditions in the Chuka area are very tough, and you need tough skin to survive. Franklin has always shown resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Franklin started practising mixed farming 10 years ago. His sources of income are vegetables, milk and eggs. These products, however, are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market.

The Chuka area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. This is why Franklin is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike as well as another quality dairy cow. With the motorbike, he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will be fresh. The dairy cow will produce more milk and meet the increased demand for it.

Franklin is determined to succeed. Because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans to provide a secure future for himself and his children through his accumulated profits. His dream is to provide a secure future for his children by paying their tuition fees. You will help him realize his dream through your loan.

For Franklin, nothing is impossible. He wants to continue working to fulfill his dream of becoming the lead supplier of farm produce and milk in his village.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for timely delivery of produce to the market as well as a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, a mother of four, lives in the remote village of Keberigo in Nyamira. This area is known to have high demand for poultry products. She practices mixed farming, keeping poultry and growing bananas, maize, and a variety of other food crops. Of all the activities in which she is involved, poultry farming is closest to her heart. Waking up every morning to collect eggs makes her very proud. Feeding her poultry is her hobby.

Margaret has always wanted to increase her poultry farming operation, because the demand is overwhelming, but the biggest challenge has been a lack of capital. Margaret has traits of a mobilizer, and she decided to mobilize other small-scale farmers who share this common problem. Together, they joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that uses a co-guarantee mechanism to provide agricultural loans. Margaret is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. With the loan, she will be able to buy more poultry and satisfy the overwhelming demand. Using the loan she will significantly increase her sales, and this will translate to more profits. Demand for chicken is high in Nyamira; it is a popular meal for many people, and fast food joints are always full.

Increased profits will allow Margaret to improve her living conditions and get out of the poverty-stricken situation she is currently in. In addition to the expected profits, she will benefit from using poultry manure, which has higher nitrogen than other livestock manure, to fertilize her crop land. Through the loan, Margaret sees a brighter future. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry birds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old, married with five children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries and also feed for her pigs.

Helen has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Piggery for eight years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet started farming seven years ago on a small inherited piece of land in Tharaka, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this mother of two children sells milk, eggs, vegetables, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions.

Linet believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Linet patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Safarinda

texts.en:
Safarinda is a 26-year-old married with two sons. Safarinda has been crediting electronic goods and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Safarinda will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Christovao

texts.en:
Christovao has build his house a few years ago, with his own working capital, and until now his house needs reapir and he has plan to rehabilitation his house. But his money is not enough to buy more materials to rehabilitation his house.

So now he is requesting a loan of $ 1,500.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add with his capital and than he will use this loan to buy materials like cement, sand, iron, nails, zinc, wood and others. Christovao happy, because Tuba Rai Metin can help him make the rehabilitation for his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, nails, zinc, wood and others.

loans.name: Geza Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her early 30s, married and has two kids in school. She has been supporting her family by running two projects i.e shop selling soft drinks, beer and chips selling. She has been in this business for ten years now, working from 11 am to 10 pm per working day. In a good working day, Christina is able to make a fair profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 3rd credit request to be apportioned among Geza five-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous credits, since paid back successfully, she bought more stocks of drinks like beer, sodas, water, juices and started selling chips. She is really doing great and shows some upgrades, having enough stock for her customers.

In the coming years, she would like to manage a business van to be able to supply stock to her customers. Christina will invest part of her credit to buy and resell soft drinks, beer, and chips at favourable prices.

loans.use: to buy and resell soft drinks, beer, and chips at favourable prices.

loans.name: Tirindi

texts.en:
irindi is a small-scale farmer who lives in the remote village of Kangutu in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with six children.

For the last 10 years, Tirindi has been engaged in mixed farming and has never looked back. Her primary sources of income have been sales of milk, eggs and crops as well as some personal business in which she engages to make ends meet. Tirindi finds farming very fulfilling and agrees with the notion that farming is a very profitable business venture. However, she constantly faces the challenge of poor productivity on her farm owing to a lack of farm inputs.

She is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as quality seeds and fertilizer that will increase her production levels, which will immediately translate into increased income levels. Tirindi is a very hard-working woman who believes that, through hard work and honest sweat, her living conditions will permanently change.

She will use the extra income she will receive to repay the loan and improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as quality seeds.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45-year-old farmer, a mother who is hardworking, humble and responsible. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. Beatrice and her husband are blessed with three children.

Beatrice has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs, cows for milk, and grows maize and vegetables for sale. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Beatrice is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Beatrice is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. With a loan, Beatrice seeks to continue growing a variety of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Nkubu and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.” She deserves support.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is having Inadequate funds to repair the motorcycle. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to repair and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a company. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as humble. She operates a butcher shop, where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of meat. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a stock of meat.

loans.name: Janerosa

texts.en:
JaneRosa, aged 51, is hopeful and happy at the idea that she can change her future and that of her family. She has been practicing farming for 10 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. JaneRosa enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs.

JaneRosa has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, JaneRosa will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family. Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.
\
She knows that, with the help of Juhudi Kilimo and the Kiva lenders, her dreams will become reality.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Millicent, a youthful, 28-year-old mrembo (beautiful woman). She is a wise farmer, whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in Kitale, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Millicent is happily married and, together with her husband, has been blessed with three lovely children. For the past 14 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been growing maize and vegetables, and keeping dairy cows. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Although she has been making profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with a challenge -- namely, delivering produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made her give up: “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Millicent mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Millicent is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge that has caused her to suffer too many losses. Perishable products, such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes, require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price. Through this loan, Millicent is going to achieve her dream and goal.

Accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle for women in Kenya. Millicent feels relieved now, to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo (with help from Kiva) that help out women, so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical, because she will never again suffer losses due to delay in delivery of her produce to the market. In addition, she will increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market, and this will increase her income level. Millicent is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping her in farm work. With profits earned using your loan, Millicent will improve her living conditions by building a good house, and will assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and hire a helper to transport her produce to market.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a brave, hardworking, smallholder farmer who has a will of iron. He is a super incredible farmer! He certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list. Born in 1972 to a humble family, Noah’s upbringing was difficult. He attended school and cleared secondary, after which he got into mixed farming. That was 10 years ago. He also married a beautiful and loving wife, and they have four children.

Noah practises farming on a 20-acre farm, which is owned by the family, in the village of Kapseret. He grows vegetables, beans and maize and keeps several highly productive dairy cows for milk production. The 43-year-old farmer sells his produce in bulk to the nearby market. His key clients are his neighbours and local people. He is a member of the Kipkenyo self-help group, a group formed to help members, who are smallholder farmers, save and use their savings to access loans from financial institutions.

Noah is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to build a greenhouse. He needs greenhouse technology to continuously improve the productivity, profitability and sustainability of his major farming systems. A greenhouse will provide a favorable environment for his plants. It will protect them from adverse climatic conditions, such as wind, cold, precipitation, excessive radiation, extreme temperature, insects and disease.

With your loan, Noah will have a year-round production of crops and off-season production of vegetable and fruits. He will also save on the use of natural resources, such as water. With greenhouse technlogogy, the water requirements of crops are limited and easy to control. Through this loan, Noah will be able to sell milk to his neighbours and to the nearby market, hence making more money.

Noah has a great credit history. He took a previous loan of 68,275 Kenyan shillings and successfully serviced the loan. This will be his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo. After successfully clearing the previous loan, he believes this one will change his life. Profits from this investment will be be plowed back into the business to fuel further growth. There still remains much space on his land for future growth.

If there ever was an opportunity to invest $25 in someone's future, it is here! You won't regret it.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and everything she does is for her family's well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale along with her husband and two children. She strives to give her children a decent life and a good education.

Edith has been doing agriculture for seven years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, as well as milk, eggs, and crops. She also does a side hustle business as a seamstress. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also affect productivity.

Edith is seeking a loan to buy good quality seed and fertilizer which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Edith and her family.

You could be part of this dream. Come on, make a loan!

loans.use: To buy farm implements such as quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 1

texts.en: Taw Ka Yan Lay Group 1’s previous loan from Proximity Designs helped 21 group members expand their livestock business. Like her fellow members, featured borrower Daw Ei used funds to expand her duck business and is now able to cover her monthly expenses. This relisted loan will support Taw Ka Yan Lay Group 1 purchase more ducks and buy high-quality feed.  Better feed will be critical to cultivating healthy eggs. The group is so grateful for all the help from Kiva lenders, and they are excited to continue to grow their business with Kiva’s help.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feeds

borrowers.first_name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 1

loans.name: Ulugoy

texts.en:
Ulugoy was born in 1983 year and is a smart and hardworking woman. Ulugoy lives with her family in a rural area. Ulugoy has 3 children. Her children are schoolboys and Ulugoy works hard for well-being of them. Her husband has been busy with animal husbandry.

Ulugoy has a land where she crows crops and vegetables. She has helped her parents since childhood and to be adult she has own business deal with farming more than 12 years. Ulugoy mainly grows wheat. She is going to make new sowing of wheat but she has not money to buy seeds. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seeds of wheat. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds for new sowing season.

loans.name: Pedro Ernesto

texts.es: Pedro tiene 40 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos queridos hijos de 17 y 23 años de edad a los que con mucho esfuerzo están sacando adelante en sus estudios por lo que quiere verlos triunfar en la vida. El es un hombre muy trabajador que se esfuerza mucho para llevar el sustento al hogar, el se dedica a la venta de lácteos desde hace 15 años y buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos ha decidido surtir mas su tienda ya que son muchos los clientes que adquieren sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, jabón, frijol, maíz, huevos, pan, sopas, frescos, salsitas, pastas, etc, y de esa manera obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old. He lives in a home of his own, together with his life partner and their two beloved children, age 17 and 23, whom they are supporting in their studies because they want to see them succeed in life.

Pedro is a very hard-working man who makes great efforts to support his household. For 15 years, he has worked selling dairy products, and seeking a way to obtain a better income, he has decided to stock his store with more products, since he has a lot of customers.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cooking oil, soap, beans, corn, eggs, bread, soups, soft drinks, sauces, pastas, etc. In this way he can obtain better earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in cooking oil, soap, beans, corn, eggs, bread, soups, soft drinks, sauces, pastas, etc., in order to obtain better earnings.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio supports his family through his fish-selling business. He sells in the neighboring municipalities of Baybay, Leyte. He has been operating for 5 years in spite of many obstacles.

Remegio is determined to do things right in order to provide for the needs of his family. He has 6 children to support: 4 school-aged children and 2 adult children. His wife stays home and takes good care of them.

Remegio is in need of a loan to buy more fish to sell. At 47 years old, Remegio aims to expand this business to increase his profitability and be able to continue providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old now.

Emelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Teresa dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sibel

texts.en:
Sibel is married and a mother of three. Sibel started sewing at home and with her first loan she bought sewing materials and underwear and sold them. With her second loan she renewed her sewing machine. With her third loan she bought herself an overlock machine and opened herself a small shop. She reached more customers by the shop thus increased her income.

The shop did not have any restaurants around so she started thinking of opening a restaurant. There was a school facing her shop and she thought she might make good sales at the restaurant so she opened a small one.

With the help of her loan she bought saucepans, casseroles, frying machines and cookstove. Here she will serve home made food to students and neighbourhood. She will only serve lunch and so being near her other shop makes it easier. Her only wish is to serve with quality and to succeed.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sibel hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Evde dikiş dikme işine başlayan Sibel Hanım ilk mikro kredisi ile dikiş malzemesi ve iç çamaşırı alıp sattı. İkinci kredisi ile dikiş makinasını yeniledi. Üçüncü kredisi ile overlok makinesi alıp kendine küçük bir dükkan açtı.Dükkan da daha çok müşteriye ulaşan Sibel Hanım işlerini arttırarak kazancını artırdı. Dükkanın yanında yemek yiyeceği bir lokanta olmaması, öğlen yemeklerinin sorun olması kendisine bir lokanta açma fikri getirdi. İş yerinin karşısın da okul olması karını arttıracağını düşündürerek ufak bir lokanta dükkanı açtı. Aldığı kredi ile tencere, kızartma makinesi, aygaz vb. şeyler aldı. Burada öğrencilere ve esnaf komşularına ev yemekleri sunacak. Sadece öğle saatlerinde hizmet vereceğinden, her iki dükkanının da yan yana olması işini kolaylaştırıyor. Bu iş de tutunmak, başarmak, kaliteli hizmet sunmak tek dileği.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, casseroles, frying machines and cookstove

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad is 63 years old and is married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Solidad has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Solidad has been in this business for 22 years selling a variety of items such as canned good, snack foods, and personal care products.

In the future Solidad would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Durlabh's Group

texts.en:
Durlabh is a 48-year-old, humble and simple lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India.

Durlabh is a married lady and is a blessed mother of two sons who are earning their own livelihoods, as they are grown up. Her household income is very low, and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible, as she faces difficulty to walk long distances due to her old age.

Therefore, she, along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and incorporate water pipes in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community.

Durlabh is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode and incorporate water pipes in it.

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en:
Sila is an enterprising lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. She has a small family of three members consisting of her husband and her son. Sila is a tailor by profession, and she provides quality service to her customers. She enjoys a contented living with her family.

The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend to nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So, in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a clean and well-equipped toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a clean and well-equipped toilet.

loans.name: Suria

texts.en:
Suria is 30 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 1 year. Suria's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose.

Therefore Suria has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
Suria is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more commodities her husband's for general store .

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 27 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Asma has been running her own beauty saloon for past five years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Asma has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
on this financial assistance Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her salon business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a 49-year-old man from Albuera, Leyte. He is married and has five children; two adult and three school aged children. Leonardo and his wife are running a sari-sari store (general store) business to earn a living. They have been doing this for almost 20 years and become proficient. Aside from sari-sari store, they also engaged in raising pig business and they also have a farm. They raised their children through these businesses.

With that, they wish to improve these businesses to have a sustainable means of living in the future. Thus, Leonardo is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles and spices. He will also buy piglets and feed as well.

loans.use: to buy  chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, powdered chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles and spices; piglets and feed.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a transport business where she owns a motorcycle and has employed someone to transport customers from one place to another. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle. Her business goal is to have three more motorcycles within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 38 years old, comes from the City of Bacolod, province of Negros Occidental. She is happily married to Mayo, a maintenance worker. They work together to sustain their everyday needs and support their children’s college expenses.

Felisa has a strong entrepreneurial spirit. She knows where the crowd is, and she stations her movable vending post there. She sells various snack items such as coffee, cup noodles, biscuits, sandwiches, and packed viands. Her customers are students and working people who usually pass by her stall. 

Now that it’s rainy season, she experiences some difficulties in operating her business. Sometimes she gets sick but she persists. She contemplates about hog fattening as additional income generating venture in the near future. But for now, she will continue with her current business because it gives her regular daily income. She applied for PHP 12,000 additional capital to buy more snack items and raw ingredients for cooking viands. She is thanking you in advance for the financial assistance that will be extended to her. She prays that more blessings will come your way.

Felisa faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more snack items and raw ingredients for cooking viands

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is a single woman. She has 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She will save the anticipated profits for future use.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows maize, potatoes, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 6 years.

Charles's business is located in a fertile area, and his customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy seeds to plant.

Charles's business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use his anticipated profits to buy more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with 8 children.

Nenita has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita is close to having fully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Nenita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dulasima

texts.en:
Dulasima is 58 years old and married with four children. Dulasima works very hard to provide for them.

Dulasima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Dulasima has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Dulasima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 23 years old. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. The adversity that has followed her has not been an obstacle for this woman who has not left her dreams behind and wants to succeed. For four years, Tabitha has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, Tabitha finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening.

In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. You don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful.

Tabitha is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seeds to start horticultural farming. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Ina. R

texts.en:
Ina is a 49-year-old widow with one son. She is a merchant. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Ina will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 24, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kiabonyoru, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and blessed with two children. She has been practising mixed farming for the last five years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

The Nyamira area is very populated, and demand for poultry products is high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She has stated that the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is the "increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming and is seeking a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry.

For a woman, accessing funds is very challenging. But, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved to know that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through this loan, she will sell eggs and other poultry products to her neighbors and the local market. The sales will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income. Being a visionary, Lucy intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

Be inspired and support her. She will not dissapoint!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Rasmita's Group

texts.en:
Rasmita is a 29-year-old, humble and simple lady standing in the middle in the photograph with a raised hand. She hails from a small village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India.

Rasmita is a married lady and is a blessed mother of two daughters who are currently studying in a primary school. Her household income is very low, and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds that feasible, as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation. She has also the danger of animal and insect bites.

Therefore, she, along with her fellow group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community.

Rasmita is awaiting your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Eno

texts.en:
Eno is a 60-year-old widow with five childs. Eno is a farmer for forty years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 6.800,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Eno will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old and married with one child and resides in RS Tan Village, Maningcol, Ozamiz City with his family.
Elmer owns and operates a transportation, transport service  for three years to earn a living. He had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying spare parts and tires. Recently, he took a new loan amount of 25,000.00 to cover the cost of repaint and  motor repair of the motorcycle used for the transportation business. He plans to buy sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

location.town: RS Tan Village, Maningcol, Ozamiz City

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married and has two sons. She has a small business.

Ruslana runs a small grocery store in Vinogradovo in a rented facility. The most popular products are groats. Ruslana doesn't have any hired employees.  She is hardworking and active person. She loves her work. In future Ruslana plans to open the second store. 

Ruslana is asking for a loan of 50 000 UAH to increase the assortment of products. The loan will help her to purchase all goods for sale.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of products

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a widow who lives in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental near her children and grandchildren. She still operates a “sari-sari” or variety store to support and maintain her daily household needs. She also aims to save some amount in case of emergencies because she has no medical benefits and insurances as a self-employed worker. 

In her store, Gloria sells dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and expectedly the competition is stiff. Gloria tries to compete and she wants to enhance it further. Lately she added bananas to her inventory. Now she is applying for PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, toiletries, beverages and fruits. This will make her business more stable and she will be able to increase her income. She will be very grateful if you can extend your generosity to her.

All CCT community clients such as Gloria are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, toiletries, beverages and fruits

loans.name: Jescah

texts.en:
Jescah is married and has four children. She describes herself as creative.

Jescah operates a restaurant, and has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

Her business goal is to own a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Cailane

texts.en:
Cailane is a 32-year-old, married woman with four children. Three of her children currently attend school.

She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cailane has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Cailane has been in this business for five years.

Cailane is requesting a loan in the amount of 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell to her customers. In the future, Cailane would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 34 years old and all three children are enrolled in school.

Jovelyn has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

Jovelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is a hardworking entrepreneur living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy beer and soap to sell. She lives with her two children, ages 2 and 17. Both attend school.

She still runs a bar which she has been operating for the last ten years. With the profits, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. In addition to the bar, she grows crops that have helped her supplement her earnings and food supplies.

She has dreams of expanding the bar and also buying a pool table so as to attract more customers. However, customer complaints about high inflation rates make business so challenging.

Specioza is requesting a loan to buy more drinks like beer and soda to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like beer and soda to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nani Suyatni

texts.en:
Nani Suyatni is a 51-year-old married with two daughters. She is a taylor and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toiet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Nani will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 2

texts.en:
The entire group is so thankful for your generous lending. Your support has helped them smooth their daily cashflow. Before Kiva’s loan, some group members had to take out costly short-term debt to pay for ad hoc purchases. Others would put off essential input purchases for their duck raising business, which would hurt their duck growth, and ultimately decrease their revenues. Additionally, several group members are now able to pay school fees on time.

Group members plan to use Proximity’s next loan to purchase high-quality feed for next season’s duck-raising so that they can grow healthy eggs.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feeds.

borrowers.first_name: Taw Ka Yan Lay Village Group 2

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is single. He deals in the lucrative business of motorcycle transport that most youth deal in. He is a hardworking man and he is doing very well.

At the moment, Geofrey has two motorcycles on the road, though he dreams of having at least seven motorcycles to transport people and increase his income.

Geofrey now wants to buy a third motorcycle, having tested the benefits from this business. However, he lacks enough money to meet his budget. He is requesting credit to meet his need mentioned above and will gladly repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en:
Azad is 27 years old, married and is IDP (internally displaced person). He has 2 daughters. Azad is very diligent and kind person. Being in farming sector over 12 years, he has gained great experience and has long-term goals.

For supporting his family materially better, he wants to expand his business. He is looking forward to buy new seeds for planting fruits. Growing new fruits and vegetables he will be able to earn more income. For this Kiva lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy new seeds for planting fruits

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en:
Sarvan is 35 years old, married and is IDP (internally displaced person). He has 2 sons and 2 daughters. He is very energetic and dynamic man. Being in farming sector over 12 years, tells of his strong character and hard-working nature. He grows some vegetables and fruits.

Sarvan is optimistic and has long-term goals. For supporting his family materially in a better way, he is planning to expand his business. He will buy new seeds for planting fruits. For this Kiva lenders can support him.

loans.use: to buy new seeds for planting fruits.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus owns and operates an agriculture business  planting and harvesting banana for sale. Jesus has been engaged in his business for ten years and earns well from these activities. He had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming supplies. His farm is still doing well and yet, he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan amount of 8,000, to buy fertilizer and insecticide. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has three children.

She describes herself as very focused. To earn a living, she operates a food café. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

She is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy additional stocks of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that, in the future, she and her business will excel. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits from the requested loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina earns a living by being a dealer of Avon products, such as beauty soap, body lotion, perfume, ladies accessories and apparel.
In addition to that, she also sold personal collection products mostly tailored for house hold use like powdered soap, toilet bowl cleaner, fabric conditioner and house hold wares.

She is 51 years old married woman with nine children. Two of them are still attending school. Her husband's occupation is a carpenter.

She needs additional capital to purchase variety of stocks in order to cater the needs of her respective customers.

Rufina has requested a loan to buy Avon supplies like cosmetics, beauty soap, body spray and accessories. With the presence of these, she could manage her earnings well and slowly improve her living condition.

She is hoping that she could make it sustainable for the welfare of her two children that are still in school.

loans.use: to buy Avon supplies like cosmetics, beauty soap, body spray and accessories.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 50 years old and has five children. Marilyn is married and has one child in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 6500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Malou is 32 years old and has one child in school.

Malou has a buy and sell scrap business in the Philippines. Malou requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

Malou has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Malou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 34 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and pays for laborers salaries.

Analyn has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and pays for laborers salaries

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
The majority of the Kenyan population directly depends on small-scale farming for their livelihood in the rural areas. The farming individuals are commonly elderly people. However, Loice has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. At the age of 36 years, she is a proud owner of a farm, where she plants maize and vegetables and keeps dairy cows. The farm is in the Matunda, Kitale area of Kenya.

Loice practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge attained from the agricultural training she has undergone with Juhudi Kilimo. Her sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg-selling. These products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time.

The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market. This is why Loice is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Loice is very determined to succeed. Because she is very disciplined with finances, she plans that, through accumulated profits, she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and also for her parents.

Loice’s dream is to build a modern house, and she hopes that through your loan, you will help her realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so she can deliver her products to the market on time.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses a hardworking married man who is aged 33 years and married with 4 children.

Moses owns a boutique selling clothing and shoes, and he is engaged in business for personal development. To supplement his income, he also buys and sells coffee.

Moses has been in business since 2006 serving his customers with diligence. He complains of inadequate capital to fully stock his business ahead of the festive season. He has the desire to transform his business into a bigger boutique.

Moses is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas's ambition to progress and get ahead drove her to start practising mixed farming 10 years ago. Dorcas, 32, a youthful mother and wise farmer, is respected by her neighbours and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kapsowar, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya.

Dorcas is happily married and blessed with a lovely family. She grows maize and vegetables and also has dairy cows. She has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

She also earns profits selling a variety of food crops but is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. Her remote village has poor roads. Transporting her produce has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes), which require timely delivery to the market. This challenge, however, has not made her give up. She says, “I have to do something for my family.“

Dorcas has joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like herself. She is requesting a loan via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. This loan will help her achieve her dream and reach her goals.

Accessing financial solutions for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Dorcas feels relieved to know that there are institutions like Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, that help women gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. Dorcas will use this loan to improve her living conditions and assure her four children a secure future. The benefits of the loan will be astronomical, because Dorcas will never again suffer losses due to a delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales and income because she will be able to transport more goods to the market.

Dorcas is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. By supporting Dorcas, you are supporting hard work and honesty and celebrating the opportunity for female smallholder farmers to get ahead. Make a loan!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Şerife

texts.en:
Şerife is single and has been running a daycare center for six years. When she started to use her first loan she was serving in a small flat. Now the number of children has increased and she has moved to a bigger flat. With the help of her fourth loan she will buy paper and supplies for the business. She aims to improve herself, serve with quality and grow.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şerife hanım bekar, altı yıldır kreş işletmeciliği yapıyor. İlk mikro krediyi kullandığında küçük bir dairede hizmet veren Şerife Hanım öğrenci sayısını arttırarak daha geniş bir yere taşınarak öğrencilerine burada eğitim vermeye başladı. Dördüncü kredisi ile kreşinin kırtasiye ihtiyaçlarını karşılayacak. Amacı kendini daha da geliştirip kaliteli hizmet sunmak ve büyümek.

loans.use: to buy paper and supplies for her daycare center.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is a divorced woman with two children.

To earn a living, she has a store of her own, where she has been working for seven years. She organizes polterabend, baby showers and birthdays. She also designs and makes candy packs for such events.

With the help of this loan, which would be her second, she is planning to buy party-related materials in bulk. Her aim is to help her children finish their educations.

loans.use: to purchase party-related materials in bulk.

loans.name: Our Time Group

texts.en:
‘Our time to expand’, is the thought that crossed her mind soon after viewing a Thrive advert on Zimbabwe Broadcasting Corporation television. The advert came at an opportune time for 39 year old Nyepudzai of Our Time group. This woman had for a long time, a burning desire to expand her business. She refers to that night she saw the advert on TV as a “revelation moment”. She called the number on the television screen and was told the requirements for joining the Thrive program.

It was not hard for Nyepudzai to find women to join Thrive with as a group. She was already enjoying good relations with three women residing around her neighborhood. These women were fellow business women who were hardworking and with whom she did rotating savings and credits associations with. The members of Our Time group reside in the upcoming high density suburb of Kuwadzana Phase 3 in the capital of Zimbabwe, Harare. The ladies joined Thrive and benefited immensely from the trainings attended.

Ladies love accessorizing their outfits with handbags and purses. Nyepudzai realized that this was a good market that she understood well and decided to provide various types of bags for her mostly female clientele. To be able to provide the eye catching bags, this woman endures long and tiring bus journeys to and from neighboring South Africa. The bad state of roads and long queues at the border posts do little to deter this determined woman.

She operates a stall of handbags and purses at an extremely busy and popular marketplace in the central business district of Harare. With a loan of $500, she intends to fully stock her stall since the festive season is fast approaching hence a higher projected demand for handbags and purses. She also aims to have numerous brands in order to serve different tastes. Her lessons at Thrive have made her a sharper business woman who wants to a bigger share of the market.

loans.use: to increase her stock of bags & purses ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma tiene 33 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad a los que con mucho esfuerzo está sacando adelante en sus estudios porque quiere verlos triunfar en la vida ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable ella se dedica a su pequeño negocio de productos de primera necesidad y buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como: cremas lociones para damas y caballeros champú etc, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: aceite, huevos, café, sopas, detergentes, jabón, champú, embutidos, y también lociones para damas, cremas para el cuerpo. Y así poder mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two small children ages 8 and 12 who with a great deal of effort they are helping to move forward in their studies because they want to see them succeed in life.

She is a a very hard-working and responsible woman who has a small business selling basic household necessities, and seeking a way of earning more income she also sells catalog products such as body creams and lotions for men and women, shampoo etc., so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase cooking oil, eggs, coffee, soups, chicken's, soap, shampoo, cold cuts, as well as lotions for women and body creams. In this way she will be able to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, eggs, coffee, soups, detergents, soap, shampoo, cold cuts as well as lotions for women and body cream.

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat was born in 1957. She is married, and is a careful mother and grandmother. She lives with her family in a rural area of North Tajikistan.

Hidoyat is a hardworking woman. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 15 years. She mainly feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products to local people, many of whom are her neighbors. She notes that she generates additional income from sewing.

Hidoyat is seeking to improve her business by increasing the number of her cows. To do so, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,000 Somoni. She very much appreciates your generosity.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing additional cows.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene lives a simple life with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has two children: one adult and one school-aged child. Arlene and her husband are involved in the fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for five years, and work hard to provide for the needs of their family.

They are asking for a bigger loan to pay for repairs to their fishing boat; which includes labor and purchasing materials such as plywood, bamboo and boat repair glue.

At 41 years old, Arlene dreams of increasing their income to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her fishing boat, which includes labor and purchasing materials such as plywood, bamboo and boat repair glue.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
She is Rowena, 54 years old, married to James, a deepwell driller. They have two children, one of whom is still studying in college. The cost of college education is usually pocket-draining, hence Rowena raises hogs at the back of their house to add income for her family. It is a promising enterprise but the return of investment takes several months. She has to advance considerable amount of capital before she earns her profit. As of now, her capital starts to drain and she still has small pigs to raise.

She appeals for PHP 29,000 additional capital to buy more feed, medicines and vitamins. In several weeks, she can already sell these medium-sized pigs and she can surely restore her capital. Slowly, she plans to expand her small pigpen hoping that someday it can grow into a big piggery that can supply more consumers in their community and nearby areas.

Besides financing her own hog fattening business, she wants to buy a microwave oven for her daughter’s food enterprise. She currently mentors her daughter as she starts her own business. She’s happy that her daughter has a positive aspiration to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

Rowena consistently meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental to share testimonies and reflect on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more feed, medicines and vitamins; and procure a microwave oven for her daughter’s food enterprise

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a large scale distributor of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a cheerful and enthusiastic person who enjoys and appreciates her life and having a family. She works hard each day and puts all her efforts into her farming business. She is a small-scale farmer from Kapsowar, a rural town known for dairy farming. For the past 10 years, she has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk and maize. She sells her produce to the nearby market and also to neighbours. She has been making positive strides.

Ann wants to diversify. She is seeking a loan to start sheep farming and make her dream come true. She is very passionate about sheep farming. The most enjoyable task for her is raising the sheep. Sheep farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for mutton is always high, given that it is such a popular meal for many people in Kapsowar.

Despite being a woman with limited resources, Ann wants to work to get ahead. She needs your help to grow and maintain her sheep farming business, which is why she is requesting the help of a loan.

With this loan, Ann will also benefit from sheep wool, which fetches a high price, both in international and domestic markets. The additional profits from sheep farming will change her life and enable her to take care of family expenses.

loans.use: To buy a sheep

loans.name: War Kaug Taw Village Group

texts.en:
Aye and her fellow members are very grateful for the Kiva community’s generous support of their first loan. These loans helped group members invest in their livestock duck-raising business. With Kiva’s funds, group members could smooth their cash flows, purchasing basic supplies at optimal times. These purchases enabled them to optimize their cultivation techniques.

Using Proximity’s next loan, Aye’s group plans to purchase ducklings and high-quality feeds. Additionally, they hope to use additional income to pay their children’s education fees.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high-quality feeds.

loans.name: Murni

texts.en:
Murni is a 52-year-old widow. Murni has been selling rice at her house for three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 4.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Murni will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Juhariyah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Juhariyah, who is a 52-year-old married with one daughter. Juhariyah has been selling electronic goods and her husband is a driver. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a toilet their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Juhariyah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water  for their family.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 43-year-old married man with five children, three of whom attend school. He trades coffee and runs a small retail shop at Omurutwe-Bugangari. He has operated his business for over 20 years.

Augustine has limited capital to expand his businesses, which is why he decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance. Augustine has been taking out loans from Ugafode which have enabled him to educate his children and sustain his businesses.

Augustine applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to buy more coffee and retail goods such as soap, sugar, posho, salt, so as to increase his sales and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and retail goods to boost his coffee trade business.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 32-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 8 years, and he is solely responsible for providing for the needs of his entire family.

Saira's husband wants to purchase commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other consumer items to sell from his business. But due to financial constraints. her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products.

Therefore, Saira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and help him earn maximum profits so he can manage both his business and household.

Saira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different commodities for her husband to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 43, is an energetic woman with a great dream: to get out of poverty, to be financially stable and to get her family ahead. She is blessed with a lovely family, which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere. She wants to provide them with a better future.

Alices lives with her family in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. She was unable to study to develop a professional career because of her family's economic situation. She never gave up, however, and has been practising farming for the past 10 years. An early riser, she goes to her farm to earn a living and has space there for dairy farming.

She has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow. Siongiroi has a high population with a high demand for milk. Being an enterprising person, Alice wants to take full advantage of that need and earn extra income. She hopes that this loan will allow her to change her living standards and expand her milk-selling business.

Once she has accumulated more profits, she plans to open a very large milk-selling business in the nearby shopping center and package milk. She wants to be economically empowered. She knows that accessing funds is challenging, but with partners such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, she feels relieved to know that all her dreams will be achieved. She will be able to provide a secure future for her children and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.en: Sirojiddin was born in 1994 year. He is young and industrious man from North Tajikistan. He lives with his parents in a rural area. Sirojiddin has been busy with growing crops more than 5 years. Little by little with the passing of the time he develops business. His parents help him with managing business. Sirojiddin is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for because he must make autumn sowing of crops. Sirojiddin awaits your mercy because he needs to your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for new sowing season.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, who is in his mid 30's, is single with no kids. He has been running a guest house business for six years now. He does not have a particular time for his guests' arrival but does not accept visitors after 12 PM. He is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Emmanuel's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to continue maintaining the guest house by laying tiles, painting the inside, and installing good beds. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.

He is doing great with the loan and appreciates lender's for the support of their group. He used the profit to take care of himself and his loan repayment and to cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to renovate his guest house by painting the outside and hanging new curtains. He dreams of installing up-to-date air conditioning. Emmanuel will make sure he pays back his loan at the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to renovate his guest house by painting the outside and hanging new curtains

loans.name: Masis

texts.en:
Masis is 34 years old and he lives with his wife, children and parents in Kapan city of Syunik region. Masis started from 2006 in his own space, manages a small business for repairing household appliances. Masis mentions that through his business he covers his family’s needs and he does his best to attract more customers and through his skilled and polite service he makes them his regular customers.

Masis works the whole week and without holidays in order not to lose any order and he works till late at night so to be on time. Masis says that he dreams of developing his business more so his workshop will be more popular and he will have workers and give a wider assortment of repairing services than now. This loan now Masis asks for, as he needs to buy a new welding machine, some spare parts and materials for his repairing works.

loans.use: to buy a new welding machine, some spare parts and materials for his repairing works

loans.name: Venesio

texts.en:
Venesio is a hardworking thirty-one-year old married man with two children. His main business is a retail trade that he started in 1995. He ventured into this business with an aim of family development.

He has a business dream of trading wholesale and a family dream of educating his children. In spite of this, he meets difficulties of having insufficient capital to realize his dream.

Venesio is therefore requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 54 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her son has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 10 years.

Farzana's son needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints her son is not in suitable condition to buy above these items. Therefore Farzana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her son to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her son can earn more profitable income.
On this financial assistance Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's tailoring business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 33 years old, from village Norio. He has a wife, school-aged daughter and son and parents. Davit works as a baker and his mother is a cleaner. The family has also small agribusiness for 10 years already.
