In order to increase his productivity and make another source of significant income, Davit decided to purchase a car, which will be used for serving the local tourists on a private orders. In his free time, Davit also will work as a taxi driver.

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2700 USD for purchasing a car.

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders. Davit is very hard-working person, who will do his best to make better style of life for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start serving tourists and locals as a taxi.

loans.name: Munanda Jijenge Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising hand in the photo is Margaret, a member of Munanda Jijenge Women's Group in Nakuru. She is sixty years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in November 2013.

Margaret does maize and bean farming as her main business. With the training she received from HiH EA, she has been able to commercialize her farming, and she is now able to earn more profits from her business.

Margaret is taking a Kiva loan to purchase quality fertilizer and more chickens for the poultry project she is starting. This will greatly boost her farm and poultry yields, thus increasing her income which will enable her to provide her basic needs.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan portion promptly.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and quality fertilizer for the poultry project she is starting.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 53 years old and lives in the Lahore, Pakistan area. She is the mother of 5 children.

Nasreen's husband is a turner by profession; he works with a lathe machine. He manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbines and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years, and up to now his business has been very much settled.

But due to continuously working over his lathe machine, some of the important parts have torn off which urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of these parts, it highly impacts the lathe's whole functioning mechanism. Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy the spare parts to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Nasreen formed a group and has requested a loan. Nasreen will use her loan portion so her husband can fix his lathe. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for both his business as well as their family.

loans.use: to fix her husband's lathe and enable him to generate income again.

loans.name: Guria

texts.en:
Guria is a 24-year-old married woman, who resides with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child. Her husband has been running her hair salon for the past 5 years. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members.

Guria's husband needs to buy different types of cosmetics, such as creams, hairbrushes, seats and other accessories for her hair salon. However, due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to buy these items.

Therefore, Guria has applied for Kiva loan. The loan proceeds will help her husband to buy the necessary items for the business so that better services can be provided to her customers. By doing so, she believes that the loan will help to increase her income so that her business's and family's needs will be satisfied. Guria is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing additional hair salon accessories, such as shaving creams, hairbrushes and seats.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba lives in Lahore. She is 35, married and is the mother of four school-going children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transportation services locally. He is a loving and responsible father as well. He is the sole earner in the family so he has to bear all the financial burden of the family. He works really hard to make ends meet.

Currently his rickshaw tires need to be replaced with new ones as they have deteriorated due to constant driving. This has affected his income as well - he is short of money to buy new tires. Therefore Saba has requested a loan to help her husband through BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

Though they have low income, Saba's husband is satisfied and content to be able to earn their living and is looking forward to more opportunities to raise more income. He plans to save money to buy a new rickshaw to rent out in the future.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw tires for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Furaha Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Ferithi, a member of Furaha self help group. She is sixty-six years old, widowed, and a mother of seven grown-up children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2014.

Ferithi does maize and beans farming. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she is now able to manage her farming business well.

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy a goat for rearing. With proper feeding and maintenance, she will be able to multiply her herd and sell the goats at a profit in the near future.

Through the income, she will support her crop farming business which is prone to failure due to erratic rainfall. This will enable her support her family needs such as food and medical care.

She is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy a goat for rearing that will boost income to support family needs.

loans.name: Angela Gabriela

texts.es: Angela de 41 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia al lado de sus hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Ella en busca de obtener ingresos económicos y así poder ofrecerle todo lo necesario a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos helados, negocio con el cual logra satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. En vista que la demanda hacia sus productos ha  aumentado, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, etc. de esta manera aumentar la cantidad de productos para aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Angela is 41 years old. She lives in a home of her own with her children, aged 10 and 14, and her life partner, who helps her with the household expenses. In the quest to obtain an income and provide her children with everything they need, she works selling clothing as well as frozen products. With this business, she has been able to satisfy her family's basic needs.

Since the demand for her products has increased, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc., in order to expand her stock of products and increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest in blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, etc., to expand her stock of products and increase her sales.

loans.name: Nishamani's Group

texts.en:
Nishamani is a 50-year-old lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from a village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. This humble lady has a family of three.

Nishamani is a grocer by profession and provides quality service to a large customer base near her locality. Nishamani is the only breadwinner in her family. She has two sons. Her husband left her six years back.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Nishamani will utilize her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees of her elder son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son complete his technical education smoothly and will help him in getting a good job with a handsome good package. Nishamani will also be able to upgrade her living standards.

Nishamani is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to pay the course fees of her elder son's ITI course.

loans.name: Nibasi's Group

texts.en:
Nibasi is a simple and sober lady standing to the right hand side of the photograph. She hails from a small village in Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. She is a widow and is a tailor by profession. She earns 4,000 INR per month.

After the death of her husband, all the family responsibility automatically came to her shoulders and 4,000 INR was insufficient for her family's monthly family expenditures.

She, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 30,000 INR. Nibasi will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and cloth so that she can give tailoring training to others and can make some extra money.

The loan amount will help her in acquiring a new automated sewing machine which will increase the efficiency of her work by reducing the time factor. Nibasi will be able to take more number of orders which will add to her income, making her economically stable.

With her added income, she will be able to send her children to a private school in order to help them avail better educational facilities.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, thread, and cloth.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single lady who operates a restaurant. She is doing very well; through using profits from her business, she has managed to construct a house up to a certain level.

However Fatuma is now stuck as she has no money to complete her building. She is now requesting for a loan to facilitate her to buy lumber and iron sheets to complete her house. In her business she meets hardships of high cost of foods that she cooks.

loans.use: to buy lumber and iron sheets to complete her house.

loans.name: Zenaida Marina

texts.es: Zenaida de 37 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 14  años y sus padres. Ella es madre soltera y en busca de poder darle todo lo necesario a su hijo se dedica a la confección de ropa, obteniendo de esta manera los ingresos económicos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Además presta sus servicios de sastre por temporadas a una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Zenaida en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela, hilos, ganchos, alfileres, y demás materiales necesarios para la confección de ropa. De esta manera aumentar sus productos para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 37 years old and lives with her 14-year-old son and her parents. She is a single mother, and seeking to be able to give her son everything he needs, she works as a dressmaker, thereby obtaining the income necessary for meeting her basic needs and those of her family. In addition she does sewing work on a seasonal basis for a company located near their community.


Seeking to improve their quality of life, Zenaida is requesting a loan from FUSAI two so that she can purchase fabric, thread, hangers, pins and other materials needed for making clothing. In this way she hopes to increase her output and sales.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, hangers, pins and other materials needed for making clothing

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is an 18-year-old, single lady, and the sole breadwinner for three other members of her family. She opened in 2014 her current beauty salon, to make sure she could financially support her family members.

Today, and since she is developing her business in a well-managed way, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to buy a new accessories collection to start selling in her salon. She is very optimistic about developing her business, and will make sure to improve her business based upon customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy a new accessories collection to start selling in her salon.

loans.name: Gloria Mabel

texts.es: Gloria de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres a quienes ayuda con la economía del hogar y también vive con sus hermanos. Gloria es una persona humilde y muy trabajadora quien en busca de ayudar a sus padres se dedica a la venta de pupusas platillo típico y también administra una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado instalar en su vivienda. Debido a que estos negocios los ha administrado desde hace algunos años, ya cuenta con un número de clientes bastante grande y la demanda para sus productos ha aumentado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón para su negocio de venta de pupusas y también invertir en productos para su tienda. De esta forma aumentar las ganancias y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 21 years old. She lives with her parents, whom she helps with the household expenses, and also with her siblings. Gloria is a humble and very hard-working person. In the quest to help her parents, she works selling pupusas [filled tortillas], a traditional food, and she also runs a store which she has been able to set up in her home through much effort. Since she has operated these businesses for several years, she now has a quite large number of customers, and the demand for her products has grown.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, beans, cheese and pork for her business selling pupusas, and also to invest in products for her store. In this way, she will increase her earnings and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, cheese and pork for her business selling pupusas, and also to invest in products for her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and has six children. She is married and has six children who are still in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lija's Group

texts.en:
Lija is a 24 years old and a simple lady. She is standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. Lija is a married lady and is a blessed mother of one infant. Her husband is the only breadwinner in her family, and they have to live on their limited income.

For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She feels that there is a risk of molestation and infection.

Therefore she, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She is the leader of the group. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for supporting her family members so that they can live a comfortable life and avoid infectious diseases.

She hopes that all her family members are healthy and enjoy a happy life.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mamina's Group

texts.en:
Mamina is a 30-year-old lady standing in a yellow saree to the extreme left in the photograph. She lives with her husband and her two daughters and son. Mamina's husband is a farmer by profession. The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. They have hardly any savings.

Therefore, Mamina was never able to build a toilet in her house, for which she is suffering a lot. She has to go long distances and isolated places in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice to be safe, as she understands the importance of having a toilet at home.

Therefore, she, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Mamina will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes to it. The loan amount will subsequently result in enhancing cleanliness, health, and hygiene.

Mamina is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes to it.

loans.name: Kokil's Group

texts.en:
Kokil is an industrious and laborious lady standing to the middle in the photograph. She hails from a remote village in Narsinghpur district, Odisha, India.

She has a big family, consisting of her husband and her daughters-in-law and three sons. Kokil is a fish seller by profession.

The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her and her family more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation. She understands the importance of having a toilet at home.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses and maintain privacy.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 49; she is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.
Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her son, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy recyclable goods for her son's for reselling to the recycling factories at high price.

loans.name: Duri's Group

texts.en:
Duri, 42, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a charismatic and hardworking lady from Narsinghpur, Odisha, India. She has a family of four and is a blessed mother of two daughters who are currently in college.

Duri hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to a toilet, she faces a lot of problems, as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible enough to depend on an open field for defecation, and she also feels that this is a threat to her privacy.

Therefore, Duri, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will promote her health and hygiene.

In the future, she aspires to see her daughters married in a well-settled and reputed house.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode.

loans.name: Sermin

texts.en:
Sermin is married and has one child. She does paintings on wood. She also paints raw wooden cabinets, jewellery boxes, trays, ornaments, panels etc and sells them. In the summertime she opens a stand and sells them. In the winter time she sells from home by request. She loves to produce her work. In the future she wants to open a shop of her own and sell her products there.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sermin Hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Ahşap boyama işi yapıyor. Aldığı ham ahşapları çeşitli figürlerle boyayıp süsleyerek dolaplar, takı kutuları , tepsi , süs eşyaları, panolar vs. yapıp satıyor. Yaz aylarında yazlık yerde stant açarak, kışın da sipariş üzerine çevresine yapıp satıyor. Üretmeyi seviyor. İleride ahşap malzemeleri ve kendi yaptığı ürünlerini satacağı bir dükkan açmak.

loans.use: to buy raw wood for her artisinal wood painting business

loans.name: Guni's Group

texts.en:
Guni is 35 years old and a divorcee, who lives with her two children, aged 14 years and 12 years. She has taken care of and brought up her children with great effort and love.

Once they were older, she had more free time, so she began to teach herself different crafts, such as making different designs for curtains, embroidering cushion covers, and designing flower vessels. She markets her products in the near-by market.She is a determined lady and supplies all the necessities of her house single-handedly.

Guni, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase satin cloth, colorful ribbons, glitter, and thread in bulk for enhancing her business.

She aspires to start a boutique, once she gains a large customer base in the future, and provide her children the best education so that they can pursue their higher studies.

Guni is standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase satin cloth, colorful ribbons, glitter, and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a 49-year-old woman living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. He uses wool for knotting blankets. There are no better kinds of blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Sughran's husband is an expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure. He knots blankets overnight. This is the reason he sells them for a high price. The problem is that customers do not always agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing over time.

However, Sughran's husband wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy sacks of wool and threads for knotting blankets. This can enable an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of wool and threads for her husband's blanket weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed concentrate, as well as pigs to increase the inventory and sales of her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a Sari-sari store owner in Alegria, Cebu. She is a persevering and a hard-working woman with five children ages one to 18. She help her husband in taking care of her family. She operate a Sari-sari store which sell basic items like vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, milo sachet, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, creamer and shampoo. She also sells fresh fish since her husband is already a fish vendor.

She is asking a loan to buy cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, biscuits and more fish to sell. This way, she can refill her shelves and make it more attractive to her customers. In the future, she plans to make her business more sustainable and prosperous for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, canned goods, diapers, coffee, biscuits and more fish to sell

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik is 35 years old and she live in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She lives with her two sons since her husband is now in Russian Federation for work, while Tatevik as been in her native city 8 years, working as a hairdresser. She is very skilled and professional in his work and she has never lack of customers.

Tatevik’s elder son is a student at the Vanadzor State University at the faculty of Social Pedagogy and he studies at the paid division. Her smallest son is 2 years old. Tatevik mentions that she with her hairdressing work and her husband from the far they do their best to cover their family’s financial needs but still they have lack of money. Now Tatevik asks this Kiva loan of 400.000 Armenian drams with some part of it (175.000 Armenian drams) she must pay her son’s tuition fee for the first semester and also she wants to make a nice surprise her son and buy a computer for him, which he greatly needs in his studying process.

loans.use: she must pay her son’s tuition fee for the first semester in Social Studies. and also she wants to make a nice surprise for him and buy a computer.

loans.name: Sharmagh

texts.en:
Sharmagh is 53 years old, and she lives with her youngest son in the frontier village Aygehovit, of Tavush region. Her elder son is already married, and he lives with his family. Sharmagh is busy with her livestock care (she has cows, calves, pigs, and chickens) and crop cultivation, which she organizes with her elder son. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers, greens, and fruits such as apples, pears, plums, figs and peaches. All of these, on her son’s truck, they take to the city’s wholesale market and sell them. She divides the income into two parts for their families. She also sells milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, meat and eggs.

Sharmagh mentions that she does her best and thinks a lot about the ways that could make her farming more profitable, for her and her son’s families. She decided to enlarge the number of her farm animals, and maybe in this way she can earn more profit. Now with this Kiva loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams, Sharmagh wants to buy several piglets and fodder for her farm cattle, with great hope that farm enlargement will be of great profit for both families.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and fodder for her farm cattle, with great hope that farm enlargement will be of great profit for both her and her son's families.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 51-year-old married man with children who attend school in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

He generates income from cattle keeping alongside selling cattle which he has been practicing for now eight years. He has the challenges of inadequate capital to meet the customers’ demands, as well as drought, pests, and diseases that limit his projected income.

George has a personal goal of improving his farm. Therefore, George is in need of a loan to buy more cows for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cows for selling.

loans.name: Kiraaro Twekambe Group

texts.en: Peter is a member of Kiraaro Twekambe Group where members guarantee each other in case of borrowing and loan payment. He is aged 70 with 8 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells fresh foods like tomatoes, cabbages and passion fruits, alongside farming that add him more income. He is faced with hardships of customers who fail to pay him on time and eventually become bad debtors which lowers his over all profit. However, he is working very hard to make sure he is self sustaining and educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Peter has asked for a loan to help him to buy more fresh foods like egg plants, carrots and others for selling.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables like eggplants, carrots and others for selling.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya iis married and has seven children. She has requested a loan for her husband, as he runs a food stall for offering burgers to the people of his area in the evenings. He has been changing his menus time to time according to weather, climate and taste. Nowadays he wants to offer burgers; for this is reason he is in better need of eggs, spices, oil, onion, cauliflower and tomato ketchup. Earlier he was selling Alu Chat (Pakistani Food), which is cheaper than burgers. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy ingredients for offering new food items.
Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, with the help of this loan her husband can easily buy the described ingredients.
She is 47, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.She thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her husband's burgers preparing and selling business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 39-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members.

Shabana has been running her own beauty salon for the past nine years. She also contributes her income (in addition to her husband's income) to manage the household. She needs to buy different types of cosmetics (for example: creams, hair brushes, and other accessories) for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business. Therefore, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan.

This loan will help Shabana to buy relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the most profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. For this financial assistance, Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic accessories for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Shalom Beeds Women Group

texts.en:
The lady wearing a white blouse in the photo is called Mary. She is 52 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, especially those in enterprise development.

Mary is involved in crop farming, i.e., vegetables, maize and beans. She also makes liquid soap and bar soap for sale, to supplement her income. She is borrowing the Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizer and certified seeds, to increase farming production. She intends to use the increased profits to expand the soap-making business and to pay her children's school fees. She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders, for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase farming production, and to use the profits to expand her soap-making business and pay school fees.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.en: Tursun is a kind woman. She was born in the year 1963. Tursun and her family live together, in a village. She has been busy with her animal husbandry and farming business for more than 20 years, like many of the local people. Tursun is widowed. Her husband died some years ago from illness. Tursun’s son and daughter-in-law help her with managing the business. Tursun buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. She is going to increase her working capital, and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 2600 Somoni, to buy cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Night ,

texts.en: Night is single and a mother of four children being their sole provider. She deals in crude salt a business that has seen her provide for her children like any loving mother could do. Her greatest desire is to educate her children and she works very hard toward her dream. At the moment, night would like to buy more crude salt, because the one in stock is too small to meet her clients needs. The challenge is the money at hand is not enough. She is requesting for money to meet the need above, and she will gladly pay back.

loans.use: to buy more salt to sell.

loans.name: Rafayel

texts.en:
Rafayel is 25 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Rafayel graduated Vanadzor State Musical School the department Armenian national musical instrument called "duduk". This instrument is unique one which is usually made of the wood, particularly the wood of apricot tree, and that is why it is also often called "tsiranapogh"- this means trumpet made of apricot tree. The music of this instrument sounds magically and it is already worldwide known as a really typical Armenian instrument.

Rafayel now works at the Song and Dance Ensemble of his city as a musician of the first degree. On his "duduk" (Armenian national musical instrument) he plays during the concerts and he also takes private orders of playing on wedding parties also. This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Rafayel asks as he needs to buy new "duduk" (Armenian national musical instrument), and he also wants to buy a computer as he wants to be aware of all the innovations and news in musical world.

loans.use: to buy new "duduk" (Armenian national musical instrument), and he also wants to buy a computer as he wants to be aware of all the innovations and news in musical world

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat is 43, and she is married. She lives with her husband and five children, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Ulfat purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband, and sells them in her locality. She has been doing this since 2005, and now she has gotten enough experience and knows the clothing business very well. She wants to use her experience and wants to generate more profit, but she needs to take a loan due to her poor financial condition. Due to the upcoming winter season, she expects that the demand for clothing will increase.

This is the reason Ulfat showed interest in taking a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would like to buy a variety of clothes at cheap prices, to sell. She hopes that she will use this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes at cheap prices in large quantity, to resell in her community.

loans.name: Karogoe Ukweli Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Nelson, a member of Karogoe Ukweli Women Group. He is 48 years old, married, and blessed with seven children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

Nelson grows maize and beans and also does dairy farming. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his crop farming business and is now able to get more profits out of it, unlike before.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to start a poultry keeping business. This will improve his income, and hence he will be in a position to educate his children and provide for family needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feeds that will lead to more income to support family expenses like food and education.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 30 years old, married, and blessed with one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 so as to benefit from the training it offers, especially on enterprise development.

He farms crops including cabbages, potatoes, carrots and snow peas. He also does dairy farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase production. With increased income, he will be able to provide better clothing and food for his family.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and certified seeds for increased production and hence more income to provide better clothing and food for his family.

loans.name: Mukeu Focal Area Seed Multiplication Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Emma. She is 31 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training it offers, especially on enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming, growing potatoes, carrots and cabbages and also keeping dairy animals. Besides, she works as a nursery school teacher to supplement her income.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a calf so as to expand her dairy farming. She hopes that this loan will help her to generate more income in future and therefore to pay school fees for her children at ease.

Emma is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy a calf to expand her dairy farming and hence earn more income in future to pay school fees.

loans.name: Kasenyi Tukole Group

texts.en:
Oliver lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She is a member of Kasenyi Tukole, where members pledge member group guarantor-ship while taking a loan. Oliver is a tea grower who compliments her work with a retail shop business selling salt, soap, sodas, and cooking oil. This is a business she started with an aim of generating income.

She will use this loan to buy more stocks of salt, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell. Oliver faces the difficulties of inadequate capital and price fluctuations, just like other people dealing in retail business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Glory Hazina Women Group

texts.en:
The person her raising hand in the photo is Susan. She is thirty years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does maize farming as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on debt management and book-keeping which has enabled her to manage the business better than before. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output and in turn increase her profits from improved sales. This will assist her to cater for the family’s upkeep and payment of school fees for the children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase output and income, and hence pay school fees.

loans.name: Yoram

texts.en:
Yoram is a hardworking 55-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started with small savings from seasonal crop output where he saved money from selling the surplus and formed a retail shop of general merchandise to help him look after his family needs.

Yoram has six years of experience working for at least eight hours a day, and his business is located in a trading centre attracting many customers. However, he faces the challenge of having inadequate capital to meet people’s changing demands.

Yoram is thus requesting this loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and sodas for the retail shop. He dreams of building a private primary school as a stable investment and to bring education services near to the people.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and sodas for his retail shop.

loans.name: Kathreen

texts.en:
Kathreen is a 47-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Kathreen's husband runs a food stall. Her husband sells different types of edible items, such as samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Kathreen's husband needs to purchase different types of edible items, as well as other items, for his business. Her husband can then increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. However, due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not able to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore, Kathreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. Kathreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband, who wants to increase his food stall business.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik lives with his wife (she is a teacher of music) and two sons in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. His daughter is already married and she lives with her family. Rafik has a higher education in economics and for several years he managed to work in his profession. Now farming is the main occupation that Rafik is engaged in.

In his farm Rafik has cows, bulls, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. Rafik shares his land work with his sons and he is happy to see how skillfully his sons cultivate potato, tomato and cucumber on their plot of land. Rafik sells these vegetables and his farm products (milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs) at the city’s wholesale market during the week.

Rafik asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he finds it very profitable for his farm to purchase one more cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle which he finds very profitable for his farm.

loans.name: Wendy Lorena

texts.es: Wendy tiene 22 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su madre a la que con mucho esfuerzo apoya ella es una joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa de su hija porque ella mantiene la economía del hogar. Wendy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace 5 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y su amabilidad cada día son más las personas que gustan de sus productos, pues demuestra que es una joven trabajadora y responsable. Wendy desea comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de pan para poder vender más en su negocio y así poder contar con una mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, levadura, manteca, sal, bandejas,  cilindro, y de esta manera tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, mejorando sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wendy is 22 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her mother, whom she painstakingly supports. She is a young woman who always shows her spirit of excellence, so her mother is very proud of her daughter since she takes care of the household expenses.

Wendy has been baking and selling bread for five years. Thanks to her experience and kindness, every day more people enjoy her products, which is testament to her being a responsible, hardworking young woman.

Wendy wants to buy more raw materials for making bread in order to sell more in her business so that she can have more customers. This is why she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in flour, yeast, lard, salt, and a baking cylinder and trays so she'll have more products to offer her clientele and improve her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in flour, yeast, lard, salt, and a baking cylinder and trays so that she has a greater variety of products to offer her clientele.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She admitted the fact that if only her husband worked for their family, then he would not be able to meet their household expenses and the educational needs of their children. This is the reason she started tailoring at home to support her family.

Both Rubina and her husband are managing their household while operating a business. She has been running her tailoring business for five years to support her family.

She has a lot of experience in tailoring work. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. To cope with the demand, she needs more reels of threads and packs of buttons, laces, zippers, etc.

Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses.

Rubina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads and packs of buttons, laces, zippers, etc. for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal.

She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arika Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is called Simon, a member of Arika Self help group. He is sixty-five years old, married, and a father of six. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

He does dairy farming and poultry keeping as his main business. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIHEA) training on financial management and record keeping that has enabled him to manage his business well.

He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase quality dairy and chicken feed that will consequently increase his production and income. This will assist him in catering to the family's needs such as food, medical expenses, and in paying school fees for his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase quality dairy and chicken feed that will consequently increase his production and income, hence meeting family needs such as food, medical expenses, and school fees.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo and operates a small sari-sari (general store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

She is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy more merchandise to sell, like drinks, noodles, canned goods, spices, sugar, coffee, biscuits, chips, soap, detergents, condiments and other items. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

Ruby is also in need of money to buy a new boat engine for their fishing boat. Perhaps they are engaged in other business opportunities like fishing. In the future, Ruby aspires to increase their livelihood to have better means of living. She wishes for good health and happiness for her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, noodles, canned goods, spices, sugar, coffee, biscuits, chips, soap, detergents, condiments and other items to sell, and to buy a boat engine.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 39-year-old married mother of four, who has been running her gym and providing sports services in her village for 23 years, working to help her husband in covering their family's increasing living expenses. She is a hard worker, well known in her region for the special prices she sets and the programs she provides to meet customers' needs.

Mirvat's income, combined with her husband's, isn't enough to cover their family's needs and develop her business at the same time. Although her business development was a result of previously acquired loans from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, where today she is benefiting from her sixth loan cycle, she is currently requesting a loan to pay for her children school tuition fees and requested stationery.

She will work hard to make sure that her work will keep on developing and meeting customers' expectations.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees and requested stationery.

loans.name: Aynabad

texts.ru: Это женщина Айнабад. Она из района Шахритус, который там  есть прекрасная погода. Шахритус  хороший район для развития сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Много поле для пасти скота, и для выращивания растения. Айнабад на районе живет вместе с детьми. Ее муж находится загранице. Айнабад занимается животноводством около 6 лет. Она хорошо ухаживает о животных. Айнабад покупает скота  и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке.  На этом ей помогает ее дети.  Доход от животноводческой деятельности обеспечить ее семью. Айнабад хочет увеличить численность скота и расширить деятельность. Путем расширения деятельность увеличить доход, и она может хорошо обеспечить детей. Айнабад надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This woman is Aynabad. She is from the Shahrituz region, where there is wonderful weather. Shahrituz is a good region for developing agricultural businesses. There are a lot of fields for pasturing livestock and growing crops.

Aynabad lives with her children in the country. Her husband is abroad. Aynabad has been raising livestock for around 6 years, and she is good at taking care of them. She buys livestock and fattens them up for a few months, then resells them at the livestock market. Her children help her with this. The income from Aynabad's livestock-rearing activities provides for her family.

Aynabad wants to increase her quantity of livestock and expand her activities. Expanding her business will increase her income, and she will be able to better provide for her children. Aynabad relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to enlarge her herd.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training it offers, especially on enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming including poultry and crop farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy manure and certified seeds and hence increase production. With increased income, she will be able to feed her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy manure and certified seeds to increase production and hence earn more income to feed her family.

loans.name: Syaeful

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Syaeful, one of Ruma's agents. Syaeful lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about three hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two daughters. Syaeful owns a small stall, where he sells meatballs and noodles and mobile airtime credits for his community. Syaeful is a hardworking man, and his customers see him as a trusted mobile provider.

With support from Ruma’s staff, Syaeful sees some improvements in his business. As the business is growing, Syaeful is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Syaeful improve his business, and in turn his community, which needs access to the services he provides.

As seen in the photo, Syaeful is the one who is standing in his own small stall. He is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community.

loans.name: Bini's Group

texts.en:
The lady standing on the left hand side wearing a white-colored sari with floral print in the photo is Bini. Bini is 32 years old and is staying with her husband and her four children. She is a differently abled lady. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in cultivation for a long time.

She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered another woman from her neighbourhood and told her about her plan. The other member liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sold them in her village.

Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, ladyfingers, and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to them.

Bini, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum in order to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale. She will purchase fertile land where she can cultivate the green vegetables and a high-yielding variety of seeds in order to get superior-quality vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has a four-year-old daughter.

Her husband is a “habal-habal’ (Visayan term for a motorcycle that has an extended seat to accommodate more passengers) driver while Cecilia is running a sari-sari store business, and she is selling “tuba” (which means coconut wine). She has been doing this for two years. Cecilia and her husband work hard to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their daughter. They also want to give her a good education.

In the future, Cecilia wants to increase their livelihood to have better means of living. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, toiletries, laundry soap, spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, chips, biscuits, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, and juice.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, toiletries, laundry soap, spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, chips, biscuits, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, and juice.

loans.name: Njokerio United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Susan. She is a member of Njokerio United Self-Help group. She is 52 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She grows potatoes and operates a butcher shop.

Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise and financial management, she learnt how to draw her budget and plan well for the future. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva, which she intends to use in boosting her butchery business by adding more stock of beef. She plans to use profits generated from the enterprise to meet family needs.

She is grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the support, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beef that will boost her butchery business and earn more income to meet family expenses.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 42-year-old married woman from the City of Baybay, Leyte.

Early this year, this woman started her own business to be able to help her husband in their financial stability. She owns a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of goods such as chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, and juice. She works every day running this business while her husband is working at a construction site.

The profits she earns from her sales aren't enough for this woman who dreams of sustainability. She wants to improve their ways of living, as to have enough money to buy their daily needs such as food, personal care products, and a variety of beverages. She even needs money for her children’s school payments.

In all, she has eight children: one adult and seven school-aged children. That's why she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of stock (mentioned earlier) to continue running her business for her family.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, and juice.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman. She has 4 children.

She operates a dairy farm where she produces milk. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs to ena her to increase milk production.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be God-fearing.

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be pests that attack cereals.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

He hopes that in the future, he will open a big cereals store. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
Raphael, the man raising his hand, is a member of Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group. He joined Hand in Hand in 2013. He is 48 years old and married, and he has been blessed with four children.

Raphael is a maize and beans farmer. After being trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has learned ways of managing and improving his farming business. He is borrowing his second loan, to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer with which to boost his farming. This will lead to more income; thus, he will be able to provide for his family's basic needs with ease. He is happy for the support from Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer that will boost his farming, enabling him to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is an old and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and two children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 12 years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of their entire family.

Razia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring tools and supplies, e.g., pieces of cloth, needles, and a sewing machine. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy the above items for his business purpose. Therefore Razia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband to obtain these tailoring tools and supplies to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income. For this financial assistance, Razia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband, for his tailoring business purposes.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 41-year-old, single lady. She started a baking business from her house six years ago, to cover the expenses and needs of her family. Her family is comprised of three members, and she is their sole earner.

Today, Amira is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to acquire a front glass display for her bakery. This is her second experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, since she benefited from a previous loan to renovate her oven and buy a car, which facilitated her business and allowed her to provide her customers with better service. She proved to be a good-standing borrower.

She hopes to stay capable of expanding her business more, in the future.

loans.use: to acquire a front glass display for her bakery.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is 25 years old, and he lives with his pretty wife and a year-old son, in Sevan city, of Gegharkunik region. Ashot has no higher education. For some time he used to work as a driver. Now, being the only bread-winner in his young family, he does his best to earn more from his farming. He greatly wants to make his farm richer with cattle, in future. Now he has a cute farm with cows, a calf, pigs, sheep, and a lamb. With the help of his beloved wife, Ashot sells his farm’s milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, and meat.

As he describes, he thinks a lot and looks for any new ways of earning more income for his lovely family. Still this loan of 500,000 Armenian Drams will be greatly helpful for him, because his farm cattle need fodder. He is going to buy a lot of it for his all farm cattle, with the help of this loan amount.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as polite.

He operates a farm where he grows bananas and beans. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy water pipes to enable him to channel water to his farm. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his standard of living.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy water pipes

loans.name: Mutie

texts.en:
Mutie is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he sells bread, flour, sugar, salt, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, salt, and other items.

He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Weseiyo Women Group

texts.en:
Dinah, the lady raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Weseiyo Women Group. She is 37 years old with four children who are in primary school, and she is married and lives with her four children and her husband.

She does dairy farming. She is taking a loan to purchase fodder for her cows. She hopes that her business will do well, thus enabling her to increase her level of income. This will also enable her to be in a position to provide her children with quality education and medication.

Dinah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for her cows that will improve milk production, resulting in more income to provide quality education and medication.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a 50-year-old married woman. Her husband provides transportation services, using a motorized rickshaw. He has been driving it over rough roads, which has caused a lot of depreciation. He separated the moto-rickshaw's body from the motorbike. He decided to keep the motorbike for personal use and wants to buy a new moto-rickshaw for transportation purposes.

He is jobless nowadays and does not have cash in hand for purchasing a new rickshaw. Rani has requested a loan so she can help her husband in purchasing a new moto-rickshaw.

Rani thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new moto-rickshaw to provide an occupation for her husband so he can drive and feed his sibling.

loans.name: Kuyiato

texts.en:
Kuyiato is a married woman. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: L’Union B Group

texts.fr: Kanane est commerçante qui s'entraide avec son mari, membre du groupe solidaire «L’union B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 28 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont 5 scolarisés et 4 sont des jumelles encore gosses. Elle est propriétaire d’un magasin où elle vend des pagnes depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 75 pieces de pagnes. Elle commença son business  avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kanane is a retailer who works together with her husband. She is a member of solidarity group "Union B," a client of IMF Hekima. She is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman, and a mother of nine. Five of the children go to school, and four are twin daughters still in infancy.

She is the owner of a store where she has been selling "pagnes," local dresses, for five years. She will stock up with seventy-five pieces of them. She started her business with capital received from her husband.

She wants to increase her capital, buy a plot of land, send her children to school, and feed them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: helps a member stock up with 75 pieces of local "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Luisa De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Luisa de 34 años de edad vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hijo de 14 años y sus hijas de 2 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se esfuerza por ofrecer todo lo necesario a sus hijos, y esto lo logra gracias a un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Así también su compañero de vida le ayuda con la economía del hogar y gracias a ello puede solventar sus necesidades básicas. Luisa en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, labiales, etc. de esta manera aumentar los productos de su negocio para aumentar las ventas y así poder seguir aportando a la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Luisa is 34 and lives with her partner, their 14-year-old son, and their daughters, aged 2 and 9. She is a responsible and hard-working person who makes every effort to meet her children's needs. She achieves this thanks to a small business selling beauty products by catalogue. Her partner also helps her with the household expenses, and thanks to that she can cover their basic needs.

Luisa is trying to improve her quality of life, and so is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in items such as creams, lotions, deodorants, make-up and lipstick. In this way, she can increase her business products and therefore her sales. Thus, she can carry on contributing to the household finances.

loans.use: to invest in items such as creams, lotions, deodorants, make-up and lipstick. Therefore, she can increase her business products and her sales.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad, tiene 15 años de residir en vivienda propia en la cual vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 2, 13 y 14 años de edad. Ella en busca de mantener la economía del hogar con mucho esfuerzo ha instalado una pequeña tienda en su vivienda, gracias a este negocio poco a poco va logrando mejorar la condición de vida de su familia, y así también su compañero de vida ayuda con los gastos de la vivienda. El negocio con el paso del tiempo ha ido obteniendo clientes, y es por ello que María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: salsas, arroz, consomé, golosinas, etc. para aumentar la cantidad y variedad de productos y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: María is 35-years old.  She has been living in her own home for fifteen years with her husband and their three children, who are 2-, 13- and 14-years old respectively.  In search of a way to support the household finances, María used a lot of hard work to set up a small store in her home.  Thanks to her business, she has been able to, little by little, improve her family's standard of living and help her husband with the household expenses.  With time, the business has gained customers, and htat is why María is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She wants to invest in salsas, rice, broth, sweets etc. to increase the quantity and variety of her products so she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest in salsas, broths, sweets etc. to increase the quantity and variety of her products and increase her sales.

loans.name: Mario German

texts.es: Mario de 45 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, por quienes se esfuerza día con día en su negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio que administra desde hace más de dos años y lo que le permite tener un número bastante grande de clientes. La venta de sus zapatos las realiza fuera de su comunidad, y para transportar su mercadería utiliza su carro el cual se le ha averiado y debido a ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: piezas de motor y mano de obra para  instalación en el vehículo, ya que es el medio con el cual transporta su mercadería.
texts.en:
Mario, age 45, lives with his partner and his children, ages 3 and 6.  He makes a great effort every day on their behalf in his business selling shoes.  He has been running this business for more than two years, and it has allowed him to have a fairly large number of customers.  

He sells these shoes outside of his community, and in order to transport his merchandise he uses his car.  The car has broken down.  Because of that, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in motor parts and the labor costs to install them in the vehicle, because this is how he transports his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy motor parts and pay for labor costs to install them in his vehicle

loans.name: Vision Self Help Group

texts.en:
Susan, the lady raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Vision Self Help Group. She is forty-six years old and married with six children. Susan lives with her six children and her husband. She joined HiH EA in the year 2015 and successfully went through enterprise trainings.

She does dairy farming. She is applying for a loan to purchase high quality fodder for her cows. She hopes that her business will do well and thus enable her to increase her level of income. This will enable her to be in a position to provide her children with quality education and other basic needs such as food.

Susan is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase high quality fodder for her cows to increase production and income and pay for her children's quality education.

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José con 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos,en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican a las labores agrícolas a la compra y venta de animales de corral y al comercio de venta de abarrotes.

José se dedica a la compra y venta de chala(panca-alimento para cuyes), con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para compra de chala y para mantenimiento de motocarguera, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor stock de dicho producto, con gran influencia en el negocio.

José es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido tres créditos de 3000,00; 1900,00 y 2000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
José is 42 and lives with his partner and their 2 children in their own house in a rural area. Their home is in the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the departament of Lambayeque in Peru. The inhabitants of his area are typically involved in agricultural work, buying and selling domestic animals, and selling groceries.

José has more than 5 years' experience buying and selling Peruvian corn leaves for guinea-pig food. He runs his business from home.

He is asking for a loan to buy Peruvian corn and to maintain his motorcycle-trailer. This investment will help him increase his stock, and thus improve his business.

José is a habitual borrower through Edpyme Alternativa. He has taken out three loans of 3,000, 1,900, and 2,000 PEN, which were all repaid promptly. Since he has been a member, his business and his quality of life have all improved.

loans.use: to buy Peruvian corn leaves and to maintain his motorcycle-trailer.

loans.name: Ridwan

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ridwan, one of Ruma's agents. Ridwan lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about 3 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ridwan is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity. Ridwan has a really high spirit to improve his life and that’s what makes his business become better each day.

As the business grows, Ridwan is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. Ridwan’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Ridwan is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is a 51-year-old, married woman. Her son (the man shown with her above) operates a construction business, which is the primary source of their income. He is responsible for building the roofs of houses during their construction. In this way, he is able to earn a sufficient income to provide for their family. However, in order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required. For the growth of her husband's business, Balqees has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. This will allow him to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so he can meet his customers’ demands without any delays.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate so her son can meet his customers’ demands without any delays

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant cinq enfants à charge, Justine se bat  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des plateaux d’œufs. Pour s’approvisionner, Justine se rend trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des plateaux d’œufs. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Justine va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Justine is a 45-year-old married woman living in Adidogome.

With five dependent children, Justine works hard to earn revenues by selling egg cartons. To procure merchandise, Justine goes to the market three times a month. She is requesting this loan to order egg crates.

With the profit margin that will result from good sales, Justine will be able to help her husband with the household’s daily expenses and to support her children’s school education.

loans.use: to buy 68 crates of eggs.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme âgée de 37 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Mariée, Marie vit avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Marie est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Marie demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des unités de chaussures fermées et des tapettes en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Marie is a 37-year-old woman living in Adidogome. She is married and lives with her husband and two children.

Marie is a shoe retailer who procure her merchandise twice a month from the market. She resells from home and itinerantly in the neighboring areas. Marie is requesting this loan to make her purchase of closed-toe and flip-flop shoes.

Her goal is to improve her sales and make a profit, so that she can help her husband provide for their children’s education and contribute to some of the household’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy eighteen pairs of flip-flops and twenty pairs of closed-toe shoes.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 26-year-old single man living in a small village in the South of Lebanon. He has owned a small business in the field of construction since 2005, specializing in painting houses. He has 12 years of experience in this domain.

Enhancing his business at this stage is very crucial because it would allow him to gain a reputation in the future and increase his customers, thus his revenue. Therefore, he contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a Youth loan. He will use this loan in order to purchase a new car, which will help him transport his work kit from one construction field to the next.

He was supposed to purchase this car through his previous loan, but he faced urgent financial requests, which forced him to postpone this need.

As for the future, Hussein wishes to develop and expand his business in order to take charge of larger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a new car to help him transport his work kit from one construction field to the next.  .

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Florence. She is 27 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.
She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is borrowing a loan to buy more stock of vegetables for her grocery, thus gaining more sales. This will increase her level of income, thus allowing her to provide better education and medical services for her children.

She is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables for her grocery thus earning more income to provide better education and medical services for her children.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia  sigue  dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar plátanos, manzanas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" communal bank. She continues with her business selling fruit. She is a responsible and determined person. She feels grateful for the awarded loan and promises to comply with the established payments. She continues to sell her merchandise to her clients on demand this being the way she gets her family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy bananas and apples amongst others.

loans.use: to buy bananas and apples amongst others.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 60 years old and from Moalboal, Cebu. She has one dependent, aged eight years old.

She has engaged in a sari-sari store business since 2013. Lucia would like to improve her inventory level and include buying items in bulk for a better profit. She is asking for a loan to buy items like sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food, and biscuits.
