She hopes that, with the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her income for her child. She dreams of making her store bigger someday.

loans.use: to  buy sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food, and biscuits.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Developing her farm and having more income, Hranush is very happy and pleased with her first Kiva loan and greatly hopes for a second Kiva loan.

Hranush lives alone in Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. She used to be employed as a cleaner at different rest houses, but now her only occupation is farming and agricultural activities. On her farm, she has cows, calves, heifers, bulls, pigs, sheep, and chickens.

Hransuh sells her farm products, mainly from her farm, to her regular customers. She sells milk, macun (the national dairy product), cheese, curd, meat, and eggs. As she did previously, she cultivates potatoes on her land and re-sells them constantly, getting them from her farm.

Hransuh likes her farming work and she does all of it properly and never minds if it will be more than usual. That is why she decided to request one more Kiva loan, which she wants to use for the purchase of two more calves for her farm and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves for her farm and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Lonah. She is 53 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

She rears goats and sheep to earn a living. She is borrowing to purchase a dairy goat that will help boost milk productivity. This will increase her output and thus income level which will allow her to continue supporting her family by providing them with quality education and better medical services.

Lonah is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy goat that will help boost milk productivity which will increase her output and thus provide more income to help meet family needs.

loans.name: Ume  Kalsoom

texts.en: Ume Kalsoom is a hardworking lady. Everyday increasing expenditures compelled her to initiate her own business of selling milk. She is a 46-year-old married woman.  She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Her job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, she has requested 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude has finished paying her previous loan. She was able to expand her businesses, leading to more income. This enabled her to support her children's education. She is borrowing more money from Kiva to expand her businesses further by buying more stock of charcoal and chickens to boost her enterprise. She looks forward to more income that will ensure she can provide her family needs with ease.

Gertrude is grateful to Kiva for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy chickens and add to her charcoal stock.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS “, la  socia continua dedicándose al negocio de costura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas, agujas, hilos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras (Working Mothers) communal bank. She still makes her living as a seamstress. She is responsible and hard working. She has had this business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the work she puts into it everyday.

This member would like to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fabrics, needles, thread and other supplies. She is thankful for the loan she has been given and promises to make the agreed upon payments

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Señor Pasion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yucay, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth ella es soltera y tiene 46 años; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Señor Pasion.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Señor Pasion Communal Bank. The bank is located in the District of Yucay, in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Elizabeth, who is 46, is a member of this group, and is single. She is a primary teacher, working from 8 am until 2 pm. She has been in this profession for 8 years, and it is going very well. She is a very hard-working person who helps her children by means of this work. Her dream is to have a business selling clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy a sound system for her home.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo requested permission to have his photo taken after the meeting, for work reasons.

The member whose face is obscured by a circle is no longer a member of the Señor Pasion group.

The other members engage in businesses providing internet services, selling clothing, offering groceries, and running a restaurant.

Elizabeth is grateful to those who are helping her dream come true in this manner, and she promises to make the repayments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for her home.

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny Margot ella es soltera y tiene 38 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Siempre Unidos". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Yenny Margot. She is single and 38 years old, with two children. She works in her restaurant business, where she makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and sautéed beef. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetable and chicken.

The member whose photo is pasted to the group photo took the photo after the meeting as she asked for permission due to work reasons. The other members work in businesses such as clothing sales, food sales, grocery stores, and craft sales.

She appreciates those who are forming part of this dream through these means and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, who used the previous loan to buy shirts, trousers, skirts, and children's wear for selling, is a resident of Kasese, Uganda. With the profits, he was able to repay the loan, repair his motorcycle, and look after his family.

He still does crop farming and a motorcycle transport business. He still complains of inadequate capital and the ever-changing tastes and preferences of his customers. Despite these hardships, Edward sees his business grow into a modern boutique in his area, with the latest fashions and dreams.

He will use the loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 41 and the mother of five children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and has been selling fresh fruits from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can maximize sales in the fruit-selling business.

Therefore, Maryam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal fruits to resell. Maryam thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy excess seasonal fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Norma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma sigue con su negocio de venta de lechones y tamales para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra manteca, carne entre otros.
texts.en: This member belongs to the Velasco Astete community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cuzco. Norma has the same business selling suckling pigs and tamales to her customers. She is a responsible, hard working person. She has had this business for along time. It gives her personal satisfaction because it is how she supports her family. She is asking for a loan to buy lard, meat and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy lard, meat and other supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
For the last 12 years, Rose and her husband have earned a living through fishing. Rose is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Concepcion, Iloilo.

Her goal for the future is to increase her income to have enough money to send her children to school and become successful someday. To do this, she wants to borrow money to buy a new fishing boat. This will help them in their daily fishing activity and will enhance their catch.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Fareena

texts.en:
Fareena is a 39 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 2 children. Her husband has a shop. Fareena has been running her own beauty saloon for past 20 years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items.

Therefore Fareena has applied for Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Fareena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her salon business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with children. He deals in a poultry project and does crop farming as a source of side income. Through this, he has been able to provide for his family.

At the moment, Joseph would love to construct a house and fulfill his family's dream, but lacks enough money to buy some materials like cement and timber on site. Joseph is requesting a loan facility to purchase construction materials like cement and timber for his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like cement and timber for his house.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 42-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for the past 25 years, her husband is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family and manage the household.

Parveen's husband wants to purchase different types of crockery, e.g jugs, glasses, dinner sets, etc. to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints her husband is not in the position to buy this merchandise for reselling purposes. To fulfill his business needs Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also be helpful for him to increase his daily sales and earn a more profitable income to manage the business and family's needs.

Parveen is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy glasses and jugs for her husband's crockery business.

loans.name: Si Se Puede Group

texts.es:
os socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SI SE PUEDE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juliana ella es soltera y tiene 61 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesania.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Sí se puede”. It is located in the district of Cusco, in the Cusco Province and Cusco Region.

The member is Mrs. Juliana. She is a 61-year-old single woman with 6 children. She works at her business, which is a restaurant, and prepares different dishes like baked chicken, soups and stir-fried meat.

She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and she has done this work for 8 years. The business has done well and her dream is to have her own restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking products like rice, vegetables and chicken.

The members added to the group picture asked for permission to leave due to work reasons. The other members have businesses selling food, clothing, handicrafts and grocery stores.

The member would like to thank the people who are part of this dream and she commits to comply with her payments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy cooking products like rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Sumaq Tikari Mandorpujio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAQ TIKARI MANDORPUJIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina ella es conviviente y tiene 29 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Sumaq Tikari Mandorpujio". This bank is located in the Challabamba district, in the Paucartambo province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Vicentina, who is in a relationship, is 29 years old, and has 4 children. She works selling cereals, such as corn, wheat and quinoa. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a space where she can sell cereals. She is requesting the loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other members work in businesses such as animal sales, cereal sales, a grocery store, and an agricultural business.

She appreciates those who are forming part of this dream through these means and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is thankful for his first Kiva deal several years ago and today he again needs Kiva support and greatly hopes to have it for the second time. Armen is 30 years old and he lives with his wife, daughter and parents in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. This farmer is already a skilled bee keeper and in his village and even far away his farm’s honey is famous and has great demand. In his farm he has a lot of bee hives, also cows, pigs, sheep, turkeys and chickens.

With the help of his father Armen also takes care of their nice orchard full of apple, apricot and fig trees. So all the farm products (milk, meat and eggs) and also the fruits of his orchard Armen sells at the city’s wholesale market. Being so devoted to his farming he greatly wants to make it bigger and richer.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Armen asks as his farm cattle has lack of fodder and he likes to buy enough of it.

loans.use: his farm cattle has lack of fodder and he likes to buy enough of it

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children, who has been her cupping health services (in Chinese medicine) a therapy in which heated glass cups are applied to the skin along the meridians of the body, creating suction as a way of stimulating the flow of energy); since 2006, with fifteen years of experience in her domain.

May is a hard working woman, who puts so much effort to develop her business and support her family.
Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her daughter's Health Surveillance university tuition fees. She is working hard to develop her business so that she can open a specialized center providing cupping services.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's Health Surveillance university tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS, él socio  sigue dedicándose al negocio de transporte, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio continua trabajando en su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
  El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Madres Trabajadoras”. The member continues working in transportation, and is a responsible and hardworking person.

He continues working in his business, which gives him personal satisfaction, and in this way he is able to support his family. The member is grateful for the loan and commits to comply with the payments.

The member will use the loan to buy tires.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Alicia Almira

texts.es:
Alicia, de 65 años de edad, creció junto a sus padres quienes le enseñaron las actividades de la agricultura y ganadería, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera y sus hijos tienen sus propios hogares pero le ayudan a realizar las labores agrícolas.

Alicia, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo desempeña desde hace varios años junto a sus hijos, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde ella dedica a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche.

Alicia, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca que le vende su hermano, se la está vendiendo para que pueda producir más leche y le genere mejores ingresos.

Alicia, sueña con comprar un terreno donde pastar y poder sembrar, porque actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Alicia is 65 years old. She was raised by her parents who taught her agricultural and livestock farming work. She studied until the ninth grade. She is single and her children have their own homes, but they help her with the farm work.

She works in agriculture, and has been doing this job for some years with her children. They work during the morning in the fields and in the afternoon she works milking the cows in order to sell the milk.

She needs the loan to buy a cow that her brother is selling her. He is selling her the cow so that she can produce more milk and generate more profits.

She dreams of buying land where she can graze her animals and plant, because she is currently renting.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz , 38 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Shehnaz  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 45000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc

loans.name: Chesa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand in the photo is Peter. He is fifty five years old, married and a father of four. All his children are in school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
He does maize and beans farming as his main business. He has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled him in budgeting and record keeping.

He is taking a loan to buy quality fertilizer so that he can increase his output. This will assist him to cater for family needs and in paying school fees.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer so that he can increase farm output and thus more income.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a car for 5 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to make maintenance of his car because the current condition of his car is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his car. Therefore Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Shabana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shabana also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband repair his car.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia continúa dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, leche entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working at her grocery store. She has had her business for a long time, and it has done well thanks to the effort that she puts on her work every day.

She continues selling basic products like rice, sugar, milk and cookies, among others. She wishes to keep working so she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, milk and other products.

She is grateful for the loan and commits to comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk and other products.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has been in the business of tricycle transport for the last five years. She and her husband rely on this business to support their 11-year-old daughter.

She is asking for a loan to buy a new tire and two sprockets for their vehicle. With the help of these parts, she can be assured that her business will continue without any delay and she can be prepared for any inconvenience.

Mary Jane hopes to buy another tricycle as part of her plan to expand. Her income will be for school fees and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy a new tire and two sprockets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a trading centre and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of rice. Her business goal is to sell more variety of cereals within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
This is Asep, one of Ruma's agents. Asep lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about 3 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have one child. Asep owns a stall that sells mobile phone's accessories and mobile airtime credits for his community.

As the business grows, Asep is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Asep improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Asep’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a latest Ruma’s product called Mapan.

As seen in the photo, Asep is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo, de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera, se dedica a la agricultura y se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su hijo para realizar sus actividades diarias. 

Consuelo, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio se lo enseñaron sus padres; durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas, para elaborar queso que luego vende entre los vecinos y en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Consuelo, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, para producir más leche y empezar a ampliar su negocio de lácteos.

Consuelo, sueña con comprar un terreno para poder pastar sus animales y sembrar granos básicos.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 66 years old, studied until the ninth grade, and is single. She works in agriculture and wakes up at 4:30am. She performs her daily work with her son. She works in agriculture, a trade she learned from her parents. During the morning they work in the fields and in the afternoon they work milking the cows to make cheese. She later sells the cheese to neighbors and people around her town.

She needs the loan in order to buy a milking cow to produce more milk and start to expand her dairy business. She dreams of buying land where her animals can graze and where she can plant basic grains.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Atiya

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Atiya to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Atiya is 42 years old married woman and a mother of 2 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling.

She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 32, has been farming for the past 10 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals.

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Beatrice could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. Beatrice believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. Beatrice also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Beatrice to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Umoja Pamoja Women Group

texts.en:
The woman raising her hand is called Mary, a member of Umoja Pamoja Women Group. She is forty seven years old, married and blessed with eight children. Three children are in primary school. Mary’s economic activities are potatoes and beans farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2015 and she has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which have equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. She hopes her business will improve hence increase her income. She will therefore be able to support her family and educate her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to improve production hence earn more income to pay school fees.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54-years-old, married and a mother of ten children.

She does vegetable farming to earn a living. She is borrowing a loan to purchase a motorcycle for transport purposes and hopes that this will help her create employment for one of her sons and also generate more income that will ensure they meet the family's needs with ease.

Rebecca is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her son's transport business to earn an income to meet the family's needs.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en: Yasser is a 44-year-old Palestinian refugee and a married father of four children. He has run a mobile fruits and vegetables stand since 2000. He is his family's sole breadwinner and works hard to improve their living. Yasser is seeking stability, which is why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to open a fruits and vegetables shop. He is working hard to make sure that this shop will provide his family with a better income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To open a fruits and vegetables shop

loans.name: Pacar Seribu Group

texts.en:
The need for “Pacar” flowers as offerings for Hindu never stops. They need it every day and the demand from the market is always high. This situation makes the flower farmers happy, and it stimulates them to work hard and make sure their land produces a lot of flowers.

Ni Putu successfully repaid her loan after she had a good harvest. Now the price for 1 kg of “Pacar” flowers is 40,000 IDR. She can earn a satisfactory profit, but it is less then before, because the dry season is too long and a lot of flowers died. Ni Putu does not just rely on her farming, as she also has other businesses as a breeder and has a small kiosk.

Her new loan will be used to purchase “Pacar” flower seeds, fertilizer and some merchandise for her kiosk. Other businesses will increase her income to support her dream to renovate her house and rent more land to plant “Pacar” flowers. Ni Putu hopes the village government can provide a new water source for farmers, to keep the land fertile and to produce a maximum result.

Ni Putu, is in the front row, right, and raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase “Pacar” flower seeds, fertilizer and some merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 45-year-old, woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with nine children; three adults and six school-aged children. To earn a living, Vivian and her husband are engaged in fishing. They raised their children by doing this business. For almost 20 years, it has been their main source of income.

Vivian wishes to borrow money to buy fishing net and materials for their fishing boat to enhance their catch. In the future, she wishes to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to send her children to school to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and materials for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 36 years old. This woman with her husband and two sons lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Aida runs farming with her husband and it is the only way to sustain their family’s needs. They have rather rich farm with cows, calves, a bull, sheep and lambs in it. Her farm is also very popular of perfect harvest of potato that they cultivate on their plot of land and sell it to re-sellers right from the farm. Aida also sells milk and great assortment of meat to several butchers from the Sevan city. As Adia likes to say with her husband they do they best to be good examples for their sons, and show them that it will be great if both of them continue their parent’s work and develop their farm more and more.

This loan of 600.000 Armenian drams Aida asks as she wants to buy a cow, a calf and also fodder for all his farm cattle, and she is already feels happy to have a chance for more cattle and also enough fodder for them as well.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf and also fodder for all his farm cattle and she is already feels happy to have a chance for more cattle

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Most of the Kenyan people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Tabitha, 51, who is based in the Chuka area of Kenya and is a mother of two adorable and lovely children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years and managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy goat farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my goats”. Her hobby is milking her dairy goat. 

She sells goat milk to her neighbors and at the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy goat, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy goat she plans to buy is not just an ordinary goat; it’s a quality breed of dairy goat that will produce between 1 to 2 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate into more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. 

Tabitha is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her goat milk business by packaging the milk before selling it. She also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy an extra dairy goat to increase milk productivity.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a widowed woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells jaggery. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of jaggery. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of jaggery

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be capable. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows maize, peas, potatoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Pilsila

texts.en:
Pilsila, 59, is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm she keeps cows and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Pilsila makes a commission on sales for which she helps arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work.

Given that Pilsila can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell it at a profit. Your loan will help Pilsila’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals from farmers to resell.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis, whose business is that of a boutique and selling palm oil, is a resident of Kasese district. He got engaged in this business for family development. He loves to serve his community as he keeps his personal relationship with his neighbors.

Since Denis and his community all suffer a problem of traveling long distances to access education and medical facilities, Denis has a big dream of starting up a school such that his people and children can access nearby facilities. Although he keeps his hopes high, Denis is affected by limited capital. He intends to use the loan to buy clothes and palm oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 58 years old, a widow. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Shamim has requested for a loan of 60,000 PKR.

She wants to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is married with children. He sells passion fruit and does farming to supplement his income. He is doing very well in his businesses. He has a desire to educate his children, and own a good home as well.

At the moment, Edson wants to construct a residential house. He already has some materials on site like bricks and timber, but lacks more materials like cement, sand and aggregate. He is requesting for money to buy the remaining materials and start the construction.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement

loans.name: Salamat

texts.en:
Salamat has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more stocks of  grocery items, such as grains, sugar, flour and rice. It will help her meet customers' demands on time.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grocery items, such as grains, sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Sabban

texts.en: Sabban  has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good income to contribute to the family household. Previously with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour, and rice. It will help her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nyumba Moja Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Francis a member of Nyumba Moja Self Help Group. He is fifty six years old, married and blessed with eight children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015.
Francis is a farmer who grows vegetables. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he was not able to keep his farming records. However, after undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, Francis knew how to keep proper records and explore appropriate market for his farm produce.

He is borrowing from Hand in Hand in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for top dressing to increase his farm produce and thus boost vegetable farming. He looks forward to more income that will enable him cater for his family needs such as food, shelter and school fees for his children.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase farm produce for increased income to meet family needs

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 50 years old lady and a responsible mother of 7 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own shoes business for past 15 years. Rukhsana's husband needs to purchase different varities and brands of shoes for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase shoes.

To fulfill the need of her husband Rukhsana has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy shoes. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.
Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's shoe selling business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Elizabeth. She is 57 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She practices maize and dairy farming. Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings and enterprise development, she has been able to run her business effectively.

She is borrowing a loan from Kiva, which she will use to purchase dairy meal that will help to improve her dairy farming. This will lead to more income that she will use to support her family. She is very grateful to Kiva and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed to improve dairy farming production for increased income.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Four years ago, and after being through difficult circumstances, she started to work at her house as a beautician. She is a skilled worker always pleasing her customers. And now, she states that she requires having more make up tools and equipment which she will acquire by the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. she is eager to receive those funds hoping that it will help her improve her business as well as her way of living.

loans.use: to buy more make up tools and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds,  vaccines and worn out drinkers

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved livelihood. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 42-years-old. He is married and blessed with three children.

He has borrowed money to purchase farm inputs hoping this will help him generate income.

His hopes and dreams for the future is to purchase enough fertilizers, improve the living standard of the family and start a new business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells goats. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought, which affects livestock.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more goats. Her business goal is to start selling cows within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man who has one child. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be breakdowns.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Evli is married and a mother of three. She has been making jewellery for years. She adds to the family budget because her husband is working as a laborer in constructions and his salary is not enough for the family. She has used loans four times. With the help of the loans she bought materials in bulk for jewellery making, produced them, sold them, gained money.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Evli üç çocuk annesi. Takı işini uzun yıllardır yapıyor. Eşi inşaat işçisi olduğundan çocuklarını okutmada aileye destek oluyor Ayşe hanım. Dört kez mikro kredi kullandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile takı malzemeleri boncuk takı aparatlarını toptan alarak ve işleyerek sattı ve para kazandı. Aldığı yeni mikro kredi ile de takı malzemelerini boncuk ve aparatları toptan alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Adinani

texts.en: Adinadi operates a carpentry workshop and transport business  to generate income. He also earns a monthly salary for additional income. In 2005, Adinadi started business with an aim of family support given the fact that he has 5 children to look after. He is so hardworking that after all this he has seen that the motorcycle transport business is doing well for him that he needs to buy many motorcycles to get more income. He then requests for a loan facility to buy another motorcycle for transport business. He meets hardships of inadequate capital to sustain all his businesses and family at large.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Flor De Transito

texts.es:
Flor, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, se dedica a la agricultura y se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a sus padres para realizar las actividades diarias.

Flor, se dedica a trabajar durante la mañana en un molino que posee y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a vender ropa para ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.

Flor, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para poder surtir su negocio de ropa, porque el inventario que tiene es limitado y eso hace que pierda clientes.

Flor, sueña con comprar un vehículo para ofrecer sus productos en otros lugares fuera de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Flor is 31 years old, studied through high school, is single and works in agriculture. She wakes up at 4:30am, and performs her daily work with her parents. During the morning she works on a mill she has and in the afternoon she works selling clothing in order to help her family with the household expenses.

She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her clothing business, because her inventory is limited and this is making her lose customers.

She dreams of buying a vehicle to sell her products in other places outside of her town.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her clothing business.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom has successfully built her business of cropping. She is working hard to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva loans.

In order to purchase good quality soil, along with different types of seeds, Kalsoom has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase good quality soil, along with different types of seeds.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng lives in West Bandung, a semi-urban area located about three hour's drive from Jakarta. Neng owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma because she is interested in Ruma’s system; the sales executive will be coming to her stall to collect the money. Moreover, her community sees him as a friendly and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Neng is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her communities. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Neng improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. Ariana’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her customers, a Ruma latest product called ‘Mapan’.

As seen in the photo, Neng is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: The lady in this photo is Lucy. She is 38 years old and blessed with three children. She grows maize and beans, and she practices dairy farming. Having undergone training by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on savings and enterprise development, she has been able to run her business effectively. She is taking a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and fertilizer that will help increase her farm yield and income. She will use the income to support her family needs. She is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer that will help improve her farm yield.

loans.name: Dadi

texts.en:
Dadi lives in West Bandung, a suburban area located about 3 hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall that sells mobile phone's accessories and provides mobile airtime credits for his community.

As the business grows, Dadi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Dadi improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Dadi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a latest Ruma’s product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Dadi is the one who is standing. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits for his community.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia,who is in her early 40's is married with three kids who are still in school.She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years now. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.She used the previous loan to increase on her genge stock,which is now serving more people.She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her kids, to repay a loan, to renovate her house,bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.She will use this loan to restock the items in her genge stock to serve more peoples.She dreams of build her own house.
Rukia will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the items in her genge stock

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children, who still attends school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to satisfy the family's needs. And as for her, she is a housewife taking care of only her family.

Today, in order to pay her children’s educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register them with the upcoming school year. Her only target is to see them pursuing their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Bert

texts.en: Bert is a 32-year-old, Lebanese divorced woman. She lives with her Parents who represents the main source income and she is a mother for one child. To help her parent, she works as an employee in a company. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her child educational fees. She tends to help him and to provide him with a good education. This is her second loan and she wants to express her thanks for it.

loans.use: to pay her child educational fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the first installment of her child's school educational fees.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en: Roula is a 40 year old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and her four children, all of them are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Olga Maricela

texts.es:
Olga, de 18 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, se dedica a vender lácteos como (crema, queso y productos de primera necesidad), este oficio lo aprendió de su madre.

Olga, se levanta  a las 4:30 a.m. para realizar sus actividades diarias, que se centran en vender los diferentes productos que ofrece en su negocio de lácteos.

Olga, necesita el préstamo para comprar lácteos en mayores cantidades, para reducir los costos que le generara el estar comprando cantidades pequeñas.

Olga, sueña con comprar un vehículo para ofrecer sus productos en otros lugares de donde recide.
texts.en:
Olga is 18 years old, studied through high school, is single and works selling dairy products such as cream, cheese, and everyday goods. She learned this work from her mother. Olga wakes up at 4:30am to perform her daily work, which focuses on selling the different products she offers in her dairy business.

She needs the loan to buy dairy products in large quantities in order to reduce the costs generated by buying small quantities. She dreams of buying a vehicle to sell her products in other places than where she lives.

loans.use: to buy dairy products in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells goats. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goats.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of goats. Her business goal is to start seling cows within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business further.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goats

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather which affect quarrying. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy another quarry. His business goal is to have more quarries within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another quarry

loans.name: Las Orquideas De La Florida Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Orquídeas de la Florida” está conformado por socios de la misma zona se conocen entre sí, responsables con distintas actividades comerciales y uno de ellos es el joven Juan Carlos de 21  años soltero, Juan Carlos es un joven emprendedor él se dedica a la venta de mazamorra morada, arroz con leche, mazamorra de calabaza, hace 10 años, con los ingresos de su  trabajo diario apoya a sus padres y solventa sus gastos personales. Su mayor anhelo es poder ahorrar un pequeño capital para seguir sus estudios superiores. Solicito el crédito para comprar insumos (arroz, leche, azúcar, canela)para la preparación de sus  dulces. Juan Carlos es la primera persona que está parado al lado derecho de la foto.
Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "Las Orquideas de la Florida" Group is made up of members all from the same zone that know each other, responsible for different business activities. 

One of the members is young Juan Carlos, 21 years old and single. Juan Carlos is a young entrepreneur who has been selling rice pudding and other traditional desserts for 10 years. With the income from his daily work he supports his parents and pays his personal expenses.  His greatest dream is to save a bit of capital to continue his higher education. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies (rice, milk, sugar, cinnamon) for his dessert preparation. Juan Carlos is the first person standing on the right in the photo.

He is grateful to the Kiva investors for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy supplies (rice, milk, sugar, cinnamon)

loans.name: Nejme

texts.en: Nejme is a 56 year old married woman living with her husband and her four children, some of them are still studying at the university. Her husband is the main source income children to satisfy the family needs and being able to live in a good lifestyle and as per her she is dedicated only for her family. Today, in order to pay her children’s university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay the fees and to pursue their education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her children’s university fees

loans.name: Manale

texts.en: Manale is a 38-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, who are still studying. Her husband is the main income provider. She does not work; she cares for her home and family. Currently, with the aim to pay her children's study fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is a regular customer and insists that she will always ask for Kiva’s support to ensure a good educational path for her children. This is her primary goal.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a single woman living with her parents. In 2007, in order to help her family, she started her business by opening in her house a small room where she sells gadgets, makes up, perfumes, accessories, using her special selling skills and providing a high quality of products. She is well-known in her region with the unique objects that she offers, in addition to her friendly personality.

Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to increase her inventory and to renovate her room to meet the needs of her clients and therefore improve her business. In the future she is planning to take a new loan to open a small shop in her town.

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics inventory and to renovate her room

loans.name: Jesus Evelyn

texts.es:
La socia Jesús Evelyn pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jesús  Evelyn continua  con su  negocio de venta de  productos de belleza como colonias, cremas, perfumes entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.
texts.en:
Jesus Evelyn is a member of the Velasco Astete communal bank, located in the Cusco district, in the Cusco province, in the Cusco department.

Jesus Evelyn is continuing with her beauty product sales business. She sells cologne, creams, perfumes and other products. She feels grateful for the loan given to her and promises to make the established payments. She has been working in her business for some time, which gives her personal satisfaction because it allows her to get by with her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy colognes and other things.

loans.use: to buy colognes and other things.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE,la socia sigue dedicándose a la costura y alquiler de cuartos, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Velasco Astete communal banks. She continues to work in sewing and room rentals. She feels grateful for the loan given to her and promises to make the established payments. She is a very responsible and hardworking, and is how she gets by with her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy bed sheets and other things.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets among other things.

loans.name: Elsa Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia continua con su negocio de elaboración de tortas para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, huevos, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the Velasco Astete communal bank. The partner continues with her business of making cakes for the various events that require her services. The partner feels grateful for the loan given to her and promises to make the established payments. The partner is a responsible and hard working person. The partner has been working in her business for some time, which gives her personal satisfaction because it allows her to get by with her family. 

The partner is requesting the loan to buy flour, eggs and sugar, among other things.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy feed, canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits, and liquor.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 38 year old second hand clothes dealer at Voi Kenya. She is a single lady who has been in this business for the last eleven years doing well.

This is her sixth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after repaying the previous loans successfully, she will use the money to purchase bales of second hand clothes for resale and the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to own a clothing shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is 23 years old from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He lives with his mother, who works as a private nurse and gets 200 GEL fixed income. Nikoloz is involved in a small agricultural business, that isn't stable source of income for him and he has great desire to start his own business. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.

So, he decided to start trading business with the loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. With the loan of 1250 USD, he will open a store and purchase stock of fruits and vegetables. Nikoloz will start selling the products at the local market and will generate some income that will help him to tackle with the financial difficulties and make better living condition for his mother.
The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To trade with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sammary

texts.en: Sammary is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be successful. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour and other items. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, soap, flour and other items.

loans.name: Vuslat

texts.en:
Vuslat is divorced and has three children. After the divorce, she had financial problems and started making and selling jewelry. Now it has been 11 years since she started. Her children all graduated from universities. She now lives alone and says that she will work for herself. In the summertime, she sells her jewelry on stands on the seaside and in wintertime she sells at home gatherings of women. She also sells ready-made jewelry. With the help of her fifth loan, she is planning to buy jewellery materials and ready-made jewels in bulk.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Vuslat Hanım eşinden ayrı üç çocuk annesi. Eşinden ayrıldık dan sonra maddi imkansızlıktan başladığı takı yapıp satma işine on bir yıldır devam ediyor. Çocuklarını üniversite de okutmuş. Şuan yalnız yaşayan Vuslat Hanım artık kendi için çalışacağını söylüyor. Yaz sezonlarında sahilde tezgah açarak, kışın kadınların toplanma ve oyun günlerin de takılarını satıyor. Kendi yaptığı takıların yanın da hazır takı satışı da yapıyor. Aldığı beşinci kredi ile takı malzemesi ve hazır takı alacak.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make different types of jewelry.

loans.name: Şengül

texts.en:
Şengül is married and has three children who are going to schools. She makes home made böreks, cookies and pastries and sells them to a cafe. She also makes pastries and cakes for special days by order. This year she started making and selling jewellery on a stand at the seaside. She says that she works for her children to complete their education and not to have financial problems. Her daughters help her making jewelleryin the summer. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of cookie ingredients and materials for jewellery.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şengül Hanım evli eğitim gören üç çocuk annesi. Ev de hamur işleri (börek,su böreği, poğça, gözleme) yapıp cafe ye satıyor. Sipariş üzerine de özel günler de pasta ve hamur işleri yapıyor. Bu sene aynı zaman da akşamları sahilde tezgah açarak takı satışı yapmaya başladı. Çocuklarının maddi sıkıntı yaşamamasını, eğitim ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için çalıştığını vurguladı. Kızları da yazın annesine takı yaparak yardımcı oluyorlar. Aldığı kredi ile hamur malzemeleri ve takı alacak.

loans.use: to buy cookie ingredients and  jewelry making materials.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 47 years old and has two children. She is really attached to her family. Her husband works tirelessly to be able to cover the heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. Today, the fact that the new school year is coming, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children educational fees. The family only target and dreams is to see those achieving higher positions

loans.use: to pay her children educational fees
